Florence is 33 years old and married to Stephen, a businessman. They are blessed with one child. Florence has been selling secondhand clothes for the past three years, earning a monthly income of 10,000 KES which she uses to help support her family.

After being introduced by a staff member to KADET LTD, Florence is applying for her first loan: 30,000 KES. She will use the loan to buy more clothes to sell.

With the anticipated profit from her business, Florence will educate her child. Her ambition is to open a boutique.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Emily Martha

texts.en:
Emily is 52 years old.  She is a business lady, and is married to Douglas, a businessman. They are blessed with three children, aged 21, 16 and 12 years, respectively. She has been a tailor for the past ten years, with the monthly income if KES 9,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. Emily will use the loan to buy clothing materials for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials for her business

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice lives in Yei. She sells fish, and has been in business for four years. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children.  Two of them are still in school. 

Joice heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Yei. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for two years. She is 40 years old, married, and has four children who are still in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Dino

texts.es:
Dino de 27 años. Convive con Elvira con quien tiene una hija: Micaela, de 9 meses de nacida. Esta joven familia vive en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Yavirironi, distrito de Río Negro – Satipo.
Dino nació en esta comunidad, creció rodeado de personas que se dedican a la agricultura, por eso aprendió esta labor con facilidad. Ahora cuenta con 2 parcelas de terrenos propios en los que cultiva café y plátanos. 
Cuando dispone tiempo, los fines de semana trabaja como jornalero en otras parcelas. Dino es un hombre constante y trabajador por naturaleza.  Hace un año empezó a cosechar el café, obteniendo 6 sacos; para este año confía que su producción será mayor. Por otra parte, su platanal cada 15 días le otorgan como 300 kilos, los que vende a 50 céntimos. 
Dino se siente libre laborando en sus cultivos, por eso continuará invirtiendo en esta actividad. Ahora espera paciente 3 años para que su reciente sembrío de cacao produzca los primeros frutos. Dino recibiría su primer crédito de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Inkani”, se siente contento de tener como compañeros a personas responsables como él.
De obtener el dinero, Dino podrá comprar herramientas de cultivo como: machetes y limas, para la limpieza de sus parcelas.
texts.en:
Dino is 27, and lives with his partner Elvira, with whom he has one daughter, nine-month old Michaela. This young family lives in their own house in the indigenous community of Yavirironi, in Rio Negro district, Satipo province.   

Dino was born in this community, and grew up surrounded by people who work in agriculture. That's why he learned this work easily. Now he has two parcels of his own land, where he grows coffee and plantains. 

When he has time available, he works weekends as a day laborer on other parcels. Dino is persevering and a worker by nature. He began to harvest coffee a year ago, obtaining six sacks. This year, he is confident that his production will be greater.  Moreover, his plantain trees yield around 300 kilos every two weeks, which he sells for 30 centimos a kilo. 

Dino feels free working on his crops, and that's why he will keep investing in this business. Now he is waiting patiently for three years for his recently planted cacao to produce its first harvest. 

Dino would receive his first loan from MFP, so he promises to pay his monthly installments on time.

He belongs to the "Inkani” communal bank, and feels happy to have as co-members, people who are responsible; just as he is.  When he gets the money, Dino will be able to buy farming tools such as machetes and files for clearing his parcels.

loans.use: To buy tools such as machetes and files.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 37-year-old married man with three children.  He owns a tailoring shop in Nandi Hills which has been in operation for a period of 12 years, earning him a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

George is servicing his first loan of KES 15,000 that he borrowed from KADET LTD.  He intends to purchase some clothing materials and sewing threads for his business.  His dream is to prosper in business and be self-sustainable.

loans.use: buy clothing materials and sewing threads

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda lives in Yei. She sells charcoal and has been in business for four years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children -- two of them are still in school. 

Roda heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 600 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Harun Gachoki

texts.en:
Harun is a 65-year-old a business man.  He is married to Millicent, a business lady. They are blessed with six adult children. 

Harun has been running a retail shop for the past 21 years,  earning a monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family.  

Harun is applying for his fifth loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully.  He will use the loan to add more stocks of sugar and rice for sale in his shop.   With the anticipated profit from the business, he will buy stocks for his wife’s business. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: buy sugar and rice

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 36 years old, married to Judith and has two children. He operates a metal and blacksmith business in Nakuru where he makes and sells metal boxes and other items out of metal.

Alfred was introduced to KADET LTD by one of its existing clients. He plans to use his loan of 20,000 KES to buy more metal to make stove stands and other items.

Alfred’s ambition is to grow his business and build rental houses, thereby improving his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more metal for his business.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is thirty years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are in school. She lives in Yei where she has sold fish for the past year.

Charity heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This will be her first loan from BRAC: 500 SDG to buy fish to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a single lady, aged 29 years, who is supporting her three children, aged eleven, eight and six years old.  She owns a tailoring shop and has been in operation for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of KES. 6,000.

Carolyng is asking for her 2nd loan of KES.25,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to pay school fees for her child, who is in primary boarding school. 


The profits she obtains from her business will be used to pay the loan and to plow back into the business. Her dream is to see her children excel in life.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a single lady, aged 28 years, and her children are aged seven, and four years old.  She owns a shoe stall in Nandi Hills Trading Centre and has been in operation for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of KES. 6,000.

She is requesting her first loan of KES.15,000 from KADET LTD, with which she intends to purchase plastic shoes for resale.  

The profits will be invested back into the business and will help her family upkeep.  She hopes to prosper in business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase plastic shoes for resale

loans.name: Lariza

texts.en:
Lariza, 31, is married to Arnel, has two school-aged-children and is a very responsible and diligent person. She has been raising hogs for the past year.

So as to earn additional income, Lariza is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy more piglets and feed to boost her business. Her ambition is to grow it so that she can take care of her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and feed.

loans.name: Roth's Group

texts.en:
Roth is a 44-year-old mother of four children, some of whom are working for others for pay while some are still in school.  To overcome the family's hardship, she and her husband have been farming and working for others for pay for about six years. 

Roth decided to take her first loan with VisionFund in 2010.  With effort, she successfully managed to repay the entire loan.  The loan helped her to manage the cash flow of her rice farming business.  Therefore, she is confident about taking a new loan with VisionFund and is acting as the leader for this group loan.  The loan is in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR.  She will use her loan to lease another plot of farmland to expand her rice paddy farm.  

She hopes to improve her lifestyle and keep her children in school until the tertiary level.

loans.use: to lease another plot of farmland to expand her rice paddy farm.

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia is 57 years of age and single. For the past year Remegia has patiently run a fish vending business from which she earns about 1,500 PHP a month. She uses her income to meet her daily needs and care for her niece and nephews who stay at her house during weekdays.

It's now harvest time when money is more plentiful and it is easier for Remegia to sell her fish. Her present income, however, is not enough to take advantage of this time, so she is requesting a 10,000 loan from ASKI to buy more milk fish and tilapia to sell. She hopes to obtain this loan so she can improve her business, enabling her to increase her profits and so take care of her daily needs and save some more for emergency purposes.

Remegia is grateful, because since she start borrowing additional capital she has been able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more milk fish and tilapia to sell.

loans.name: Rowena Colcol

texts.en:
To overcome the hardships of life, Rowena and her husband aimed to improve their rice farming business by increasing their yields and income in order to meet their family needs and educate their two children.  They have been farming for more than 23 years and usually earn a profit of 24,000 PHP each harvest season.  They use this profit to provide food, clothing and allowances for their children. 

They planned to expand their rice plantation to increase their yields; but, due to insufficient capital, Rowena is asking for a loan of 32,000 PHP in order to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay the labor cost incurred in planting rice.  She believes that through patience and hard work, they will make an improvement in their business and increase their yields this coming harvest season.  

They hope that someday, they will become financially stable and that their children will have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay the labor cost incurred in planting rice.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 45 years old, has five children and is married to a tricycle driver named Renato. Renato patiently provides motorcycle transport to the people in the village where they live. The couple usually earns a minimum daily net profit of about PHP 300. 

Marlyn would like to improve the transport services offered by her spouse, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tires and side mirrors to use on the motorcycle.  In the future, she would like to earn consistent profits from the business and keep ensuring the safety of their passengers.

loans.use: buy motorcycle tires and side mirrors

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester has been selling fruits and vegetables to the people in her village for over six years now. She has been doing it to provide sustenance for her family. She is 47 years old, has seven children and is a widow.

Ester would like to increase her sales, so she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy cabbages, tomatoes and eggplants to sell.  In the future, she hopes to keep improving her sales and expanding her business for the overall welfare of the family.

loans.use: buy cabbages, tomatoes and eggplants

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 37 years old, married and had two children attending school. She established a fruit and vegetable selling business to add to her spouse's income, which is derived from a farming business. She would like to increase her sales so that her profit will gradually increase too. 

Flordeliza is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy eggplants, tomatoes, potatoes and bananas to sell.  Someday, with patience and hard work, the family will live progressively.

loans.use: buy eggplants, tomatoes, potatoes and bananas

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn raises hogs to fatten and breed and sell to butchers. She has been doing it in order to supplement her spouse's  income, derived from a farming business. She usually earns about PHP 2,000 for each hog she is able to sell. Her proceeds go for meals and allowances for her two children, who are currently attending school.

Jenelyn is now asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy additional hogs to raise, as well as fertilizer and medicine. Jenelyn would like to ensure the proper growth of her hogs to be able to sell them at a higher price upon maturity.

loans.use: buy hogs, fertilizer and medicine

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene, 45 years old, is married to Benjamin and is from the village of San Vicente in Isabela Province. Irene is a very loving person, especially when it comes to her family. She does everything possible to meet their needs.

To this end Irene is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins for the hogs she raises and sells. Irene’s ambition is to grow her business so that she can improve the quality of life she so desires for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli is 54 years old and happily married to Rufino who is both a farmer and a tricycle driver.  The couple was blessed with six children.  Of her six children, two are already married and have their own families, one is working and three are currently studying. 

Arceli runs her small bakery within the village where she lives.  She has been involved in this business for three years and earns about 4,000 PHP each month.  According to her, the profit she has generated from her bakery was utilized to meet the daily needs of her family and to pay the allowances of her children who attend school.  So, the income intended for her business is no longer sufficient.  For this reason, Arceli is requesting a loan in the amount of 6,000 PHP in order to buy more flour and other ingredients to make pandesal (a rounded bread) for her food sales business.  

She knows that through her patience and sacrifice, she can achieve success that allows her to provide for her family and enables her children to achieve a high level of education.

loans.use: to buy more flour and other ingredients to make pandesal (a rounded bread)

loans.name: Marieta Gapuz

texts.en:
Marieta is 46 years old.  She is married and was blessed with six children.  She and her husband are raising their family in a village.  They plant and harvest rice and vegetables which they sell.  They aim to become financially stable so that they will be able to educate their children and give them a better life.  They agreed to expand their rice plantation to ensure high production. 

Due to financial constraints, Marieta is asking for a loan in the amount of 28,000 PHP in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay the labor cost incurred in transplanting rice.  They believe that this loan will enable them to work out their plans and hope that they will have a fruitful harvest this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay the labor cost incurred in transplanting rice.

loans.name: Genereuse

texts.en:
Genereuse is 48 years old and was married but is now a widow.  She has two children aged between 13 and 21 years old.  She owns a local drinks business and her business is well-organized.  She currently employs three people to help her and she has 3 years of experience. 

Genereuse has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more bananas to make local drinks for sale. She plans to use any profit generated from this loan to satisfy her family's basic needs, to pay her children's school fees, and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: buy bananas to make juice

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is 28 years old, married, and has 2 children aged 2 and 4 years old. He sells various goods such as lotions, soap, toothpaste, biscuits, etc. This is his 2nd year in this business. 

Alphonse has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as lotions, soap, toothpaste, biscuits, etc. to sell.  With the profits from the loan, he will be able to save for his future, pay medical insurance and he will be able to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: buy various goods to sell

loans.name: Daisylene Macato

texts.en:
"To be successful in life" is a goal of every individual like Daisylene.  She is a 32-year-old mother who is blessed with three school-age children.  She is married to a farmer and they live happily in a village, planting and harvesting rice and vegetables to sell.  Despite financial constraints, they have the determination to improve their standard of living and give their children a bright future. 

They aim to improve their vegetable production in order to increase their yields, but due to insufficient capital, Daisylene is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in vegetable production.  She hopes that they will improve their farming business and have a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in vegetable production.

location.town: Brgy. Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Suraiya Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya Bibi is a 49-year-old seamstress and widow; her husband died unexpectedly. She is the mother of seven children, three daughters and four sons. Three of her sons sell clothes while the fourth works in a garage.

All of Suraiya’s daughters are seamstresses. In the past they helped Suraiya complete her orders; now they have gone into this work professionally. In this way they all do sewing work and financially support the family from their earnings.

After losing her husband, Suraiya worked resolutely, knowing that her children’s care was her responsibility now. She is a very brave lady who stands strong in the face of any crisis. Her children are very much attached to her because they know how she alone has born all the responsibilities inherent in raising a family.

Suraiya’s group has requested a 95,000 PKR loan from Kiva’s partner Asasah. Suraiya plans to use her portion of the loan to invest in one of her son’s business. With this money he will buy a variety of clothes in bulk to sell. Suraiya is very confident in the positive financial outcome of her son’s business after her investment.

loans.use: to invest in her son’s clothing business.

loans.name: Fatoulaye

texts.fr: Madame Fatoulaye  est âgée  de 54 ans et vit au Sénégal. Elle a déjà remboursé 2 crédits antérieurs dans le  guichet de l’U-IMCEC de sa localité ou elle est membre. Son activité consiste   à acheter du  poisson pour le revendre. Elle l’a choisi par nécessité et dans le but de diversifier ses sources de  revenus. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de poissons qu’elle va revendre sur le marché. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices pourra l’aider à s’assurer un niveau de vie meilleur.
texts.en:
Fatoulaye is 54 years old and lives in Senegal. She has already paid back two previous loans at the local branch of UIMCEC where she is a member. 

Fatoulaye buys fish for resale, and she chose this business activity in order to diversify her income sources. She is requesting a loan of 200 000 francs to buy fish to resell at the market. A higher income will increase her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fish to resell

loans.name: Merly

texts.es:
Merly, de 42 años, vive en su propia casa junto a su cónyuge  y sus 04 estimados hijos,  a quienes dedica  todos sus esfuerzos. Merly, gracias a todos sus energías, hoy tiene su negocio de  abarrotes, donde le va de la mejor manera, además sus ventas vienen mejorando con respecto a los anteriores, a pesar de ello trata de mejorar su tienda de aglomeres con la necesidad de que pueda atraer clientes. Merly, trabaja por cuenta propia en su establecimiento de ventas en su localidad un pueblo donde no hay mucha competencia con los negocios. Su plan a futuro es agrandar su negocio de abarrotes y de esa forma  incrementar en su tienda  y surtir sus productos. Este será su crédito número 05 con MFP; por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además esta conforme con su banco comunal, ya que todos son solidarios.
Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará mercadería con el propósito de que pueda abastecer su negocio de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Merly is 42 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and 4 dear children, for whom she expends all her efforts. Merly, thanks to her high energy, now has a grocery business that she manages well. Her sales have been higher than in the past. Still, she is trying to improve the store so she can attract more customers. Merly works on her own in her store, which is in a section of town where there is little business competition. 

Her plan is to grow her grocery business by expanding the store and stocking more products. This will be her 5th loan cycle with MFP. She promises to continue making her payments on schedule and complying with her communal bank, as the members stand together. With the 1,500 nuevos soles, she will buy merchandise to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Ynaydina

texts.es:
Ynaydina, de 20 años de edad, convive con Fredy de 25 años de edad; viven en casa propia que sus padres le cedieron, junto a su hijo, Ángelo de 02 años; a quien brindan lo mejor y desean un buen futuro. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas. Ella siembra plantas de cacao y café, productos un a vez cosechados los lleva a vender hasta su localidad, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse y ayudar con los gastos familiares, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, ya que se siente muy feliz haciéndolo. Lleva 06  años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, en su faena rutinaria cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su pareja quien es su brazo derecho. Ynaydina solicita el crédito para comprar una movilidad y así poder movilizarse a su centro de trabajo. Este será su crédito número 02 con MFP; se siente alegre por la colaboración de los financistas ya que así podrá seguir con sus planes de trabajo. En su banco comunal agradece a sus compañeros por permitirles trabajar con ellos.
Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, más sus ahorros acumulados de su trabajo comprará una moto para que pueda movilizarse con mucha facilidad a sus parcelas.
texts.en:
Ynaydina, 20 years old, lives with Fredy who is 25 years old. They live in their own house that her parents gave her, together with her son, Angelo who is 2 years old. They give him their best and they hope he has a good future. 

With much effort Ynaydina successfully works her land and they are very productive. She grows cocoa and coffee plants. Once she harvests the crops she sells them from her locality, selling them at wholesale prices. Her crops provide the necessary income in order to maintain and help with the family expenses, which is why she wants to put everything into getting ahead in the business. 

What she likes most about her work is taking care of the crops, and she is very happy doing it. She has has been doing this activity for 6 years. What is the most difficult is transporting the crops. In her daily chores she has the unconditional support of her partner who is her right arm. 

Ynaydina is asking for a loan in order to buy a vehicle to use in her work. This will be her second loan through MFP. She feels happy for the assistance of the financial funders as she can continue with her work plans. She gives thanks to the communal bank partners for letting her work with them.

With the 1,500 soles, plus savings accumulated from her work, she will buy a motorcycle so she can move easily between the fields.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Eldy Mamagali

texts.es:
Eldy es mamá de 2 niños pequeños, se dedica a la comercialización de prendas de vestir, en la feria principal del Alto , 2 veces por semana, asimismo los días miércoles y sábado viaja a Oruro para poder proveerse de  mercadería que vende los días jueves y domingo.  Lleva con esta actividad más de 5 años,    en dicho tiempo logro  incrementar su cartera de clientes quienes la buscan y la conocen por la simpatía que la caracteriza, asimismo por la exclusividad de prendas que vende. Actualmente vive en la casa de su madre en la ciudad de La Paz  quien le colabora con el cuidado de los niños mientras ella sale a la feria, para vender las prendas de vestir que comercializa, y también cuando viaja a la ciudad de  Oruro, los otros días que no va a la feria ni va de viaje, ella se ocupa de cocinar en su casa, para toda la familia, haciendo una olla común. El destino del crédito es para capital de operación, para la compra de prendas de vestir, con lo cual incrementara su  mercadería y de esa manera  diversificara más  las  prendas para  vender.
Entre sus sueños y metas es ampliar cada vez mas su negocio y que sus dos hijos puedan estudiar una carrera profesional  para que puedan tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Eldy is the mother of two small children.  She works selling articles of clothing in the main market of El Alto twice a week.  She also travels to Oruro on Wednesdays and Saturdays to be able to supply herself with the merchandise she sells on Thursdays and Sundays.  She has been doing this work for more than five years, during which time she managed to increase her portfolio of customers who look for her and know her because of the friendliness she is known for as well as for the exclusivity of the articles she sells.

Currently she lives in her mother's house in the city of La Paz.  Her mother helps her care for the children while she goes to market to sell the articles of clothing she sells, and also when she travels to the city of Oruro.  The other days, when she neither goes to market nor travels, she takes care of the cooking at home, making a common meal for the entire family.

The purpose of the loan is for operating capital to purchase garmets for sale, with which she will increase her merchandise and in this way have more variety in the items to sell.

Among her dreams and goals is expanding her business more and more and for her two children to be able to study a professional program so they can have a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase garmets for resale

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es: La señora Eliana tiene 27 años, estudió hasta el nivel primario es madre soltera de un hijo de 7 años que está cursando el nivel primario en una escuela fiscal de la zona donde radica, vive en zona de la Maica sud, hace aproximadamente tres años ella vivía en la casa de su mamá pero decidió independizarse construyendo cuartos para ella y su hijo en el terreno aledaño al de su madre. Su principal actividad es la producción de leche cruda para su posterior elaboración y venta quesillos a las comerciantes  de la zona.  Necesita capital de inversión para arrendar pasto (forraje) para su  ganado lechero es una oportunidad que no puede desaprovechar, esto le ayudará en la mejor alimentación de su ganado y de esa manera incrementara la producción de la leche y aumentara  sus ingresos lo cual le ayudara para  terminar de construir su pequeña casa  y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su hijo.
texts.en: Eliana is 27 years old and has an elementary school education.  She is the single mother of a 7 year-old child who is studying in a public elementary school in the area where she lives.  She lives in the south Maica neighborhood.  About 3 years ago she was living in her mother's house, but she decided to become independent by building some rooms for herself and her child on land adjacent to her mother's property.  Eliana has a business producing crude milk that she later uses to make and sell cheese to the merchants in the area.  She needs some investment capital to rent pasture land for her dairy cows.  This is an opportunity that she can't turn down, because it will help her to provide better feed for her cows, and in this way increase her milk production and income.  This will help her to finish the construction on her small house and improve the living conditions for herself and her child.

loans.use: to rent pasture land for her dairy cows

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 53 años, es una mujer divorciada. Vive con 3 de sus 7 hijos, en una casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Villa Visca, distrito de Huasahuasi – Tarma. María se dedica a la agricultura. En sus 30 años como mujer del campo aprendió a producir con efectividad papas, maíz y arvejas. Sus parcelas de terrenos se ubican en distintas partes de su localidad, por ello debe levantarse muy temprano para aprovechar los primeros rayos solares. También se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de papa y verduras, para esto adquiere toda su mercadería en el mercado mayorista de Tarma y de sus cosechas. María viaja cada 8 días hacia la ciudad de Chanchamayo llevando sus productos, vendiendo en el mercado de su ciudad. “En Chanchamayo los precios son buenos, como es selva, no crecen verduras, por eso siempre se gana”, comenta.  María invierte la mayor parte de sus ingresos en la educación y alimentación de sus hijos. Por eso continuará trabajando para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Una de sus metas es llevar sus productos hacia la ciudad de Lima,  ya que los precios son más favorables. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Visca”, y este sería su crédito número 8 con MFP. Se siente contenta de formar parte de un grupo sólido y emprendedor. Le agrada el sistema de trabajo de su banco comunal. María destinará el dinero del préstamo en la compra de bolsas de abonos orgánicos para fertilizar sus cultivos de papas.
texts.en:
María, 53, is a divorced woman.  She lives with three of her seven children in a house of her own located in the Villa Visca settlement in Huasahuasi-Tarma District.  María is a farmer.  In her 30 years as a woman of the fields she learned how to efficiently produce potatoes, corn and peas.  Her parcels of land are found in different parts of her locality so she must rise very early to take advantage of the day’s first sunlight.  She also is a potato and vegetable merchant and for this she acquires all her merchandise at the Tarma wholesale marked and from her own harvests.

María goes to the city of Chanchamayo every 8 days with her products and sells them in a market there.  “In Chanchamayo prices are good because since it’s jungle, they don’t grow vegetables so one always comes out ahead,” she comments.  María invests most of her income in her children’s education and food.  Because of this she will continue working to provide them with a better quality of life.  One of her goals is to take her products to the city of Lima because prices there are more favorable.

She belongs to the “Villa Visca” communal bank and this is her 8th loan with MFP.  She feels happy to be part of this solid, enterprising group.  She likes the communal bank’s system of work.  María will use the money from the loan to buy sacks of organic manure to fertilize her potato crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Raquel Egipto

texts.en:
Raquel is 39 years old and married to Ricardo. They have no children yet but are hoping to have one soon.

Raquel and Ricardo own a one-hectare plot of land on which they plant and cultivate rice. They have been farming for over two years now and usually earn about 38,000 PHP twice a year. It is their only source of income.

Raquel would like to improve their farm so as to earn more from it. She would like to ensure that Ricardo and she have healthier rice crops but have insufficient funds now to do so. Therefore she is asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides.

Someday, with consistent effort, determination and patience, Raquel and Ricardo will achieve economic stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 35 years old, married and has one child. For the past four years she has run a dairy. She feels her operation is a good one because there is limited competition in the area.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Veronica has been able to improve her dairy. She is now applying for a 30,000 KES loan to buy another dairy cow. Her ambition is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
Albina tiene 41 años, convive con Rolando, con quien tiene 3 hijos, pero solo viven con uno de ellos: Fiorella de 8 años. Todos ellos habitan una casa propia ubicada en el anexo de Yaroca, distrito de Palca – Tarma. Albina se dedica a la agricultura, desde que era niña. Siembra flores de gladiolos, papa, arvejas y hortalizas, de esa manera obtuvo una estabilidad económica adecuada, ya que sus hijos mayores estudian en la ciudad de Lima, para ello Albina debe enviarles un dinero mensual para sus gastos. Ella tiene más de 7 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, en las que constantemente siembra variando sus productos. 
“Lo que más me conviene sembrar son gladiolos, su precio se mantiene y no se gasta mucho en abonos”, dice.
Por su parte, Rolando cuenta con un carro propio con e que realiza servicios de transporte desde la ciudad de Tarma hasta el anexo de Yaroca. Esta actividad también es rentable. Con ambas actividades logran brindar a sus hijos una mejor educación y calidad de vida. Albina se siente contenta. Éste sería su crédito número 4 con MFP, por eso se responsabiliza de pagar con puntualidad las cuotas. Además menciona su satisfacción de pertenecer a un grupo de trabajo sólido y confiable. De recibir el dinero podrá adquirir 10 bolsas de abonos para fertilizar sus 7 terrenos de arvejas, papas y hortalizas.
texts.en:
Albina is 41 year old. She is married to Rolando, with whom she has 3 children. Only one of their children lives with them, Fiorella who is 8 years old. They live in a home that they own, located in Yaroca, in the district of Palca-Tarma. Albina makes a living farming, which she learned to do at a young age. She plants gladiolas, potatoes, peas and other vegetables. As a result of her farming, she has an adequate income. Her older children are studying in Lima, so Albina sends them money on a monthly basis for their expenses. She has more then 7 hectares of agricultural land, which she is constantly planting on and varying her crops. 

"The most convenient thing to plant is gladiolas, their price stays constant and you don't have to use a lot of fertilizer," she said.

Rolando has his own car, which he uses to provide transportation services. His route goes from the city of Tarma to the annex of Yaroca. This is also a profitable business. Combining both of their economic activities they have succeeded in providing for their children a better education and a better quality of life. Albina is happy. 

This will be her 4th loan through MFP; she takes the responsibility of making her payments on time. She also mentioned the satisfaction she receives from being a member of a hard working and dependable communal bank. With this money she will be able to buy 10 bags of fertilizer to use on the land where she has planted peas, potatoes and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy ten bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 47, es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Gerardo su esposo. Ambos tienen 6 hijos a los que cuidan con mucho amor y cariño. Construyeron su casita en la localidad de Paltarumi.  Ella es una mujer muy ágil, sobre todo porque siempre, camina varios kilómetros para poder ordeñar sus vacas, quienes se encuentran en un establo a las afueras de su localidad. Todo el día ella se dedica sus cuidados, pues siempre le brindan un promedio de 10 litros de leche con lo que realiza, moldes de queso que la ayuda a conseguir ingreso económico diario. Además aprovecha ese tiempo para poder cuidar de sus sembríos de papa, maíz y demás hortalizas, las cuales cosecha con mucha satisfacción y las comercializa en el mismo lugar. “los mismo comerciantes llegan con sus camiones”, afirma. Se siente tranquila y tiene muchos planes de mejorar su calidad de vida, pues su esposo trabaja en una empresa de construcción de carreteras, donde está obteniendo buenos ingresos. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “La rosa de paltarumi” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde se siente muy satisfecha de poder, desarrollar sus actividades con normalidad, pues tiene el apoyo de todos ustedes. Además promete cargar todas sus cuotas de manera puntual, ya que siempre fue una persona trabajadora y honrada. Julia, de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos de papa.
texts.en: Julia, 47, is a hard-working owman. She lives in the company of Gerardo, her husband. Both have six children for whom they care with much love and affection. They built their little house in their town of Paltarumi. She is a very agile woman, above all because she always walks various kilometers to be able to milk her cos who are found in a stable in the outskirts of town. She dedicates all day to her cows because they always provide an average of 10 liters of milk with which she makes cheese which helps her to earn her daily economic income. Additionally, she takes advantage of this weather to be able to care for her crops of potato, maize, and other plants which she farms with a lot of satisfaction and sells in the same place. "The same traders come with their trucks, " she affirms. She feels relaxed and has many plans to improve her quality of life since her husband works in a road construction company where he is obtaining good income. She belongs to a joint group, "La rosa de paltarumi" and this is her fourth loan with MFP where she feels very satisfied to be able to develop her activities normally since she has the support of all of you. Additionally, she promises to make all of her payments in a punctual manner since she has always been a hard working and honorable person. Julia, upon receiving your support, will invest the money requested in the purchase of various bags of natural fertilizers to spread among her potato crops.

loans.use: to buy various bags of natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 47 años, es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Marcelino, con quien tiene 6 hijos, a los que sacan adelante en la localidad de Paltarumi, donde construyeron su casita propia. Desde las primeras horas del día, se dirige a sus sembríos, pues ya no tiene el apoyo de su esposo, quien la ayudaba constantemente. Cuenta que hace poco, comenzó a trabajar en una empresa constructora de carreteras, donde recibe un sueldo mensual que ayuda en los gastos del hogar. Por eso tomo las riendas de la agricultura, ella misma. Cuida mucho de sus sembríos de maíz, papa y demás hortalizas. Además de las vacas que posee cuenta con 6, las que siempre le otorgar muchos litros de leche que comercializa a los productores de queso que la visitan todas las tardes. Ahora, Julia, espera poder aumentar su ganado, ya que recibe ganancias diarias de sus animales, “la agricultura, es por temporadas”, afirma. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “La rosa de paltarumi” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde se siente muy satisfecha de poder, desarrollar sus actividades con normalidad, pues tiene el apoyo de todos ustedes. Además promete cargar todas sus cuotas de manera puntual, ya que siempre fue una persona trabajadora y honrada. Julia de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos de papa de la variedad “yungay”.
texts.en:
Julia is a hard-working 47-year-old woman. She lives with Marcelino and their 6 children that they are advancing in the locality of Paltarumi, where they constructed their own little house. From the earliest hours of the morning, Julia heads for her fields. She no longer has the help of her husband who used to assist her constantly. Julia reports that a short time ago, he began to work for a highway construction company where he receives a monthly salary, which helps with household costs. 

That's why Julia herself took the reigns of the farm. She takes good care of her plantings of corn, potatoes, and other vegetables. Then there are also 6 cows who always provide many liters of milk, to be sold to cheese makers who visit every afternoon. Now, Julia hopes to be able to increase her herd of cattle, since she receives earning daily from her animals. “Agriculture is seasonal,” she affirms.

Julia belongs to “La Rosa de Paltarumi” solidarity group and this is their 4th loan through MFP. She is very satisfied to be a member, developing her activities normally, with everyone's support.
    
Julia promises to make all her payments punctually; she always was a hard-working and honorable person. Upon receiving this loan, Julia will purchase natural fertilizers to spread among her potato plantings of the “Yungay” variety.

loans.use: buy natural fertilizers for her potato fields.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío de 28 años, es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de sus padres y hermanos en su casa propia, ubicada  en la localidad de Hualahoyo. Ella es una mujer sencilla, a pesar de haber culminado sus estudios de enfermería en una reconocida universidad estatal de la ciudad, continua con la siembra y cuidado de animales, como sus padres, “no descuido mi profesión, se puede desarrollar las 2 cosas” afirma. Por ello en las temporadas agrícolas, siembra maíz y papa. Las que son cuidadas por parte de sus padres a los que quiere mucho. Ahora comenzará con el esparcimiento de fertilizantes, para poder cosechar un buen maíz y así vender en la temporada de festividades que se aproximan en el país. Ahora ella desea mejorar sus ingresos económicos, para poder especializarse y continuar con sus estudios, pues quiere llegar a lo más lejos que pueda en su carrera. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, y se siente feliz, pues encontró la ayuda que tanto necesitaba, para emprender sus objetivos. Además es responsable en todas sus labores, por ello promete ser puntual en los pagos. Rocío de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos de maíz, que muy pronto cosechará.
texts.en:
Rocío, 28, is a hardworking woman.  She lives with her parents and siblings in their own house located in Hualahoyo.  She is an unassuming woman who despite having completed nursing in a recognized university in the city continues farming and raising animals like her parents do.  “I don’t neglect my profession; one can do two things at once,” she affirms.  

Because of this, during farming season she plants corn and potatoes which are cared for by her parents who she loves very much.  She will now start to spread fertilizer to harvest good corn to sell during the festival season that’s approaching in the country.  She wants to improve her income to specialize and continue with her studies because she’d like to go as far as possible in her profession.

This is her second MFP loan and she feels happy because she found the help she so needed to start toward her goals.  Besides, she’s responsible with all her tasks so promises to be punctual with the payments.  If Rocío were to receive your help, she will invest the requested money in the purchase of several sacks of natural fertilizer to spread among her corn crops which will be harvested very soon.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es: Demetrio, de 40 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de Bertha, su esposa. Ambos tienen 4 hijos a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Colcabamba. Todas las mañanas, este hombre responsable, se dirige a sus terrenos agrícolas; donde cuida desde hace varios años de sus sembríos de papa, maíz y habas. Los cuales fertiliza y limpia constantemente. Gusta de sembrar la tierra sobre todo en épocas de mucha lluvia, “Ahí no tengo que preocuparme de regar las plantas con agua, para que crezcan”, afirma. Pues le molesta, cuando se pierden cosechas enteras por escasez de lluvia. Como es consiente que no siempre obtendrá dinero con la agricultura. Por ello, también se dedica a la crianza de animales, entre ovejas, cerdos y animales de carga. Su trabajo consiste en engordarlos para después vender su carne a un mayor precio de esta manera, asegura un ingreso de dinero constante. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Maraypampa”, este es el primer crédito con MFP, y se siente feliz, pues encontró la ayuda que tanto necesitaba, para emprender sus objetivos. Además es responsable en todas sus labores, por ello promete ser puntual en los pagos. Demetrio de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos entre sus cultivos de maíz.
texts.en:
Demetrio, 40, is a hardworking man.  He lives with Bertha, his wife.  They have four children he cares for in his own house located in Colcabamba.  Every morning this responsible man heads out to his agricultural fields where he’s farmed potatoes, corn and broad beans for many years.  He fertilizes and weeds them constantly.  He likes planting the soil, especially during seasons of abundant rain.  “I don’t have to worry about watering the plants so that they will grow,” he affirms, because it does bother him when crops are lost due to scarce rain.

Conscious that he won’t always earn money farming, he also raises animals like sheep, pigs and beasts of burden.  His work consists in fattening them up to then sell their meat at a higher price thus insuring a constant flow of money.

He belongs to the “Maraypampa” communal bank and this is his first MFP loan.  He feels happy because he found the help he so needed to start toward his objectives.  He is responsible in everything he does so he promises to be punctual with the payments.  If Demetrio were to receive your support, he will invest the requested money in the purchase of natural fertilizers to spread among his corn crops.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila, de 32 años es una mujer luchadora. Vive en compañía de German, su esposo. Ambos tienen  2 hijos a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Santa Matara. Como siempre esta exitosa mujer, se dirige desde las primera horas a sus terrenos agrícolas donde siembra, toda variedad de hortalizas y verduras, además de papa. Cuenta con muchos años de experiencia en la agricultura, de la que obtiene el sustento económico de su familia. Gusta mucho de limpiar sus terrenos y prevenir de las plagas que siempre azotan el lugar. Además aprovecha su tiempo para poder cuidar a sus animales, los cuales lleva a la altura para que puedan alimentarse de los pastos verdes y naturales. Cuenta con varias cabezas de ganando ovino.  Cuenta que los engorda para después llevarlos a vender a más precio en un mercado reconocido de la zona. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Maraypampa”, este es el segundo crédito con MFP, y se siente feliz, pues encontró la ayuda que tanto necesitaba, para emprender sus objetivos. Además es responsable en todas sus labores, por ello promete ser puntual en los pagos. Teofila, de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos de papa y maíz.
texts.en:
Teófila, 32, is a tenacious woman.  She lives with her husband, Germán.  They have two children together that they care for in their own house located in Santa Matara.   As always, this successful woman heads out to her fields at first light where she plants a variety of greens and vegetables as well as potatoes.  She has many years of experience in farming from which she obtains economic sustenance for her family.  She very much enjoys clearing her fields and keeping them safe from infestations that are a scourge there.  She also takes advantage of her time to care for her animals which she takes uphill to pasture so that they can feed on green, natural grasses.  She has several head of sheep.  She relates that she fattens them up to then take to sell at higher prices in a well-known market in the zone.

She belongs to the “Maraypampa” communal bank and this is her second MFP loan.  She feels happy because she found the help she so needed to start toward her objectives.  She is responsible in everything she does so promises to be punctual with her payments.  If Teófila were to receive your support, she will use the requested money to buy natural fertilizer to spread among her corn and potato crops.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Copaboka 4 Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur Vénuste, membre du groupe COPABOKA 4 est âgé de 44 ans. Il a 5 enfants dont le plus âgé a 16 ans et le moins âgé a 4 ans. Trois de ses enfants vont à l'école et n'a aucune autre personne en charge. Le niveau d'éducation de Monsieur Vénuste est 6 ans de l'école primaire.

Il est devenu le client d'ACB en 2012 et le cycle actuel est le premier. Etant l'agriculteur du riz, le crédit lui octroyé lui permit d'acheter les angrais chimiques et a utilisé le reste au payement de la main d'oeuvre des gens qui ont cultivé son champs.  Il n'anticipe aucune difficulté pouvant faire que ce crédit soit mal remboursé ou ne soit pas remboursé. Pour accroître son agriculture, il prévoit demander d'autres crédits et ceci lui permettra d'être le meilleur dans ce business. Avec le profit, il va développer sa famille.
texts.en:
Vénuste is a member of the Copaboka 4 group. He is 44 years old and has five children between the ages of 16 and four. Three of his children are in school, and he is their only provider. Vénuste completed six years of primary education.

Vénuste became an ACB customer in 2012 and this is his first loan cycle. He is a rice farmer, and the loan will allow him to buy chemical fertilizers and pay the farmhands that work in his fields. He does not anticipate any difficulty in repaying the loan. In order to expand his business, he hopes to obtain further loans in the future and this will help him become the best in his field. His profits will go towards supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay workers

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Mirian, de 23 años de edad, es una mujer decidida y emprendedora, que le gusta el trabajo y sabe que con esfuerzo se logra progresar. Es conviviente con Garber quien se dedica al transporte y es padre de su hijo de 10 meses de nacido por quien se esfuerzan en brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Juntos habitan cómodamente en su propia casa en compañía de sus suegros. La actividad que realiza Mirian es el servio de fotocopiadora, para eso cuentan con una maquina de fotocopiados, la cual está en su casa temporalmente, para luego llevarlo a un centro educativo ya que se reinician las labores escolares en todo el país, donde además venderá golosinas y útiles escolares. Se inicio hace más de 3 años, adquiriendo inicialmente una maquina pequeña que no le abastecía, cambiando a una de mayor capacidad con un préstamo de MFP. 
Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja y la facilidad para realizarlo.
Se decidió empezar su negocio, por los deseos de progresar con su pareja y con la llegada de su hijo tiene muchas ganas de brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.
Por tanto y  viendo lo buenos resultados desea en un futuro abrir en su casa un minimarker con variados productos a la venta. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por eso tiene el compromiso de cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas  para tener un buen record crediticio.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de útiles escolares para la venta y una nueva maquina fotocopiadora valorizada en 1000 nuevos soles, buscando ampliar y crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Mirian is 23 years old. She is a decisive and enterprising woman who likes to work and knows that with effort you can get ahead. She lives with Garber, who works in transportation and who is the father of her 10 month old son. They work hard to offer him a better quality of life. They live together comfortably in their own home with her parents in law. Mirian's activity is a photocopying service. She has a photocopier, which is in her house temporarily. Later she will take it to a school since classes are starting again throughout the whole country. She will also sell candies and school supplies there. She started doing this more than 3 years ago, initially acquiring a small copier that wasn't enough. She switched to one with more capacity with a loan from MFP.
 
She considers her business to be very profitable because the earnings it brings her and the ease she has doing it. She decided to start her business so she could get ahead with her spouse and when her son came along she really wanted to offer him a better quality of life. Because of this and seeing the good results, she hopes in the future to open a mini-market in her house with a variety of products to sell. 
 
This will be her 4th loan with the MFP institution. She hopes to have your cooperation to continue with her goals. That is why she is committed to making her payments in order to have a good credit history. With the 1500 nuevos soles she has asked for, she will invest in buying school supplies to sell and a new copier valued at 1000 nuevos soles. She seeks to expand her business and make it grow.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier and school supplies.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Baptiste is 27 years old and is single. He sells rice. This is his 5 years in this business and he currently employs 5 people to help him. 

Baptiste has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his agriculture business by cultivating more rice to sell. With the profits from the loan, he will be able to save for his future, pay medical insurance and buy a car to help him transport his goods to his clients.

loans.use: grow more rice

loans.name: Laylanie

texts.en: Laylanie, 35 years old, is from the village of San Vicente in the province of Isabela. Laylanie has been engaged in a hog raising business for two years. Laylanie is a very supportive woman to her family.  Laylanie is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy pig feed and additional piglets to raise. She hopes that all her dreams will come true.

loans.use: buy pig feed and piglets

loans.name: Copaboka 1 Group

texts.fr:
Madame Véronique, membre du groupé COPABOKA 1, âgé de 53 ans, cultivatrice du riz,  a 10 enfants dont le plus âgé a 30 ans et le moins âgé a 8 ans. 8 de ses enfants vont à l'école et n'a aucune autre personne en sa charge. Véronique a 3 ans de l'école familiale.

Elle est devenue cliente de l'ACB en 2011 est le cycle actuel est son premier. Le crédit qu'elle a bénéficié lui a été utile en achetant les angrais chimiques et en payant la main d'oeuvre des gens qui ont cultivé son champs. Sa stratégie pour accroître son agriculture est de demander dans le futur d'autre crédit, ceci lui permettra de devenir compétente dans ce secteur agricole. Avec le profit, elle va éduquer et faire soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Véronique is a member of the Copaboka 1 group and is a rice grower. She is 53 years old and has ten children aged between 30 and eight. Eight of her children are in school and she has no one else to provide for. Véronique herself attended infant school for 3 years. 

Véronique became an ACB customer in 2011 and this is her first loan cycle. The loan has been used to purchase chemical fertillizers and pay the farmhands who worked in her fields. Her strategy for expanding her business is to request another loan, which will allow her to establish herself in this sector. The profits will be used for the education and care of her children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay workers

loans.name: Juan Orlando Chalarca

texts.es:
Juan es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y siempre querer ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Juan se ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a la venta de legumbres, verduras y frutas, pues su padre se dedicaba a esta actividad y desde temprana edad le enseñó a trabajarla. Su punto de atención es en el andén de su casa, pues no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para poder ubicarse en un local o adecuar su vivienda como local para la venta de sus legumbres y frutas. La principal dificultad que presenta Juan es que su esposa constantemente se está realizando tratamientos, pues sufre de una enfermedad mental que cubre gran parte de los gastos de su hogar, por lo que Juan se esfuerza diariamente en su negocio con el ánimo de sacar su esposa adelante. Con el ánimo de surtir su negocio, Juan busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de legumbres y frutas con los cuales pueda ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes. 

Juan espera que de esta manera sus clientes encuentren en su negocio mayores necesidades satisfechas, y de esta manera sus ventas aumenten considerablemente. Además, Juan espera que con mayores ingresos su familia pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida. Juan sueña en el corto tiempo ubicarse dentro de su vivienda adecuándola lo necesarios para ubicar su legumbrería, y en un futuro sueña con tener una gran legumbrería y una gran carnicería con las que le pueda ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progreso.
texts.en:
Juan is a person who has always described himself as being very hard working and always wants to offer his family a better quality of life. Juan has spent much of his life selling pulses, fruit and vegetables because his father worked in this sector and taught him the ropes from an early age. Juan's point of sale in on the pavement of his house given that he doesn't have enough money to be located in a store or turn his home into a shop to sell his fruit and vegetables. 

The main difficulty which Juan faces is that his wife is constantly having treatment: she suffers from a mental illness, representing a large chunk of the household spending, which is why Juan works hard every day in his business with the hope of helping her get ahead. 

With the aim of stocking up his business, Juan seeks a loan which will give him the possibility of purchasing fruit and vegetables so that he can offer a greater variety of products to his customers.

Juan hopes that in this way his customers will find more of their needs are met by his business, and in that way his sales will increase considerably. Moreover, Juan hopes that with a larger income, his family can enjoy a better quality of life. In the short term, Juan dreams of setting up his business in his home, adapting it as necessary to set up his fruit and vegetable stall, and in the future, he dreams of having a large fruit and vegetable shop and a large butcher's shop with which he could offer his family a better quality of life and better opportunities to progress.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables so that he can offer his customers a better variety of products.

loans.name: Sofa

texts.es:
Sofa de 64 años es viuda, tiene 3 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de: 25 y 20 años. Sofa tiene una casa propia en el barrio Malambo, distrito de Huasahuasi – Tarma. Sofa es una mujer que no descansa. A pesar de su avanzada edad continua dedicándose a lo que le gusta hacer: la agricultura. Desde joven siembra papas, y verduras. Pero lo que más le conviene realizar es la compra y venta de papa, arvejas, zanahorias, lechugas, etc. Empezó hace 2 años. “Antes sembraba, pero es cansado, ahora viajo hasta Chanchamayo (selva central) para vender”, dice. Cada semana Sofa adquiere 20 sacos de papas, 10 sacos de arvejas y un poco de verdura. Sus hijos la ayudan en estas labores, por eso se siente a gusto con su actividad. Toda esta mercadería la expende en un puesto de ventas en el mercado de Chanchamayo. Además, hace 5 años prepara quesos. A la semana vende 80 moldes. Está contenta con su labor, porque así logró mantener a su familia en todo este tiempo.
Espera seguir con sus negocios y mejorar sus ventas. Éste sería su crédito número 12 que obtendría de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. “Santa Rosa de Tiambra”, es el nombre de su banco comunal. Se siente cómoda de tener compañeros con la misma visión emprendedora.
Con el dinero podrá comprar varios sacos de papas, para llevarlos hasta Chanchamayo y venderlos.
texts.en:
Sofa is a 64 year-old widow.  She has 3 children, but lives with only two of them who are aged 25 and 20.  Sofa has her own house in the Malambo neighborhood of the Huasahuasi – Tarma district.  Sofa is a woman who never rests.  In spite the fact that she is older, she continues to devote herself to doing what she enjoys, which is farming.  Ever since she was young she has cultivated potatoes and vegetables.  But the work that suits her best is buying and selling potatoes, peas, carrots, lettuce, etc.  She started doing this 2 years ago. "Before I used to farm, but it is tiring.  Now I travel to Chanchamayo (in the central forest) to sell," she says.  Every week, Sofa acquires 20 sacks of potatoes, 10 sacks of peas and some vegetables.  Her children help her with this work, and because of this she is comfortable with this activity.  She sells all of this merchandise from a sales post in the Chanchamayo market.  In addition, for 5 years she has also been making cheese.  Each week she sells 80 cheese molds.  She is content with her work, because this is the way that she has been supporting her family over all of this time.  

Sofa hopes to continue with these businesses and improve her sales.  This will be her 12th loan with MFP, and she pledges to be punctual with her loan payments.  Her communal bank is called “Santa Rosa de Tiambra."  She feels comfortable to have fellow group members who share her enterprising vision.

With this money, Sofa will buy a number of sacks of potatoes so that she can take them to Chanchamayo and sell them.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Concepción de 64 años convive con Antonia, la madre de sus 4 hijos, pero sólo todos ellos ya tienen familia. Él y Antonia viven juntos en una casa propia en el barrio Collpachaca, distrito de Huasahuasi – Tarma. A sus 64 años, Concepción aún continúa con las labores agrícolas. Desde que tenía 20 años trabaja la tierra. Actualmente cuenta con 8 “tongos” (parcelas de terrenos), en los que siembra papas y choclos. “Al año estoy sembrando de 15 a 20 sacos de semillas de papa, de distintas variedades”, dice.
En estas tareas agotadoras recibe el apoyo de sus hijos y de algunos peones que contrata. Así optimiza su trabajo. A la vez tiene una granja de cuyes. Comenta que posee 150 cuyes y los reproduce, a veces viaja hacia la ciudad de Lima llevando 80,  cada roedor lo vende a 15 soles. Le va bien. 
Con estas 2 actividades ha podido mantener a sus hijos y brindarles lo necesario para que ellos  sean personas de bien. Concepción accedería a su crédito número 12 de MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Está contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal “Santa Rosa de Tiambra” cuyos socios son personas emprendedoras y visionarias.
Comprará con el dinero 10 bolsas de abonos para sus cultivos de papas. Lo restante será para comprar los insumos necesarios para preparar los alimentos de los peones a quienes contratará.
texts.en:
Concepción is 64 years old and lives with  Antonia, the mother of his 4 children, but all of them have their own families. He and  Antonia live together in their own home in the Collpachaca neighborhood, district of Huasahuasi – Tarma. At 64 years old, Concepción still works at farming. Since he was 20 years old, he has worked the earth. Right now he has 8  “tongos” (parcels of land), where he plants potatoes and corn. "Every year I plant 15 to 20 sacks of different varieties of potato seeds." he says.   

In these exhausting tasks he gets help from his children and some laborers that he hires. That is how he optimizes his work. He also has a barn with guinea pigs. He says that he has 150 guinea pigs and he breeds them. Sometimes he travels to the city of Lima with 80 of them and sells each rodent for 15 soles. It is going well for him.  
 
With these 2 activities he has been able to support his children and give them what they need so they can be well established. This would be Concepción's 12th loan with MFP. That is why he is giving his word to make the monthly payments on time. He is happy to belong to his communal bank   “Santa Rosa de Tiambra”, whose members are enterprising and visionary people. With the money he will buy 10 bags of fertilizer for his potato crops. The rest will be to buy the necessary ingredients to prepare meals for the laborers he will hire.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and ingredients for the laborers' lunches.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza raises hogs to fatten for future sale. She had been doing it for over 10 years now. Through her income from her business, she was able to pay tuition fees for her children. She had four children attending school. 

Flordeliza would like to make her business more profitable, so she needs additional capital for hog sustenance.  She is now asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy feeds and vaccines for the hogs. 

Flordeliza would like to ensure good growth of the hogs to acquire good profits from her business.

loans.use: buy hog feeds and vaccines

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Rachael is 26 years old, married and has 3 children. She sells mango juice to earn a living.  She has been in the business for one year and describes her customers as low income earners because they live in slums. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Rachael has been able to improve her business and she hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy mangoes for making juice to sell.

loans.use: buy mangoes to make juice

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 39 years old and is a mother of one child. She runs a retail shop to earn a living.  She has been in the business for 5 years and describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. To earn extra income, she does farming. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Susan has been able to grow her business and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 10,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy sodas, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: buy sodas, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Peter Kinuthia Ndungu

texts.en: Peter is 28 years old.  He has a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for 2 years and describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Peter has been able to save his income and he hopes to expand his business in the future.  Peter has applied for 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 29 years old and married to Timothy.  They are blessed with four children, aged eleven, nine, seven and three years. She has a dairy where she sells milk, a business she has been doing for the past three years.  She earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

Caroline is requesting for a loan worth KES 30,000 to purchase a dairy cow at KES 20,000 and milk at KES 10,000 for resale. The anticipated profit will be ploughed back to her business. Her dream is to own a dairy farm and a matatu. This is her first loan.

loans.use: buy milk and a dairy cow

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet lives in yei. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for five years. She is 30 yearS old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Janet heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pound in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fee of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Sospeter Muturi

texts.en:
Sospeter is 33 years old married to Naomi and blessed with three children aged 10, seven and five years respectively. He sells leather jackets a business he ventured in four years ago. He earns a monthly income of KES 30,000 and has requested for a loan of KES 30,000 to buy 30 pieces of leather jackets for sale. 

The anticipated profit will be ploughed back to his business. His dream is to become a successful entrepreneur. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase 30 pieces of leather jackets for sale.

loans.name: Maxima Malenab

texts.en: Maxima is a 56-year-old and is married to Esteban, a farmer in the village of Union Kalinga. The couple has six children. They are very patient and hardworking persons. Maxima is engaged in selling different vegetables to the people in her community. She is requesting a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy a variety of vegetables and fruits that she can offer in the community. Maxima, at her age, still hopes to find ways to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables and fruits that she can offer in the community

loans.name: Rose Sadia

texts.en:
Rose lives in yei. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for five years. She is 39 years old, married, and has four children; three of them are still in school. 

Rose heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pound in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fee of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: John Gitau

texts.en:
John is a twenty eight year old man, he is single and has no children, and he runs a general merchandise supply shop in Loitokitok.  He has been in the business for two years now and gets a monthly income of twenty thousand seven hundred shillings.

This will be John’s first loan with KADET LTD, he plans to use the entire loan to purchase more stock for sale, with the profit that he will get he wants to increase stock especially sweets and biscuits. 

In future he wants to expand the business to include supply chain distribution.

loans.use: increase the stock especially sweets and biscuits.

loans.name: Lona

texts.en:
Lona lives in yei. She sells food stall, and has been in business for five years. She is 30 year old, married, and has four children; three of them are still in school. 

Lona heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500 Sudanese pound in order to purchase beans, rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fee of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice for sale.

loans.name: Mary Nganga

texts.en:
Mary Mukami is a fifty six year old woman, she is single and a mother of four children, she sells rice in wholesale in Huruma. Mary has been in the business for five years now and gets a monthly income of one hundred and eighty thousand shillings. 

This will be Mary’s sixth loan with KADET LTD, she plans use the entire loan to purchase more rice so as increase the number of outlets for sale. 

The profit that she will get she wants to diversify her business to farming. In future she wants to be able to expand her business and improve the economic status of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more rice for sale

loans.name: Julian De Jesus Vargas

texts.es:
Julian es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y siempre querer ofrecer a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Julian se encuentra casado y es padre de 4 hijos, quienes siempre han sido su motivación para trabajar fuertemente en su negocio. Julian anteriormente generaba los ingresos para su familia trabajando en la actividad del reciclaje, sin embargo, los graves problemas de salud que esto le generaba hicieron que dejara esta actividad a un lado y comenzara a buscar nuevas fuentes de ingresos. Fue así como montó su tienda general la cual atiende con muy buen servicio y en la que ofrece una gran cantidad de productos de la canasta familiar. Gracias a esto, Julian puede generar los ingresos que su familia necesita y puede preservar su salud que antes le impedía trabajar. Debido a que Julian montó su tienda con muy bajo capital, busca que un préstamo le permita acceder a la compra de productos de la canasta familiar con el ánimo de surtir su negocio y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes. 
Julian espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, pues podrá atender mayores necesidades de sus clientes y por ende tendrá mayores ventas. Julian sueña con que este negocio salga adelante y en un futuro crezca y pueda generar empleo como mínimo para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Julian has been noted for being a very hard working person and always wanting to offer his family a good quality of life. Julian is married and father to four children, who have always been his motivation to work hard at his business. Previously Julian generated income for his family by working in the recycling sector, however, the serious health problems this caused him, made him cast this occupation aside and start to look for new sources of income. It was how he opened his general store, in which he provides a very good service and offers a great quantity of staple family goods. Thanks to this, Julian can generate the income that his family needs and preserve his health, which previously stopped him working. As Julian opened his shop with very little capital, he is looking for a loan which will give him access to purchase more staple family goods, with the intention of stocking up his business and offering a greater variety of products to his customers.

In this way, Julian hopes that his income will increase considerably, as he will be able to attend to greater customer necessities, and therefore he will have greater sales. Julian dreams of his business making progress and growing in the future, and of being able create work, at least, for his children.

loans.use: to stock up his business and offer a greater variety of goods to his customers.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza de 44 años es una mujer soltera. Tiene un hijo de 9 años, a quien cuida con cariño en su casa propia ubicada en el barrio Malambo, distrito de Huasahuasi – Tarma. Lorenza confiesa que el trabajo del campo es lo que le gusta realizar, y es lo que sabe hacer muy bien. Gracias a la convivencia con familiares que se dedican a la agricultura aprendió sobre el cultivo de productos. Ella siembra papas y arvejas, “me conviene sembrar arvejas porque el precio no varia mucho y siempre hay venta”, comenta.
Cada vez que cosecha, negocia al por mayor con clientes que llegan desde la ciudad de Lima. Por otro lado, las papas las comercializa en la misma ciudad de Tarma, pero afirma que no siempre obtiene buenos ingresos, ya que los precios tienden a bajar. Aún así recupera su inversión.
Así también se dedica a la preparación de quesos, los que vende en su propio distrito, para ello cuenta con 2 vacas lecheras. A pesar de ser una madre soltera, consigue los medios necesarios para acompañar a su hijo en su crecimiento. Lorenza lleva trabajando varios ciclos con MFP, éste sería su crédito número 12, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en los pagos. “Santa Rosa de Tiambra”, es el nombre de su banco comunal, se siente alegre de pertenecer a un grupo responsable y empeñoso.
De obtener el dinero podrá adquirir pastos naturales, para alimentar a sus 2 vacas lecheras.
texts.en:
Lorenza is 44 years old and single. She has a 9 year old son, whom she cares for with love in her own home in the Malambo neighborhood, district of Huasahuasi – Tarma. Lorenza confesses that farm work is what she likes to do, since this is what she knows how to do well. Thanks to living with family members who farmed she learned how to grow produce.She plants potatoes and peas: "it's good for me to grow peas because the price doesn't vary a lot and they always sell", she remarks. 

At every harvest she negotiates wholesale with customers who come from the city of Lima. On the other hand, she sells the potatoes in Tarma itself, but she says that she doesn't always have good income, since the prices tend to go down. Even so, she is getting back her investment. 
 
She also makes cheese and sells them in her own district. To do this, she has two dairy cows. Despite being a single mother, she gets what she she needs to be with her son as he grows up. Lorenza has worked with MFP for several cycles. This will be loan number 12 and she is committed to making her payments on time. “Santa Rosa de Tiambra” is the name of her communal bank. She is happy to belong to such a hardworking and dedicated group. With the money she will be able to acquire fodder to feed her two dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy fodder to feed her cows.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
