Mary lives in Yei. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for five years. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children -- two of them are still in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao is 35 years old and lives in a rural area in the Thmor Koul district, where rice farming is one of most common businesses in the village. Mao has five children, but only four of them are still under her responsibility and two of them are still in school. 

To maintain her household, Mao grows rice as the main source of income and works for others for pay for additional income. She has been in her  business for 10 years. This is her first loan cycle with VisionFund, which she forms as a group loan with the other member and is the group leader. 

Mao and her group member are requesting a loan of KHR 500,000 each.  As the group leader, Mao will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and hire laborer for plowing her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice paddy healthfully and earn more income so that she still can keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and hire farm laborer

loans.name: Tahira Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Tahira bibi is 27 years old married woman and by this relationship she has four children: two daughters and two sons.   
Her father-in-law and brother-in-law also live with her family and they all including her husband are involved in wheat & grains selling business. They have been in this business for over many years but her husband started this business 5 years ago.  
They purchase these products from the farmers on wholesale and sell in markets on profits. They earn good income from this business which helps them running the financial circle of the family. 
Tahira herself is very caring lady. She spends her time at home and manages the household responsibilities. She tries her best to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy grains and wheat in larger quantity for reselling. 
She is very confident about the positive financial growth of her husband’s business after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy wheat and grains for reselling

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 43 years old, she sells fruits and vegetables in Majaoni, Mombasa. She is a married mother of two children. She has been doing this business for the last twelve years and she is doing great. 

This is her first business loan from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase more bananas, mangoes and cabbages to resell to her customers. 

She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and add more stock into her business. She hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, mangos and cabbages

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima lives in yei.  She sells fish, and has been in business for one year.  She is 25 years old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school.

Alima heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer; this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pound in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fee of her children

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Matheu

texts.en: Matheu is 29 years old. He uses scrap metals to make cookers(jiko) and grills to earn a living. He has been in the business for 2 years and describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy scrap metal for making grills and cookers.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal for making grills and cookers.

loans.name: Jesusa Cagurungan

texts.en:
Jesusa engages herself in selling fruits and vegetables in her village to supplement her husband's income. She is 58 years old and has five children. She aims to improve their status of living.

In this regard, Jesusa plans to improve her business and make it a viable source of income. Because of insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional amount of PHP12,000 to buy peanuts and bananas to sell in the villages. She believes that she can improve the business through her patience and strong determination.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and bananas to sell in their villages.

loans.name: Manuel Mnyapara

texts.en:
Manuel is 37 years old, a video shop owner in Voi. He is a married father of two school going children. His business has been in operation for the past twelve years successfully.

This is his third business loan from KADET LTD. He plans to purchase more video tapes and a new DVD player. He will use the anticipated profits to renovate the video shop and to repay his loan. 

He hopes to have a well established business.

loans.use: to purchase more video tapes and a new DVD player.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva lives in Yei. She sells fish and has been in the business for one year. She is 25 years old, married, and has two children; two of them are still in school. 

Eva heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en:
Abida is 22 years old, married, and has a 3 year old son who hasn’t started his education yet. Abida is a very caring & supportive woman and mother. She spends her time at home and manages her household responsibilities. She also helps her husband in preparing food for his restaurant business. 

Abida has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s restaurant business, which he runs in the market. He sells, through his restaurant, Punjabi food items called "Daal chawal" (made with lentils and served with rice and pickle) and "Roti Sabzi" (made with vegetables and served with bread). 

With the loan investment, Abida's husband will buy required ingredients such as flour, spices, cooking oil, rice and lentils in larger quantities that will allow him to prepare better quality food in larger quantities to serve many more customers. He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for the past many years. Due to the good quality and taste of food, his clients come to his restaurant regularly. 

Abida is hopeful that an investment will bring positive financial changes to her husband's business.
Note: "In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Abida".

loans.use: To buy required ingredients for the resturant business.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifania, de48 años es una mujer saludable y muy alegre. Vive en compañía de Marcelo, su esposo. Ambos tienen 2 hijos a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de Chilca. Desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a la venta de ropa para mujeres, varones, niños. Los cuales los comercializan de casa en casa a sus vecinos y a otros clientes que ya la conocen. Su forma de trabajo es muy diversa; pues deja al crédito a sus clientes de confianza a quienes conoce muy bien e incluso es conocedora de sus gustos. Su alegría y vitalidad es un factor muy importante, ya que se gana la simpatía de las personas, “me gusta conversar con ellos”. Cada 15 días viaja a la capital a comprar mercadería, “cuando converso, me entero de sus gustos y puedo traer ropa clave para que lo compren”. Afirma. Ahora ella está planeando alquilar un puesto de venta, donde pueda lucir la ropa que trae y vender al público en general. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “la florida” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación pues son personas responsables y solidarias.
Epifania de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de ropa surtida y variada, para su negocio.
texts.en:
Epifania is 48 years old and is a healthy and very happy woman. She lives with her husband Marcelo. They have 2 children who they take care of in their house located in the city of Chilca. She has worked for a long time selling clothes for men, women and children, which she sells from house to house to her neighbours and to other customers who already know her. 

Her way of working is very different, as she gives loans to trustworthy customers who she knows extremely well, and she even knows their tastes. Her happiness and liveliness are key as it wins people's affection, "I like chatting with them." Every fortnight, she travels to the capital to buy merchandise. "When I chat, I find out their tastes and I can bring them the right clothes so that they buy them," she says. 

She is now planning to rent a stall where she can display the clothes she has brought and sell to the general public. She belongs to the "La Florida" solidarity group and this is the first loan with Microfinanzas Prismas, where she feels accomplished as she gets help to grow her business. For that reason, she promises to make her payments on time. Moreover, she likes working in her communal bank as they are responsible and supportive.

Upon receiving your support, Epifania will invest the requested money in the purchase of a variety of clothes for her business.

loans.use: to buy a range of clothes

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José de 47 años convive hace 20 años con Yolanda, la madre de sus 3 hijos de 18, 13 y 8 años. Toda esta familia vive unida en una casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Palca – Tarma. José es un hombre luchador y empeñoso. A sus 47 años está seguro que trabajando con honestidad se pueden conseguir muchas cosas. Él es agricultor. Siembra papas, arvejas, espinacas y zanahorias. 
“Me gusta sembrar zanahorias y espinacas, porque la cosecha es más rápida”, dice. De esa manera en cada temporada siembra 1 lata de semillas de espinacas y 2 bolsas de semillas de arvejas. Los otros productos tienen meses específicos para el cultivo. Comenta que, la venta de espinacas es rentable. Se comercializa por canastas y su precio no varia tanto. José está satisfecho con los ingresos que obtiene de las hortalizas. Por otro lado las papas requieren más dedicación, tiempo y dinero, por eso prefiere empeñarse más en verduras.
Yolanda y sus hijos apoyan en las arduas labores del campo. José espera aumentar su producción, así mantendrá a sus hijos menores, que aún se encuentran en edad escolar. Éste sería su crédito número 5 que recibiría de MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. “Los Cantaritos” es el nombre de su banco comunal. Se siente bien al lado de socios responsables y pagadores.
De obtener el dinero podrá comprar 2 latas de semillas de espinacas con 150 soles, lo restante lo destinará al pago de los peones que contratará para remover la tierra y bolsas de abonos.
texts.en:
José, 47, has lived with Yolanda, the mother of his three children who are 18, 13 and 8 years old, for the last 20 years.  The entire family lives together in the own house located in Palca-Tarma District.  José is a tenacious, enterprising man.  At the age of 47 he is sure that by working with honesty one can attain many things.  He is a farmer.  He grows potatoes, peas, spinach and carrots.

“I like to grow carrots and spinach because they are harvested more quickly,” he says.  That way each season he plants a can of spinach seeds and two sacks of pea seeds.  The other products have specific months for planting.  He comments that spinach sales are profitable.  It’s sold by the basketfuls and the price doesn’t fluctuate much.  José is satisfied with the income he earns from the greens.  On the other hand, the potatoes require more attention, time and money which is why he prefers to work more with the vegetables.

Yolanda and their children help him with the field work.  José expects to increase production to support his younger children who are still school age.  This will be loan #5 he’ll get from MFP so he commits to be punctual with his monthly installment payments.  “Los Cantaritos” (The Little Pitchers) is the name of his communal bank.  He feels good alongside responsible, well-paying fellow members.

If he were to get the money, he will buy two cans of spinach seeds for 150 sols and the rest will be used to pay day laborers he’ll hire to till the soil and for sacks of manure.

loans.use: to buy two cans of spinach seeds, to hire day laborers and to buy a sack of manure.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara de 24 años es una madre soltera. Mayte (su hija) de 4 años es su razón de vivir. Sara vive con sus padres en la casa de ellos, ubicada en el distrito de Palca – Tarma. Sara se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra papas, arvejas y habas. “Me conviene las arvejas, por eso siembro 2 bolsas de semillas. Obtengo como 40 sacos solo de 1 bolsa.”, dice orgullosa. Así también siembra papas, pero en pocas cantidades ya que el precio tiende a variar. Lleva 4 años en esta actividad, gracias al asesoramiento de sus padres. Sara es inteligente, sabe que le conviene por eso también cría animales (carneros, chanchos y algunos cuyes). Así asegura otro tipo de ingresos por medio de la venta de carne.
Espera contar con más ahorros para destinarlos en la compra de más terrenos, así aumentará su producción. Dice que será firme en sus convicciones para darle a su hija una mejor calidad de vida. Ella accedería a su primer crédito con MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Gracias al trabajo que realizan dentro del banco comunal:”Los Cantaritos” se decidió en pertenecerlo, por la solidaridad y responsabilidad que ve dentro del grupo. Con el dinero podrá comprar 1 bolsa de semilla de arvejas con 600 soles, lo restante lo destinará en la compra de bolsas de abonos.
texts.en:
Sara, 24, is a single mother.  Mayté (her daughter) is four years old and her reason for living.  Sara lives with her parents in their house located in Palca-Tarma District.  

Sara is a farmer.  She grows potatoes, peas and lima beans.  “Peas are advantageous for me which is why I plant two bags of seeds.  I get about 40 sacks from just one bag,” she says proudly.  She also plants potatoes but in small amounts because prices tend to vary.  She’s been in this line of work for four years thanks to her parents’ guidance.  Sara is intelligent.  She knows that it’s to her advantage to also raise animals (calves, pigs and some guinea pigs).  This way she insures another source of income through the meat sales.

She hopes to have more savings to use to buy more land and increase production.  She says that she will stand firm in her convictions to give her daughter a better quality of life.  

She will be accessing her first MFP loan so commits to being punctual with her installment payments.  Thanks to the work done in the “Los Cantaritos” (The Little Pitchers) communal bank she decided to join it because of the solidarity and responsibility she witnessed within the group.  With the money she will be able to buy a bag of pea seeds for 600 soles and the rest will be used to buy sacks of manure.

loans.use: to buy one bag of pea seeds and sacks of manure.

loans.name: Clemente

texts.es: Clemente de 45 años convive con Antonia con quien tiene 6 hijos de 24, 22, 20, 16, 13 y 10 años. Pero solo vive con los 4 menores, en una casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Palca – Tarma. Clemente se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra papas, arvejas y habas. Su producción es considerable. “Siembro 6 bolsas de semillas de arvejas, de cada bolsa cosecho 25 sacos, si es rentable”, dice. Afirma que desde los 14 años se dedica a la labores del campo, por eso le gusta su actividad. Las papas no mantienen un precio fijo, a veces solo recupera lo invertido, por eso solo siembra de 6 a 10 sacos de semillas. Gracias a la ayuda de sus hijos y de su incondicional pareja, puede terminar más rápido sus labores.  Pero siempre requiere la intervención de peones, a quienes contrata pagándoles al día. Clemente espera seguir trabajando en el campo hasta que las fuerzas se le agoten, porque le gusta lo que hace. Éste sería su crédito número 5 con MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Está contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal “Los Cantaritos”, por tener socios responsables y confiables. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de bolsas de abonos y algunas sustancias para contrarrestar las enfermedades de sus plantas.
texts.en:
Clemente, 45, lives with Antonia with whom he has six children who are 24, 22, 20, 16, 13 and 10 years old.  He only lives with the youngest four in a house of his own located in Palca-Tarma District.  

Clemente works in agriculture.  He plants potatoes, peas and lima beans.  His production is considerable.  “I plant six bags of pea seeds and from each bag I harvest 25 sacks; it’s profitable,” he says.  

He affirms that he’s been doing work in the fields since he was 14 years old and this is why he likes his activity.  Potatoes don’t retain a steady price and sometimes he barely recuperates his investment so he only plants from six to ten sacks of seeds.  Thanks to help from his children and his unconditional spouse he can finish his tasks more quickly.  But he always needs help from day laborers who he hires and pays a daily wage.  Clemente hopes to continue working in the fields until his strength gives out because he likes what he does.  

This would be loan #5 with MFP so he commits to be punctual with his installment payments.  He is happy to belong to his “Los Cantaritos” (The Little Pitchers) communal bank because it has responsible, trustworthy members.  He will use the money to buy sacks of manure and some substances to counteract crop diseases.

loans.use: to buy a bag of manure and substances to avoid his plants being attacked by bugs or fungus.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel de 20 años es un joven soltero, vive al lado de sus padres, en la casa de ellos, ubicada en el distrito de Palca – Tarma. Miguel es un joven entusiasta. A su edad ya piensa como una persona madura. Se dedica a la agricultura, apoyando en las chacras de sus padres. “Siembro a medias, ellos ponen el terreno y yo el trabajo y la semilla, cuando cosechamos lo dividimos en 2”, dice, añadiendo que una forma de trabajo conveniente.
Le gusta cultivar arvejas, gladiolos y papas. Cuando cosecha expende su producción en el mercado mayorista de Tarma. A la vez, Miguel estudia Electrotecnia Industrial, sus metas son claras, piensa laborar hasta concluir sus estudios y luego ejercer un trabajo profesional. Aún le faltan 2 años, mientras tanto seguirá esforzándose como ahora. Miguel accedería a su primer crédito con MFP. Vio atrayente la forma de trabajo de su banco comunal “Los Cantaritos”, por eso no dudo en ser parte de él. Afirma que será responsable en el pago de las cuotas y en las actividades de su grupo.
Con el dinero podrá adquirir bolsas de abonos con 400 soles; y 1 bolsa de semilla de arvejas con 600 soles.
texts.en:
Miguel, 20, is a single young man living alongside his parents in their house located in Palca-Tarma District.  Miguel is an enthusiastic young man.  At his age he already thinks like a mature person.  He works in agriculture helping out in his parents’ fields.  “I half-way farm; they put in the land and I put in the work and the seeds.  When we harvest, we divide it in half,” he says adding that it’s an expedient way to work.

He likes growing peas, gladioli and potatoes.  He sells his harvests in Tarma’s wholesale market.  At the same time, Miguel is studying Industrial Electric Technology.  His goals are clear.  He plans to work until he finishes his studies and then practice a professional career.  He still has two years to go and in the meantime he will continue to strive as he’s done to date.

Miguel will access his first loan with MFP.  He thought the way his “Los Cantaritos” (The Little Pitchers) communal bank works was attractive so he didn’t hesitate to become part of it.  He affirms that he will be responsible with his installment payments and with group activities.  He will be able to buy sacks of manure with 400 soles of the money and one bag of pea seeds with 600 soles.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and a bag of pea seeds.

loans.name: Fidela

texts.es: Ser más específico en este párrafo, algunos solo mencionan la edad y en donde viven. 6 hijos. Ella es una mujer muy exigente, gusta mucho de trabajar y que sus actividades sean de calidad. Desde muy joven y por las necesidades que atravesaba ella se dedicó a la venta de diversos productos allá en su tierra natal de Huaraz, se hizo muy conocida  en su tierra, era una de las proveedoras en productos alimenticios como papa, queso entre otras, así como artesanías y prendas de vestir. Se casó  y desde ahí vino a radicar a Huancayo,  pero siempre estuvo trabajando aunque en menor proporción, pasaron los años y no se quedó atrás pues por un tiempo se dedicó a la venta de verduras en un puesto de mercado y también a la venta de agua de manzana, pero por motivos de salud  dejo de hacerlo aún más porque las indicaciones médicas especificaban un periodo de descanso a la cual ella tuvo que cumplir, pasado este tiempo y retomó la venta de ropa. Pasaron 4 años desde entonces, ella se siente muy contenta de sentirse útil, además el cuidado de sus 2 hijos le brinda los deseos de trabajar para poder aportar económicamente en el sostén de sus estudios, su esposo también trabaja pero fuera de la ciudad, teniendo que asumir los dos roles ella sola. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “la florida” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación pues son personas responsables y solidarias. Fidela de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de ropa variada para su negocio.
texts.en:
To be more specific in this paragraph, some only mention the age and where they live. Fidela has six children. She is a very exacting woman, who really likes to work, and to do quality work. 

From a young age, and because of the difficulties she was experiencing, she worked selling various products in Huaraz, the area where she was born. She became very well-known in her home area, as one of the suppliers of food products such as potatoes, cheese, and other things such as crafts and articles of clothing. She married, and came to live in Huancayo; but she was always working, though to a lesser extent.

The years passed, and she wasn't left behind, as for a time she sold vegetables from a stand in the market, and also sold apple drink. But for health reasons she stopped doing this, because medical advice indicated a period of rest and she had to comply. After this period, she resumed selling clothing.

Four years have passed, and she is very happy to feel useful; and in addition, looking after two children makes her her want to work to be able to contribute to the costs of their schooling. Her husband also works, but out of town, so she alone has to assume the two roles. 

She belongs to the "La Florida" communal bank, and this is her ninth loan with MFP, where she feels empowered, as she is getting help to make progress in her business. That's why she promises to pay her installments on time. Besides, she likes to work in her group, as the people are responsible and supportive. 

When she receives the loan, Fidela will use the money applied for to buy a variety of clothing for her business.

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothing.

loans.name: Nancy Francisca Quexel Gil

texts.es: Nancy de 29 años de edad madre de dos niños se dedica a la venta de perfumeria y cosmeticos de belleza, y articulos para limpieza desde hace 6 años ella vende todos los dias sus productos de casa en casa,nos cuenta que la dificultad que ella tiene es que no cuenta con un local propio para poder ofrecer su producto,el credito que esta solicitando es para la compra de mas perfumeria y productos de limpieza ya que tambien nececita conseguir un local para poder ofrecer su producto, ya que es un medio de como generar mas capital y ganancias ya que por medio de la ganacias ayudara a suu hijos en sus estudios espera que le puedan dar la oportunidad de el credito.y apoyarla en su negocio.
texts.en: Nancy is 29 years old.  She has two children and has been selling perfume, cosmetics, and cleansers for 6 years.  She sells the products every day door to door.  She tells us that the challenge she faces is that she does not have her own shop to be able to offer her products.  The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase more perfume and cleansers.  She also needs to find a location where she can sell her products.  This is a way she can generate more capital and earnings that will help her children with their education. She hopes to have the opportunity of receiving this loan and support for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more perfume and cleansers.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William's business is motorcycle transport. He has been in this business for a long year. William works hard to give his family better quality of life. He spends his income mainly to provide the daily needs of his family. At this time, William has asked for a loan amounting to PHP 13,000 to buy paint, spare parts, and gasoline for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy paint, spare parts, and gasoline for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Leidy Yureny Morales

texts.es:
Leidy es una joven emprendedora que a pesar de su corta edad ya ha cosechado muchos frutos con gran esfuerzo. Con 19 años de edad, Leidy es propietaria de su negocio el cual es una papelería y además ofrece el servicio de café Internet. Con tan solo 15 años de edad comenzó a trabajar en este almacén y lo hacía estudiando en las mañanas y trabajando en las tardes, y de esta manera generaba los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de sus propios gastos y con los que contribuía económicamente con los gastos de su hogar donde convive con sus padres. Gracias a que inició desde muy temprana edad a trabajar, aprendió la actividad rápidamente y así pudo aprovechar la oportunidad de comprar la papelería cuando su antigua jefe se lo ofreció en venta. Ya de esto hace aproximadamente 2 años, y desde entonces Leidy es la propietaria de su propio negocio y gracias a esto puede sostener sus propios gastos y contribuir económicamente en su hogar. Con el ánimo de surtir su negocio, debido a la temporada escolar, Leidy busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos de papelería y poder tener un buen surtido de mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientes.

Leidy espera poder surtir su negocio sin que sus ingresos mensuales se vean afectados. Además, Leidy espera que con mayor variedad de productos sus clientes encuentren más razones para comprar en su papelería, y de esta manera sus ingresos cada vez sigan aumentando. Leidy sueña con sacar su negocio adelante y con que este le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a estudios universitarios y cumplir su sueño de ser una profesional estudiada.
texts.en:
Leidy is a young entrepreneur who, with great effort, already has achieved a lot despite her young age.  At 19 years old, Leidy is the owner of her business, which is a stationery store where she also has an internet cafe service.  At the age of only 15 she began to work in this department store, and she did it while studying in the morning and working in the afternoon.  In this way she generated the income necessary to cover her own expenses and contribute economically to the expenses of her home, where she lives with her parents.

Thanks to this she began to work at a very young age.  She learned the job quickly and so managed to take advantage of the opportunity to buy the stationery store when her former boss offered to sell it to her.  This was approximately two years ago, and since then Leidy has been the owner of her own business, thanks to which she can support her own expenses and contribute financially in her household.

With the desire to supply her business, because of the school season, Leidy wants a loan that will give her the possibility of buying paper products and having a good supply of merchandise to sell to her customers.

Leidy hopes to be able to supply her business without affecting her monthly income.  In addition, she hopes that with a greater variety of products her customers will find more reasons to shop in her store, and in this way her income will continue to increase more all the time.

Leidy dreams about getting her business ahead and that, with this, she will have the possibility of gaining access to a university education and realizing her dream of being an educated professional.

loans.use: to buy products for her stationery store to have a good supply for her customers.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es:
Adelina de 46 años está casada con Guillermo con quien tiene 2 hijos de 24 y 22 años. Esta unida familia vive en una casa propia en el distrito de Palca – Tarma. Adelina se esfuerza mucho para lograr lo que quiere. Ella es agricultora, siembra papa, arvejas, zanahorias, habas, entre otras.
Su producción es considerable. “Siembro 40 sacos de semillas de papas Yungay, Única y Canchán (variedades)”, comenta. Con la ayuda de Guillermo y sus hijos (quienes estudian) puede apresurar su trabajo, y a la vez no sentirse sola en tan absorbente actividad. Comenta que la producción de arvejas también es rentable. De una bolsa de semilla obtiene como 25 sacos. Ella espera aumentar su producción de arvejas y hortalizas, para ello piensa alquilar terrenos, así continuará en su lucha hacia el emprendimiento. Adelina viene trabajando con MFP varios ciclos. Éste sería su crédito número 5, por eso se responsabiliza de pagar las cuotas. “Los Cantaritos”, es el nombre de su banco comunal, se siente contenta de pertenecer a un grupo sólido y confiable.
Con el dinero podrá adquirir 5 bolsas de abonos y algunos remedios para contrarrestar la “rancha” y “chupadera” (enfermedades producidas la falta de lluvias).
texts.en:
Adelina, 46, is married to Guillermo and they have two children who are 24 and 22 years old.  This united family lives in their own house located in Palca-Tarma District.  Adelina works hard to attain what she wants. She’s a farmer.  She grows potatoes, peas, carrots and lima beans, among others.

Her production is considerable.  “I plant 40 sacks of Yungay, Única and Canchán (varieties) of seeds of potatoes,” she comments.  With help from Guillermo and her children (who are studying) she can quicken her tasks and not feel so lonely in such demanding work.  She comments that pea production is profitable.  From one bag of seeds she obtains about 25 sacks.  She hopes to expand production of peas and greens and to do so plans to lease land to continue with her struggle toward entrepreneurship. 

Adelina has been working with MFP for several cycles.  This will be loan #5 so she takes on the responsibility of the installment payments.  “Los Cantaritos” (The Little Pitchers) is the name of her communal bank and she feels happy to belong to such a solid, trustworthy group.  She will be able to use the money to buy five sacks of manure and some remedies to counteract “rancha” and “chupadera” (diseases caused by lack of rain).

loans.use: to buy five sacks of manure and substances for her plants to avoid their being attacked by fungi.

loans.name: Duo Lirio De San Bartolo Group

texts.es: Duo Lirio de los Balles, Flor de Maria,de 39 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 25 años cuando apenas ella tenia 14 años ya a trabajado un credito y le gracias a Dios porque pudo comprar mas mercaderias pero ella siente la nececidad de un credito mas ya que nececita comprar mas frutas y versura y tambien para la invercion en un local mas grande ya gracias a Dios su negocio a enpesado a crecer y nececita capital para surtir su local ya que su deseo es terminar su casa y tambien para ayudar a sus tres hermanos que estan en epoca escolar y ella los ayuda,de igual forma la siguiente socia se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
Lirio de los Valles Duo  (Lilly of the Valley Duo)

Flor de María, 39, started selling fruit and vegetables 25 years ago when she was barely 14 years old.  She has worked with loans before and she thanks God because she was able to buy more merchandise.  She now feels the need for another loan because she needs to buy more fruit and vegetables and also to invest in a larger stand because thanks be to God her business has started to grow and she needs capital to stock it since her wish is to finish building her house and also to help her three siblings who are school age and she helps them.  The other member also sells fruit and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Maria Luisa.de 47 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos es propietaria de un puesto de ventas de comidas en una fabrica textilera,todos los dias se levanta desde muy temprano para empesar a cocinar ya que tiene que bariar diferentes platillos,todos los dias tiene que trasladarse a la fabrica a vender su comida,con el credito anterior pudo agrandar un poco mas su negocio,espera que le puedan seguir dando el apoyo que ella nececita el credito lo esta solicitando para la compra de mas mercaderia para la elavoracion de comida.
texts.en: Maria Luisa is 47 years old.  She is married and has 4 children.  She owns a food stall in a textile factory.  Every day, she gets up very early to begin cooking, as she has to make different dishes.  Every day she goes to the factory to sell her meals.  With a previous loan she was able to grow her business a little bit more.  She hopes that you can continue providing the support that she needs.  The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase more ingredients to prepare meals.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare meals.

loans.name: Elsa Judith

texts.es: Elsa de 25 años de edad,casada y tiene una hija ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas,lo inicio reciente mente ya que anterior mente vendia elados pero su suegra le dio la oportunidad para vender tortillas en el negocio que ella tiene todos los dia se lebanta temprano para preparar el maiz que utiliza para elavorar las tortillas Elsa cuentq con su negocio pero el capital que tiene no le alcanza para comprar mas maiz es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz espera que le puedan dar el apoyo que nececita para agrandar mas su negocio.
texts.en: Elsa is 25 years old.  She is married and has a daughter.  She recently started a business selling tortillas.  She previously sold ice cream, but her mother-in-law gave her the opportunity to sell tortillas in the business she has.  Every day she gets up early to prepare the corn that she will use to make the tortillas.  Elsa has her business, but the capital she has is not sufficient to purchase more corn.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to purchase more corn.  She hopes you can provide the support she needs to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Erika de 24 años de edad convive con Armando de 24 años, con quien tiene 1 hijo, ellos viven en el centro poblado de Omaya del distrito de Pichari. Erika es una madre joven que viene dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes en el mercado de su ciudad. Ella se inicio en este negocio gracias al pequeño capital que juntaron con su querido esposo con la finalidad de obtener un ingreso para el sostén de la familia, de esta manera lograron tener una vida digna. Generalmente trabaja sola pero en las tardes cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien de día trabaja en su parcela agrícola cultivando cacao. Erica está contenta con su negocio por que le genera una buena rentabilidad económica, porque cada día que pasa siempre viene captando un sin numero de clientes. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles invertirá en el incremento de mercadería
texts.en: Erika is 24 years old and lives with Armando, age 24, with whom she has a son.  They live in the town of Omaya, in the Pichari district.  Erika is a young mother who has a business selling groceries in a market in her city.  She started this business thanks to a small amount of money she had saved with her dear husband, with the goal of generating an income to support the family.  In this way they were able to have a decent life.  She usually works alone but in the afternoons she has help from her husband who works during the day on their agricultural plot cultivating cacao.  Erica is happy with her business because it provides good economic returns.  Every day that passes she attracts numerous customers.  This is her first loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time.  She will use the 1,000 new soles to invest in growing her inventory.

loans.use: to purchase products to stock her store.

loans.name: Manyeso Kiraga

texts.en:
Manyeso is 34 years old.  She is a married mother of four and a firewood seller in Gana Hola, Mombasa.  Her business has been in operation for the past two years with great success. 

This is her third loan term with KADET LTD to finance her business.  She plans to use the loan to purchase more firewood to supply her customers.  She will use the proceeds from her business to educate her children and repay her loan. 

She hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood.

loans.name: Dora Mwachogo

texts.en:
Dora is a 72-year-old retail shop owner in Voi. She is the married mother of two grown children. She has been a shopkeeper for the past ten years. Her business is doing great.

This marks Dora's third loan from KADET LTD. to finance her business. She plans to purchase more sugar, salt, cooking oil, and washing detergents. Dora will use the anticipated profits to expand her business further and to repay her loan. She hopes to have a well established business.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, salt, cooking oil, and washing detergents.

loans.name: Lilly

texts.en:
Lilly lives in Yei. She sells clothes, a business she has been in for five years. She is 40 years old and married with five children, two of whom are still in school. 

Lilly first heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese Pounds in order to purchase clothes to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Esther Baya

texts.en:
Esther is a 22-year-old businesswoman in Mombasa. She sells clothes, a business she has been in for the past seven years with success. She is married with three children.

This is Esther's fourth loan from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase more shirts, blouses, trousers, and skirts to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. She hopes to excel in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more shirts, blouses, trousers, and skirts.

loans.name: Nora Alicaycay

texts.en:
Nora has operated a small sari-sari (variety) store for ten years. She expresses her commitment and full devotion to her business and to her family as well. The profits earned from her business allow her to pay her family's monthly electric bill and to provide for their daily needs. 

Nora wants to strengthen her business but has insufficient funds, so she is asking for a loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, vinegar, and other basic kitchen needs to sell. She wants to stock more items in her store to meet all her customers' requests. In the future, Nora aims to have a large store to earn higher revenue.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, vinegar, and other basic kitchen needs to sell.

loans.name: Duo Luchadoras De Chajones Group

texts.es:
Dúo  LUCHADORAS DE CHAJONES
Este dúo está formado por doña Gloria Florencia, ella tiene 34 años de edad, es casada, y tiene 4 hijos nos cuenta que ellas ya están en la escuela y la mayor tiene 9 años, ella nos cuenta que es dueña de una pequeña tienda en su casa ubicada en el caserío los Chajones, desde hace 2 años, la idea surgió porque en el lugar en donde ella esta no hay tienda entonces su esposo y ella con mucho esfuerzo lograron ponerla, pero no tienen suficiente capital como para poder vender todos los productos de una tienda, ya que tiene solo lo básico, y lo poquito que vende lo vuelve a invertir y su esposo ya que él se dedica a vender (colchones, canas, baños plásticos, escobas,etc.) por abonos, entonces viaja a comprar a la capital 2 veces por semana, entonces él la hace el favor de traer el producto necesario, porque a veces en lugar no llegan las empresas a vender el producto, mas sin embargo ella solicita este crédito para invertir en su negocio como en la compra de aguas gaseosas,golocinas,jugos, frijol, arroz etc ya que su esposo no le ha ido muy bien con su trabajo entonces quieren agrandar la tienda y así obtener mejores ganancias, y apoyar a sus hijos en la escuela la siguiente socia  se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada típica,y nececita este credito para invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Dúo  LUCHADORAS DE CHAJONES (Chajones Fighters Duo)

This duo is made up of Gloria Florencia, 34.  She’s married and has four children.  She tells us that they are in school; the oldest is 9 years old.  She tells us that she has had a small store at home located in the Chajones hamlet for the last two years.  The idea arose because where she lives there was no store and her husband and she with much effort managed to open one but they don’t have enough capital to sell all store products; she only stocks basic things and what little she sells she reinvests.  

Her husband is a merchant.  He sells mattresses, reeds, plastic bathtubs, brooms, etc.) in installments so he goes to the capital twice a week to buy and he does her the favor of bringing her the products she needs because sometimes firms that sell the product don’t come to her place.  However, she is asking for this loan to invest in her business purchasing soft-drinks, snacks, juice, beans, rice, etc. Since her husband hasn’t done too well with his business they want to enlarge the store to obtain better profits and support their children’s schooling.  

The other member sells new and used traditional clothes and needs the loan to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy basic staple food items.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Yei.  She sells fish and has been in business for one year.  She is 20 years old, married and has one child who attends school. 

Susan heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase fish.  She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her child’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Prisca Nganga

texts.en:
Prisca is a 23-year-old boda-boda (motorcycle) owner in Mariakani.  She is married.  She has managed a motorcycle transportation business for the past two years and she is doing great. 

This is Prisca’s third business loan from KADET LTD.  She plans to use this loan to service her motorcycle.  She will use the anticipated profits to buy an additional motorcycle. 

In the future, she hopes to have an established transportation business.

loans.use: to service her motorcycle.

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en:
Veronika lives in Yei. She sells charcoal and has been in this business for two years. She is 40 years old and married, and she has four children; two of her children are still in school. 

Veronika first heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Samvel Ohanyan

texts.en:
Samvel is 33 years old. He lives in Kapan City, in the south of Armenia, with his wife and four children. Samvel runs a farm, where he has been breeding livestock for eight years. The main income from agriculture comes from selling the milk and meat in the city. 

Currently the number of livestock in Samvel's farm is 13. Samvel has applied for this loan in order to purchase more livestock and develop his farm. With the loan's help Samvel expects to increase the sales of meat and milk and get more income. Samvel's house needs to be repaired, so additional income is vital for him to solve this problem and insure improved living conditions for his children.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock.

loans.name: Sajida Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Sajida Bibi is 41 years old and a very hardworking lady. She and her husband are involved in the business of animal sales. Her husband purchases the young animals from animal markets and sells them after raising them up. During the raising period he gets full support from Sajida. She takes care of his cattle and gives timely food and water. 

Sajida and her husband are both very helpful and supportive of each other. Her husband also helps Sajida in her household works. Sajida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy young animals (goat and buffalo) to raise and sell. Sajida is very sure about the business growth of her husband's business after the loan investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sajida Bibi.

loans.use: To buy animals for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía es natural de Chupaca, es viuda y en la actualidad vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia que heredo de sus padres. Desde hace 2 años comenzó con su tienda de comestibles, anteriormente tenía un restaurante en una zona céntrica de la ciudad, que cerró porque no le generaba ganancias. Por ello comenzó a dedicar todas sus fuerzas en la tienda que instalo en su misma casa y de donde vende productos de primera necesidad, también refrescos y gaseosas y para la mayor comodidad de sus clientes, puso una mesa con sillas para que sus clientes puedan consumir gaseosas con mayor comodidad. Se siente feliz, pues sus hijos la ayudan en la atención y también aprenden cada día del trato adecuado a los clientes, su negocio está mejorando poco a poco y se dio cuenta que es necesario implementarla y no descansará  hasta ver su tienda mejor equipada y en el futuro también vendiendo comida. “todo poco a poco, lo importante son las ganas de progresar”, menciona. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “cristo rey” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación pues son personas responsables y solidarias.
Sofía de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero en la compra de más mercadería en productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Sofía is from Chupaca. She is a widow, and currently lives with her two children in her own house that she inherited from her parents. She began her grocery store business two years ago. 

She previously had a restaurant in the central area of the city, which she closed because it wasn't generating profits. For this reason she began to devote all her energies to the store she set up in her own home, where she sells basic household products, as well as soft drinks. She put in a table with chairs so that her customers can have their soft drinks in greater comfort. 

She is happy, as her children help her run the store, and also learn each day how to serve customers properly. Her business is gradually improving, and she realized that it is necessary to run it properly.  She will not rest until she sees her store better equipped, and in the future also selling meals. "Everything little by little--the important thing is the desire to move forward," she comments. 

She belongs to the "Cristo Rey” communal bank, and this is her second loan with MFP, where she feels empowered, as she is getting help to make progress with her business. This is why she promises to make her installment payments on time. She also likes working in her group, as they are responsible and supportive people.

When she receives her loan, Sofía will use the money to buy more merchandise: basic household necessities for her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy basic household necessities to stock her store.

loans.name: Julia Liliana López Cruz

texts.es: Julia Liliana, de 48 años de edad es viuda y tiene 4 hijos tres de ellos son casados y las mas pequeñas vive con ella,doña julia desde muy pequeña a trabajado en negocios y hace 25 años inicio su negocio propio tiene  un taller de costuras y reposteria y hace poco tiempo empeso a vender waipe,ella esta solicitando el credito para poder comprar(materia prima) telas hilo,y waipe,agradese a kiva el apoyo que le han brindado ya que su negocio a prosperado.
texts.en: Julia Liliana, 48, is a widow and has four children; three of them are married and the youngest lives with her.  Julia has worked in businesses since she was very little and 25 years ago started her own business.  She has a sewing shop and a pastry shop and a short time ago started selling ‘waipe’ [cleaning rags].  She is asking for the loan to buy raw materials: fabric, thread and rags.  She thanks Kiva for the support it has provided since her business has been prospering.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es: Maria Jesus de 36 años de edad, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales empeso con esta actividad desde hace 7 años,nos cuenta que esta muy contenta porque dice que si le apoyan con el credito podra comprar lo que nececita nos comenta que nececita comprar mas animales como marranos,pollos,etc ya que biene la epoca de semana mayor y es cuando se vende muchos los animales.desde ya les agradese el apoyo.
texts.en: María Jesús, 36, raises animals.  She started with this activity seven years ago.  She tells us that she’s very happy because she says that if you help her with the loans she will be able to buy what she needs.  She comments that she needs to buy more animals like pigs, chickens, etc. because Holy Week is approaching and that’s when most animals are sold.  She thanks you for your support as of now.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Pastor

texts.es:
Pastor, de 36 años de edad, es un hombre emprendedor y trabajador, es soltero sin hijos.  Vive solo en compañía de un amigo con quien comparte los gastos de alquiler su casa, habitando cómodamente una casa alquilada. Las actividades que realiza Pastor son las  labores de estilista, haciendo manicure y pedicure a domicilio, cortes y peinados de cabello para damas, caballeros y niños, tiendo como principales clientes a sus amistades y familiares. Su oficio lo aprendió en un centro de educación ocupacional en su tierra natal de Tarapoto. Lleva dedicándose a ésta actividad desde hace más de 15 años, y realizándola solo en un ambiente acondicionado en la casa que habita. Considera a su actividad bastante rentable por las buenas vagancias que le deja, que es muy solicitado por los buenos acabados del corte y peinado de cabello.
Le gusta su actividad, sentirse a gusto realizando una actividad que le gusta, que es la de estilista, y convertirse en un prospero empresario, a la vez que lo entretiene, Lo considera rentable ya que esta ubicada en una zona comercial que tiene una buena afluencias de clientes, por tanto  tiene planes de ampliar y abrir un gimnasio y otra sucursal. Este seria el segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, le gusta el trabajo que vienen realizando por el apoyo que viene recibiendo, desea poder seguir contando con este apoyo, por tanto comenta será puntual con los pagos de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para el arreglo de su local, además de maquinas de corte de pelo, espejos y otros, de esa manera tendrá un ambiente  más cómodo para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Pastor is 36 years old.  He is entrepreneurial and hardworking.  He is single and does not have children.  He lives alone with a friend with whom he splits the rent.  He lives comfortably in a rented home.  Pastor is a stylist, doing manicures and pedicures at home, and haircuts and hairstyles for women, men and children.  His primary customers are his friends and family.  He learned his vocation in an occupational education program in his hometown of Tarapoto.  He has been doing this type of work for over 15 years, just working out of a room set up for this purpose in the house where he lives. He considers his profession pretty profitable based on his earnings.  He is often requested for his good cuts and styling.   He likes his profession, and enjoys being a stylist and being his own boss. His work is entertaining and profitable, now that his business is located in a commercial area that has good foot traffic.  For this reason he plans to expand, open a gym, and open another branch. 

This is his second loan with MFP.  He likes the work he is doing and the support he has received.  He would like to continue to receive this support, and comments he will make his payments on time.  He will invest the 1,500 new soles he has requested in materials to fix up his salon, as well as hair clippers, mirrors, etc. so that he will have a more comfortable environment for his customers.

loans.use: to purchase materials to set up his beauty salon such as mirrors and tools for cutting hair.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Yei.  She sells fish and has been in business for two years.  She is 30 years old, married and has two children who attend school. 

Betty heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase fish.  She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Juan Ángel

texts.es:
El señor Juan tiene 33 años de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos. El se ha dedicado toda su vida a la agricultura y lo aprendió de sus padres. Es una persona honesta, responsable, con valores y principios posee buena reputación en la comunidad, es una familia unida, es jornalero y manifiesta que desea brindarle una mejor vida a su familia. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 25 pliegos de lámina que cuestan $325 dólares, clavos y pago de mano de obra, para construir una nueva cocina en su casa. Así él construirá una cocina más segura para su familia, por la época de lluvia y una casa más digna, ya que su sueño es construir una casa de bloque y brindarles a sus hijos el estudio.
texts.en:
Juan is 33 years old, married and has four children. He has been a farmer all his life and learned the job from his parents. He is an honest and responsible person with  values and principles and he has a good reputation in his community. His is a united family. He is a day laborer and states that he wants to give his family a better life.

He is applying for a loan from Fundación Campo in order to buy 26 sheets of metal, nails and to pay workers to build a new kitchen in his house.  Thus he will build a kitchen for his family that is safer during the rainy season and provide a more respectable home since his dream is to build a house out of concrete blocks as well as to provide an education for his children.

loans.use: to purchase 25 metal sheets that cost $325 and nails and to pay workers to build a new kitchen in his house.

loans.name: Libardo Antonio Ciro

texts.es:
Sin grandes recursos económicos, y con grandes adversidades que se le presentaron en el camino, Libardo ha tenido la fortaleza para montar su propio negocio de venta de verduras y legumbres en la plaza de mercado de su municipio, con el cual ha tenido la oportunidad de generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar donde convive con su esposa y sus 9 hijos. Libardo anteriormente vivía junto con su esposa y sus hijos en un municipio del cual fue desplazado por la violencia, y por lo cual se vio en la obligación de dejar todas sus pertenencias a un lado e iniciar su vida desde cero trabajando fuertemente. De allí, se mudó para el municipio de Rionegro y desde el cual pudo montar su negocio y así generar los ingresos para su hogar. Libardo, gracias a la buena atención que ofrece en su negocio, ha tenido grandes pedidos de sus clientes, por lo que busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de verduras y legumbres para surtir su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Libardo espera que de esta manera su negocio se acredite cada vez más y pueda captar un mayor número de clientes. Además, Libardo espera que con mayores ingresos su familia tenga la oportunidad de acceder a una mejor calidad de vida. Libardo sueña con tener un gran negocio bien ubicado y bien acreditado en la plaza de mercado y desde el cual pueda generar empleo para los más necesitados y una estabilidad económica para su familia.
texts.en: Without many financial resources and facing great adversity that presented itself along the way, Libardo has had the strength to set up his own business selling vegetables in the marketplace in his town.  His business has provided the opportunity to generate the necessary income to support his home where he lives with his wife and their 9 children. Libardo previously lived with his wife and their children in another town and were displaced by violence.  They were forced to leave all of their belongings behind and start over from zero, working very hard.  From there, they moved to the town of Rionegro and were able to set up a business to generate income for their home.  Libardo, has received large orders from his customers, thanks to the good customer service he provides.  He is therefore requesting a loan that will enable him to buy vegetables to stock his business and meet his customers' needs. Libardo hopes that his business continues to gain credibility and he can attract more customers.  Libardo also hopes that with more income his family will be able to have a better quality of life.  Libardo dreams of having a large business that is well located and well respected in the marketplace, so that he can generate employment for people who most need it and provide financial stability for his family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to stock his business and meet his customers' needs.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
La señora Pascuala tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos. Ella se ha dedicado toda su vida a realizar oficios domésticos, es una persona con valores, principios, responsable, posee buena reputación en la comunidad, es una familia unida y tienen el proyecto de mejorar su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 50 bolsas de cemento que cuestan $375 dólares, 300 bloques que cuestan $135 dólares, hierro y pago de mano de obra para construir una fosa séptica. Ella manifiesta que solo necesita una parte del dinero, ya que la otra la tiene de unos ahorros. Pascuala vive a unos 4 kilómetros de la zona urbana de la ciudad. Así ella dispondrá de los materiales para construir la fosa séptica y mejorar su casa, para tener una mejor salud en su familia.

La señora Pascuala, desea continuar trabajando con la Fundación Campo, comprar una vaca, cerdos, para trabajar en la agricultura y brindarle el estudio a su familia para mejorar la calidad de vida de ellos.
texts.en:
Pascuala, 50, is a single mother with 2 children.  She has devoted her whole life to caring for her household.  She is a responsible person with values and principles, and she has a good reputation in the community.  Her family is very united, and they plan to do some improvements to their house.

She is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy 50 sacks of cement that cost $375 dollars, 300 cement blocks that cost $135 dollars, steel and labor to build a septic tank.  She says that she only needs to borrow part of the money, because she will fund the rest of the project from her savings.  Pascuala lives 4 kilometers from the urban part of the city.  She will use these materials to build a septic tank and improve her house, so her family can have healthier living conditions.

Pascuala wants to continue working with the Fundación Campo so that she can buy a cow and pigs and work in agriculture.  This way, she can provide her children with an education and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cement, cement blocks, steel and labor to build a septic tank

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret lives in Yei. She has a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 26 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are still in school. 

Margret heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for sale.

loans.name: Nelda Dela Cruz

texts.en:
Nelda owns and manages a general store in her village, while her husband manages their rice farming business. They endure the hardships and difficulties they encounter in life because they want to educate their three children and give them a bright future. She and her husband have planned to improve their sources of income so that they can satisfy their needs and support the education of their children.

To work out their plan, Nelda is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, oils, sugar, and soaps to sell in her store. Through this loan, she believes that she will make improvements in her business and hopes that she will be successful in carrying them out.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, oils, sugar, and soaps to sell in her store.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Tièssiri, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Madoudiarrabougou, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de galettes, de poissons et de savons.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Tièssiri sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter du mil, des poissons frais et du savon.                                                                          
M’PENIN, deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debouts, compte acheter 100 kg de poissons frais des poisson auprès des revendeur de Fana et de Dioïla pour ensuite les revendre au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour faire face aux besoins personnels et de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The women of the Tièssiri group are all married.  They are, on average, 32 years old, have three children each, and live in extended traditional families in the village of Madoudiarrabougou, in the Fana sub-prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative district of Mali).  They know each other because they are relatives, neighbors or friends.  They sell galettes (flat cakes), fish and soap.

These women are on to their third solidarity loan, which they will use to buy millet, fresh fish and soap.

In the photo, M'PENIN, is the second woman from the right in the standing row.  She is planning to buy 100 kilos of fresh fish from resellers in Fana and Dioïla.  She will then resell these fish in her village, for cash or on credit, to customers of both genders.  She is expecting average monthly profits to reach 20,000 CFA francs which will be used to meet her personal needs as well as those of her children.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Myrna Pascual

texts.en:
Myrna is a 40-year-old mother who is engaged in direct selling of AVON, NATASHA, and MSE products in her village to generate income. She has three school-age children. Despite financial difficulty, she wants to continue sending her children to school because she wants them to earn degrees and become professionals someday. 

Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Myrna aims to improve her business to increase her income. She wants to ask for additional capital of PHP 32,000 to buy lotions, body sprays, underwear, and roll-on to sell in her village. She believes that through her patience and sacrifices, she will improve the business and make it a viable and profitable source of income.

loans.use: to buy lotions, body sprays, underwear, and roll-on to sell in her village.

loans.name: Marine Melikyan

texts.en:
Marine is 30 years old. She lives in Khndzoresk village in the south of Armenia with her family: her husband and three little children. The main income for the family comes from agriculture. Marine's farm includes ten cows. Marine sells meat and milk from the farm in Kapan city regional center. 

After the long lasting winter season, which has been very cold, Marine has challenges with feeding the cattle. She has applied for this loan to purchase necessary forage for the cows. This will help Marine to continue successful breeding of the cows and have a stable income from meat and milk sales.

loans.use: to pay for forage.

loans.name: Hikmatullo

texts.ru: Хикматулло добрый и трудолюбивый семьянин. Более 17 лет Хикматулло занимается купле- продажей сладостей на базаре. У него широкий ассортимент конфет и печеньев. Вначале у него был небольшой товарооборот,  и он постепенно расширил бизнес. Хикматулло запрашивает займ для покупки конфет, печеньев и вафель. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Hikmatullo is a kind and hardworking family man. Hikmatullo has been buying and selling sweets on the market for more than seventeen years. He has a wide range of candy and cookies. In the beginning he had a small merchandise turnover, but gradually he has expanded his business. Hikmatullo is asking for a loan to buy candy, cookies and waffles. He is hoping for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy sweets.

loans.name: Amelia Soberano

texts.en:
To earn a living, Amelia and her husband help each other in managing their farm lots by planting rice and onions for sale. They have been farmers for more than 18 years, usually earning a profit of P25,000 each cropping. They want to increase their yields and income to pay for the necessities of life and support the education of their two children.

Amelia is now requesting a loan of P31,000 to buy onions, fertilizers and pesticides to expand their onion production. She and her husband believe that they will be able to increase their yields and income through their patience and hard work.

loans.use: to buy onions, fertilizers and pesticides needed in onion production.

location.town: Brgy. Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Luz Adiela Gomez

texts.es:
Luz Adiela es una persona muy trabajadora que siempre ha querido ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. Luz Adiela se encuentra casada y es madre de 1 hijo de 5 meses, quien es su motivación para trabajar fuertemente en su negocio. Hace aproximadamente 13 años se dedica a la actividad de la peluquería, la cual aprendió en una academia y gracias a esto consiguió empleo en un salón de belleza. Debido a que sentía que su trabajo era muy mal remunerado, decidió independizarse y desde hace 6 meses aproximadamente montó su propio salón de belleza donde ofrece un muy buen servicio a sus clientes. Luz Adiela ya es reconocida en el sector por el buen servicio que ofrece y por la calidad de su trabajo, y gracias a esto el negocio en poco tiempo ha podido tener un gran crecimiento. Debido a que su negocio fue montado con muy bajo capital, Luz Adiela busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de belleza y a realizar mejoras locativas a su negocio. 

Luz Adiela espera que de esta manera su negocio siga creciendo y siga brindándole la oportunidad de tener una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Luz Adiela sueña con tener un gran negocio en el cual pueda generar empleo para los más necesitados y con el cual pueda ofrecerle a su familia mayores oportunidades económicas.
texts.en:
Luz Adiela is a very hard-working person who has always wanted to offer her family a better quality of life.  Luz Adiela is married, and the mother of a 5-month-old son, who is her motivation for working hard in her business. 

She has been a hairdresser for approximately 13 years, a trade she learned at an academy, and thanks to this she got a job in a beauty salon. Due to the fact she felt her work was very poorly paid, she decided to go independent, and around six months ago, set up her own beauty salon. There she provides a very good service to her customers.

Luz Adiela is already well-known in the neighborhood for the good service she offers, and for the quality of her work. Thanks to this, the business has been able to grow quite a bit in a short time. Due to the fact her business was set up with very low capital, Luz Adiela is seeking a loan that will offer her the chance to purchase beauty products and upgrade her business premises. 

Luz Adiela hopes that in this way, her business will continue growing, and keep offering her family the chance to have a better quality of life. Luz Adiela dreams of having a large business where she can generate employment for those who need it most, and through which she can offer her family greater economic opportunities.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and upgrade her business premises.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es: Hernán, de 67 años es un hombre vital. Vive en compañía de su esposo a la que cuida en su casa propia ubicada en el anexo de Ocoro – Colcabamba. Cuando se unió a su pareja, dedicó su tiempo y fuerza en la agricultura, la siembra de diversos productos como habas, alverja y demás tubérculos eran su especialidad. Se siente feliz por ello, pues todo lo que logró fue gracias a sus cultivos. Pero con el tiempo, sus fuerzas no eran las mismas, fue así que decidió incursionar en el negocio de compra de granos verdes, donde todos los fines de semana, mira sus ganancias en la venta que realiza en la feria de Pampas, ya que cuenta que durante la semana se encarga de recolectar de los proveedores. Cuenta que a pesar de la inconveniencia que tienen, se siente deseoso de seguir trabajando muy duro. Asta el día en que las fuerzas lo abandonen. “Tolo lo que realizó es para ver a mi mujer tranquila”, concluye. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Virgen candelaria” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada y feliz, ya que espera obtener el préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete pagar puntual sus cuotas. Pues es una persona responsable y solidaria. Hernán de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de granos para su negocio.
texts.en: Hernán, 68 years old, is a man full of vitality. He lives in the company of his wife to whom he cares for in his own house located in the anex of Ocoro – Colcabamba. When they got married, he dedicated his time to the force of agriculture, the seed of diverse products like lima beans, peas, and also root crops were his speciality. He is happy for this, as all that he achieved was thanks to his crops. But with time, his strength wasn't the same, and so it was decided to enter the business of purchasing green beans, where every weekend, he watches his earnings in the sales that he makes at the Pampas market. Since during the week, he is responsible for collecting from the suppliers. He says that in spite of the inconveniences they have, he feels eager to continue working very hard. Until one day his strength abandonded him. "All I did was to see my wife peaceful" he concluded. He belongs to the group "Virgen candelaria and this is his third loan with MFP, where he felt developed and happy. He hope to obtain the loan in order to continue with his objectives. Also, he promises to pay his payments punctually, as he is a responsible and caring person. From receiving your support, Hernán will invest the requested funds into the purchase of grains for his business.

loans.use: to buy grain to supply his business.

loans.name: Selly Chemutai

texts.en: Selly has requested her third loan from KADET LTD for KES. 41,800  to pay her child's university tuition.  Her dairy farm is generating income with which she will repay the loan. Selly's dream is to live a happy life and improve her dairy farm.

loans.use: to pay her child's university tuition.

loans.name: Ayde

texts.es: Ayde, de 32 años es una mujer independiente. Vive en compañía de Edwin, su esposo con quien vive en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Ocoro – Colcabamba. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer tímida, pero alegre. Su principal ingreso económico se centra en la comercialización de granos verdes, los cuales le otorgan un ingreso semanal y constante. Antes gustaba de la siembra, comenta que no deja de hacerlo pero solo para su propio consumo, ya que existen varios que se dedican a esa actividad. Ella no quiere ser una más, por eso emprendió este negocio nuevo y de ganancias estables. Ahora desea comprar un lugar estable en una zona de comercio para poder negociar sus menestras a buen precio y proyectarse a ser una empresaria mayorista. “Esa es mi meta, espero conseguirlo con el apoyo de mi esposo y familia, sobre todo porque mis hijos son pequeños y necesitarán de nosotros más adelante”, afirma. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Virgen candelaria” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada y feliz, ya que espera obtener el préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete pagar puntual sus cuotas. Pues es una persona responsable y solidaria. Ayde re recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de granos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Ayde, 32, is an independent woman who lives with her husband, Edwin in their own house, on the outskirts of Ocoro-Colcambamba.  She is characterized as being a shy woman, but cheerful.  Her main business is selling fresh legumes which gives her a weekly and regular income.  In the past she liked to farm, she says, and she still does, but only for personal consumption.  There are others who farm and she doesn’t want to be one more.  


 That is why she started her new business and it is giving her regular earnings.  Now she wants to buy a fixed place in a commercial zone to be able to sell her legumes at a good price and she plans to be a wholesale entrepreneur in the future.  “This is my goal, and I hope to succeed with help from my husband and family. My goal is especially for my children who are young, and will need our support later on".  She belongs to the communal bank “Virgen candelaria” and this is her third loan with MFP.  She feels supported and happy now that she  is expecting a loan to help with her objectives.  She promises to make her payments punctually since she is a responsible and serious person.  Ayde will use the requested money to buy legumes for her business.

loans.use: to buy grain to stock her business

loans.name: John Kamunya Mwai

texts.en: John, a 39-year-old married father of two, has been repairing autos to earn a living for 14 years, and employs two people. His business environment is busy because he is visited regularly by his customers. Since joining Faulu Kenya, John has been able to improve his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He is now requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.use: to buy motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Julieta Gharibyan

texts.en:
Julieta is 61 years old. She lives in Agarak town with her son. Julieta works at a local factory as an electrician. Because her salary was not enough to cover the family's daily costs, Julieta started running a farm. About 10 years ago she started running an orchard. After 6 years Julieta also got involved in cattle breeding. Now Julieta plans to expand her farm by purchasing two cows. With the help from this loan, she will also purchase necessary forage for the cattle.

This loan will help Julieta to increase the income from agriculture and live with a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for cows and forage.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 37 años es una mujer alegre. Vive en compañía de Virgilio, su esposo desde hace 20 años. Ambos cuidan de sus 5 hijos a los que crían en su casa propia ubicada en el anexo de Viñas. Su principal desea es dedicarse a la ganadería con la crianza de animales en especial de vacas, de las que quiere aprovechar la leche que suministra para realizar todo tipo de productos lácteos. Cuenta que posee 2 vacas, de las que muy pronto comenzaran a proporcionarle leche. Además de ello tiene cerdos. Sigue firme en este deseo y ya muy pronto piensa adquirir más animales. Mientras tanto trabaja como peón en otras chacras, cuenta que lo realiza de 2 a 3 veces por semana, le gusta mucho cultivar los sembríos y quitar la maleza que crece entre los surcos, eso la hace sentirse en paz, asimismo su esposo se dedica al trabajo de albañilería, por ahora solo es ayudante, pero muy pronto desea aprender más para ser albañil y no ayudante. Sabe que lo conseguirá, pues estos deseos de superación hacen que ellos se mantengan firmes y que paso a paso logren sus objetivos. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada y feliz, ya que espera obtener el préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete pagar puntual sus cuotas. Pues es una persona responsable y solidaria. María de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de calaminas, ventanas y puertas para poder acondicionar el establo de sus animales.
texts.en: María, 37 years old, is a happy woman. She lives with Virgilio, her husband of 20 years. Together they care for their 5 children whom they raise in their own house located in the annex of Viñas. her greatest desire is to earn a living raising animals, especially cows from whom she wants to use the milke that they produce to make all types of dairy products. She says that she has 2 cows, from whom she quickly began to supply milk. Addition she has pigs. She stays strong in this desire and already wants to quickly acquire more animals.
