The woman who form the Balimaya group are all married, are on average 33 years old with three children, and all live in traditional homes with their extended families in the village of Madoudiarrabougou, prefecture of Fana, in the region of Koulikoro (second largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They know each other through linkages of family, neighborhood and friendship. They are all involved in the commerce of food condiments, wood, and grains.

The women in the group are asking for their fourth loan in order to purchase millet, wood and condiments. Oumou (second person from the right in the group of standing women in the photo), plans to stock up on bulk quantities of condiments in Fana and Dioïla, and then re-sell these products in her village. She sells on credit or cash to a customer base largely comprised of women. She hopes to gain monthly profits of 20,000 FCFA [approximately 40.50 USD] to take care of her needs and that of her children.

loans.use: purchase condiments

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: Arturo, de 47 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, además de solidario y amable.  Está casado con Belén  quien le apoya en el negocio que tienen y es madre de sus 3 hijos.  Vive juntos cómodamente instalados en la casa de su suegra, en compañía de sus cuñados. La actividad que realiza Arturo es la elaboración y venta de bebidas como refrescos y néctares de pulpa de frutas amazónicas como cocona, camu camu y otros, para esto cuenta con unas maquinas que compró con sus ahorros, instalada en la casa de sus suegros, quienes no le cobran por alquiler,y desde atiende a sus clientes. Se inicio con un préstamo privado más capital propio hace 05 años, pero por falta de capital no pudo industrializar sus productos, realizándolo de manera informal, contando con el apoyo de su pareja en la atención y manejo de personal. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener una ocupación para brindar una mejor calida de vida a sus pequeños hijos a los que quiere mucho, además de los ingresos económicos que le genera para pagar los gastos de su hogar. Por lo contrario lo que no le gusta es cuando llueve muy seguido pues le dificulta la venta de su producto pues depende en algo del clima para mejorar sus ventas, pero eso no la desanima y tiene planes de aumentar la variedad de sus productos con bebidas, además de industrializar y formalizarse como empresa llegando a ser un prospero empresario. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además de sentirse cómoda con su banco comunal pues los considera personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de frutas amazónicas, así poder elaborar diversos sabores, como para variar su stock buscando precios más bajos por sus compras al contado.
texts.en:
Arturo, 47, is a hard-working, persevering man who is also caring and kind.  He is married to Belén who helps him with their business and is the mother of three children.  They live together comfortably in his mother-in-law's house, together with his brothers and sisters-in-law.  Arturo sells softdrinks and pulp nectar from Amazon fruits such as cocona, camu camu and others.  He used his savings to buy the equipment he uses which is set up at his in-laws' house, where he does not have to pay rent, and where he attends to his customers.  

He began the business with a loan and his own capital five years ago, but due to lack of capital was unable to industrialize his product.  So he does business informally with his wife's help regarding employee attention and management.  He enjoys his business because it allows him to provide a better lifestyle for his small children who he loves very much.  The income also covers household expenses.  What he does not like is the rain because it makes selling his products difficult.  He depends on the climate as far as sales are concerned, but this does not affect his plans to increase beverage product variety and set up a company where he can be a prosperous business owner.  

This is his third loan through MFP and he is hoping a small loan will help him meet his goals.  He is comfortable with his communal bank because all the members are responsible and caring.  The 1,500 PEN loan will be used to buy Amazon fruits to make different flavors and vary his stock, paying cash to get discount rates.

loans.use: To buy fruit from the Amazon.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, de 41 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y amable, además de ser trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Está separada del padre de su hija Joselin de 4 años de edad. Habita cómodamente su propia casa en compañía de  su hija que la quiere mucho. La actividad que tiene Isabel es la venta de bebidas gaseosas de diferentes marcas y sabores, además de golosinas que compra en los centros comerciales de la ciudad. Todos estos productos son adquiridos al contando y son vendidos desde su casa a sus vecinos y transeúntes quienes son sus clientes habituales. Tiene más de 5 años dedicándose  éste negocio y por el momento solo cuenta con el apoyo de su mamá quien atiende a los clientes cuando ella está fuera de casa.
Considera a su negocio rentable por las ganancias que le deja. Tuvo dificultades por la separación con el padre de su hija, pues la pensión que le pasa no alcanza para cubrir todos sus gastos de alimentación y educación teniendo que empezar a trabajar por cuenta propia. Le gusta su negocio por los ingresos económicos y el poder tener una ocupación, además el poder estar en la comodidad de su casa y contar con tiempo disponible para dedicarlos a otras actividades. Por tanto tiene planes de ampliar su negocio e incursionar en la venta de comida rápida. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues le gusta el trabajo que vienen realizando apoyando a las personas. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para surtir su bodega como golosinas y gaseosas de diversas marcas y sabores, buscando precios más bajos por sus compras al contado, de esa manera tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Isabel, 41, is a cheerful, kind woman who is also a hard worker and determined to get ahead.  She is divorced from the father of her beloved four-year-old daughter, Joselin, who she lives with comfortably in her own house.  Isabel works selling different brands and flavors of sodas and sweets that she buys at shopping centers in the city.  She buys everything in cash and sells from home to passers-by who are her habitual customers.  She has been in business for over five years and, for now, is helped out only by her mother who attends to customers when she is not home.

She believes her business is profitable because of the earnings she can make.  When she divorced her daughter's father, things were difficult because the pension he paid was not enough to cover food and education costs, so she decided to work for herself.  She likes what she does because it gives her an income and keeps her busy.  And, since she works at home she has free time to dedicate to other activities.  Therefore, she has plans to expand the business and go into the fast food sector.  

This is her third loan through MFP and she is hoping a small loan will help her meet her goals.  She says she is happy with her communal bank because she likes the work it does toward helping people.  The 1,000 PEN loan will be used to buy merchandise such as different brands and flavors of sweets and sodas.  She will pay cash and seek out the lowest prices in order to increase her earnings.

loans.use: To buy sweets and sodas.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz, de 66 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, alegre y muy amble, le gusta los retos. Es conviviente con Abdias quien es desempleado, fruto de esa unión tuvieron  03 hijos que son independientes. Juntos viven cómodamente instalados en su propia casa en compañía de su nieto de 18 años de edad. El negocio que tiene Luz es la venta de comidas, para eso tiene un pequeño puesto ubicado al frente de una posta de salud, donde ofrece variados platos de la región a su distinguida clientela, levantándose de muy temprano para realizar las compras de sus ingredientes para la preparación del día, pagando un precio cómodo que le permite tener un mayor margen de ganancias. Ya  lleva 7 años en éste negocio atendiendo a sus clientes contando con el apoyo de su pareja  para atender al público.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la clientela constante que tiene y ha sabido ganarse por la buena sazón de sus comidas. Le gusta su negocio pues le ha traído muchas satisfacciones personales y económicas, ya que lo ha visto crecer iniciándose  con venta de jugos, pasando  a la venta de comidas en una mesa ambulatoria, ahora contando con un local, sabiéndose ganar un buena clientela, y le deja buenas ganancias, viendo esto tiene planes solo de mantenerse en el negocio por la edad que tiene. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues cuenta con su apoyo permanente.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de golosinas para mejorar la variedad de sus productos a ofertar a sus clientes, así como también los ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas, buscando precios más cómodos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Luz, 66, is an enterprising, cheerful, very kind woman who likes challenges.  She has a common-law husband, Abdias, who is unemployed, and they have three independent children.  They live comfortably in their own home with an 18-year-old grandson.  Luz sells food for a living and has a small stall outside a healthcare center where she offers regional dishes to her distinguished customers.  She gets up very early to buy the food ingredients she needs every day, and pays a comfortable price which allows her to earn more profit.  She has been in business for seven year and attends to her customers with her husband's help.

She believes her business is fairly profitable because of the consistent number of customers she has been able to attract with her delicious food.  She likes what she does because it has brought her much personal and economic satisfaction, having watched as the business grew from selling only juice, then food as a street vendor, and now having her own stall with many customers and good profits.  Because of this, her only plans at this age are to keep the business going.  This is her third loan through MFP and she hopes a small loan will help her meet her dreams.  She likes her communal bank because it is her permanent support.

The 1,500 PEN loan will be used to buy sweets to increase the variety of products on offer, and also food ingredients, seeking the best prices for bulk purchases.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
Martha es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y gracias a esta cualidad ha podido salir adelante con su esposo y su hijo. Martha proviene de una familia de campesinos, por lo que ha aprendido la actividad de la crianza de animales desde muy temprana edad. Con su esposo tiene en su hogar un cultivo de legumbres y con las vacas lecheras que cuida Martha, generan los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Con el ánimo de comprar más vacas para su terreno, Martha busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de 2 vacas lecheras para su terreno.

Martha espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, pues podrá vender más leche a sus clientes y esto se traducirá en que su familia goce de una mejor calidad de vida. Martha sueña con tener un gran negocio en el cual además de criar vacas lecheras, pueda criar pollos, cerdos, ganado, entre otros.
texts.en:
Martha has always been known as a hard worker, and thanks to this quality she and her husband and son have been able to get ahead.  Martha comes from a family of farmers so she learned about raising livestock from a very early age.  She and her husband grow vegetables and, with the dairy cattle that Martha looks after, they generate enough income to maintain their household.  In order to buy more cattle for her land, Martha is requesting a loan to buy two dairy cows.

Martha hopes to be able to increase her earnings considerably because she will be able to sell milk to her customers, meaning her family will have a better quality of life.  Martha's goal is to have a large business raising dairy cattle, chickens, pigs, and other livestock.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Mauricio De Jesus Betancur

texts.es:
Mauricio es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y siempre querer ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Mauricio es padre de 2 hijos y se encuentra separado de la madre de sus hijos, por lo que debe garantizar a sus 2 hijos el sustento necesario para una buena calidad de vida. Mauricio tiene un corral de pollos, el cual junto con la otra actividad que desempeña Mauricio como moto-taxista, generan los ingresos que requiere para poder ofrecer a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida. Debido a que su negocio de los pollos lo inició hace muy poco con muy bajo capital, Mauricio busca que un préstamo le permita acceder a la compra de 50 pollos para la crianza, además de realizar algunas adecuaciones a un sótano donde podrá acomodar 2 corrales más de pollos. 
Mauricio espera que de esta manera pueda seguir aumentando la cantidad de pollos para la venta y de esta manera el aumento de sus ingresos. Mauricio sueña con ver crecer su negocio y con que sus hijos puedan acceder a una educación de mayor calidad.
texts.en:
Mauricio is known for being a very hard worker, always providing the best quality of life possible for his family.  He is the father of two children and is separated from their mother, so he must guarantee the support necessary for his children to have a quality lifestyle.  Mauricio raises chickens and also works as a motor-taxi driver to earn a living to provide for his sons.  Since his chicken business was started with only a small amount of capital, Mauricio is seeking a loan to buy 50 more chickens and to renovate a basement for two more chicken pens.

Mauricio hopes to increase the number of chickens he sells to increase his income.  His goal is to expand his activity so his children can get a good education.

loans.use: To buy 50 chickens and renovate a basement for two more chicken pens.

loans.name: Jakeline

texts.es: Jakeline, de 23 años, es una joven emprendedora. Vive en compañía de Juancarlos; su esposo desde hace un año. Ambos tienen un pequeño hijo de 4 meses de nacido, al que quieren mucho y pusieron como nombre  Carlos Cruz. Por ahora viven en casa de su madre, ubicada en la Florida. Cuando comenzó a trabajar en la asociación era una joven trabajadora, que luchaba para sacar adelante a su madre y hermanos, ahora que tiene su propia familia, piensa hacer lo mismo junto a su hijo y esposo. Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca a nivel mundial, lo hace con la modalidad de catálogos, donde sus clientes observan lo que les agrada y realizan los pedidos. En todo este tiempo pudo obtener productos en stock, por ello ya tiene una capital de dinero asegurado. Pero la actividad económica más rentable, se centra en la crianza de pollos, los cuales vende junto a su madre a un reconocido restaurante de la ciudad. Cuenta que junto a su madre están pensando, acondicionar un espacio que tiene en su casa, bastante grande. Donde puedan criar más pollos y de esa manera abastecer los pedidos que tienen, ya se encuentra planeando estrategias para hacer realidad el proyecto. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “tambo al progreso” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible el dinero, pues permite a muchas personas que como ella salen adelante. Jakeline de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 400 pollos pequeños para comenzar con su proyecto.
texts.en: Jakeline, 23 years old, is a young entrepreneur. She lives with Juan Carlos, her husband of one year. They have a small son who's 4 months old and whom they love very much. His name is Carlos Cruz. For now they live in the home of her mother, located in La Florida. When she began to work with the association she was a young worker who fought to get her mother and siblings ahead. Now that she has her own family she plans on doing the same together with her son and husband. She makes a living selling beauty products of a brand that's well-known on the global level. She does this by means of catalogs where her clients see what they like and then make their orders. During this time she was able to obtain products in stock and because of this she already has a secure financial capital. But the most profitable financial activity is centered around raising chicken, which she sells together with her mother to a well-known restaurant in the city. She says that she and her mother are planning on setting up a very large space that she has in her home where they can raise more chicken and in this way supply the orders they have. She is already planning strategies to make this project a reality. She belongs to the solidarity group "Tambo al progreso" and this is her fourth loan with MFP. She is very thankful for all the people who make the money possible as it allows many people like her to get ahead. After receiving support, Jakeline will invest the requested money in the purchase of 400 small chicken to begin her project.

loans.use: to buy 400 small chicken.

loans.name: Mujeres De Chajabal Group

texts.es:
Doña Lidia es una señora casada, tiene 32 años de edad, curso los seis años de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos los cuales estudian la educación primaria, se dedica a los oficios domestico y a la confección de playeras, y brinda atención a una tienda de consumo diario, inició el negocio de la tienda con la ayuda de su esposo y lleva 8 años de experiencia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizaran para la compra de aguas gaseosa, jugos, cereales, fideos, huevos, y entre otros productos, espera ver en el futuro un negocio grande y surtido. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la atención a tienda de consumo diario, venta de ropa típica, tejido de cortes típicos y a la crianza de animales. En la foto hay 12 integrantes, pero solo calificaron 11 para el crédito.
texts.en:
Lidia is a married woman who's 32 years old and finished the first six years of elementary school. She has 3 children who are in elementary school. She makes a living doing housework, making t-shirts, and working in a daily goods store. She began the store business with the help of her husband and has 8 years of experience. She relies on the support of her husband who makes a living selling clothing.

She organized a group to request a loan that they used to buy water, soft drinks, juice, cereals, noodles, and eggs, among other products. In the future she hope to see a large and stocked business. The rest of the female members of the group make a living working in the daily goods store, selling traditional clothing, traditionally cut fabric, and raising animals. In the picture there are 12 members but only 11 qualified for the loan.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina, de 48 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Mauro, su esposo desde hace 30 años. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 6 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Huayucachi. Por el progreso y desarrollo de su familia, trabaja sin descanso, su principal ingreso económico se centra en el crecimiento de animales como cerdos y ovejas. Los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, para luego vender su carne al mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde los carniceros son conocedores de su negocio, pues ya tiene muchos años dedicándose a ello. Obtiene mucha ganancia en ello. Cada día sale a vender, como ella dice, en compañía de Dios, pues si no vende la totalidad de la carne, se malogra y le produce muchas pérdidas. Durante este tiempo le está, logrando mucho progreso por ello trabajará con mucho esmero para seguir, así. Su principal estrategia es vender todo lo que pueda en las temporadas altas, como en el mes de mayo, de esa manera podrá ahorrar y aprovechar los meses de mayor demanda. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde agradece al apoyo de los que hacen posibles el préstamo, además promete ser puntual con el pago de las cuotas, pues los integrantes de su asociación son personas responsables y solidarias.  
Marina de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más animales par su negocio.
texts.en:
Marina, 48 years old, is a hardworking woman. She lives with Mauro, her husband of 30 years. Together they have 8 children of which only 6 live with them in their home located in the locality of Huayucachi. Due to the progress and development of their family, she works without rest. Her main financial income centers around the raising of animals like pigs and sheep which she cares for very carefully in order to later sell their meat in the city's wholesale market. There, the butchers are experts of her business, so for many years she has made a living doing this and obtains good earnings from this. Every day she goes out to sell, as she says, in God's company. If she doesn't sell all of the meat, it goes bad and she suffers many losses. During this time she is making a lot of progress and for this reason she will work very carefully to continue as such. Her main strategy is to sell all that she can in the high seasons like the month of May. In this way she will be able to save and take advantage of the months with the higher demand. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She is thankful for the support of those who make the loans possible. Moreover she promises to be punctual with her payments. The members of her association are responsible and supportive people.

Upon receiving support, Marina will invest the requested money in the purchase of more animals for her business.

loans.use: to buy more animals.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Martina, de 41 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de sus 3 hijos: Nely, Joel y Dany a los cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Aza. Hace 7 años se separó de su esposo, desde ese entonces comenzó su travesía en poder sacar adelante a sus hijos. Su principal ingreso económico es la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de abarrotes, donde tiene 20 años de experiencia. Todos la conocen y compran los alimentos en su negocio, pero como es una mujer trabajadora, también se dedica a la siembra de productos como: papa, maíz y alfalfa en sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Los que comercializa en el mercado cercano a su localidad. Asimismo tiene 2 vacas lecheras que le brindan 10 litros de leche cada una, con esa leche puede obtener un ingreso extra ya que vende a los pobladores de la zona. Cuenta que ahora se encuentran preñadas y muy pronto darán una cría de buena raza, de esa manera su establo aumentará, pues tiene cuyes y cerdos, que también vende a los carniceros que llegan a su propia casa. Este es el décimo sexto crédito con MFP, donde agradece al apoyo de los que hacen posibles el préstamo, además promete ser puntual con el pago de las cuotas, pues los integrantes de su asociación son personas responsables y solidarias. Martina de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles, asimismo en útiles de escritorio para mejorar la venta de su tienda en esta campaña escolar.
texts.en: Martina, 41 years old, is a hardworking woman. She lives with her 3 children- Nely, Joel, and Dany- whom she takes care of in her home located in the locality of Aza. Seven years ago she separated from her husband and since then began her journey to get her children ahead. Her main financial income comes from selling essential items in her grocery store where she has 20 years of experience. Everyone knows her and buys food from her business, but as she is a hardworking woman, she also makes a living planting crops like potato, corn, and alfalfa on her own farming land which she sells in the market near her locality. Also, she has two dairy cows that each provide 10 liters of milk. With this milk she is able to obtain extra income since she sells it to the inhabitants of the area. She says that they are now pregnant and that very soon they will give birth to cows of a good breed, increasing her cow shed. She has guinea pigs and pigs that she also sells to the butchers that come to her house. This is her sixteen loan with MFP. She is thankful for the support of those who are making her loan possible. Moreover, she promises to be punctual with the payments. The members of her association are responsible and supportive people. Upon receiving support, Martina will invest the requested money in the purchase of essential items for her grocery store and also in school supplies in order to improve her store's sales during this school year.

loans.use: to buy essential items and school supplies to sell.

loans.name: John Musungu Iravonga

texts.en:
John is 30 years old and married with 2 children. He sells cereals to earn a living. He has been in the business for 6 years and has employed one person. He describes his customers as low income earners because they live in slums.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 70,000 Kenyan shillings to buy cereals to sell.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in Yambio. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for one year. She is 25 years old, married and has three children. Two of them are still in school.

Alice heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 400 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Glenda Sambile

texts.en:
Glenda is 42 years old, married and has three children. To make a living, Glenda owns and operates a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from tending a canteen in the village. Edna has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Now she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase meat and vegetables to cook and sell. Glenda plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase meat and vegetables to cook and sell

loans.name: Mostafa Al-Mtour

texts.en:
Mostafa is a 37-year-old engaged man. He is preparing to get married soon. He is a taxi driver, but earns a low salary which is not enough to cover all of life's costs and expenses.

Mostafa is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover part of his wedding expenses such as paying for necessary new home furniture and appliances. This will enable Mostafa to prepare well for his wedding and enjoy this occasion, and to live in suitable conditions with his wife.

Mostafa is photographed next to the taxi he drives.

loans.use: to help in paying part of his wedding expenses

loans.name: Susan Kairu

texts.en:
Susan is 25 years old and she owns a butcher shop in Mikindani, Mombasa. She is married and the mother of one child. Her business has been in operation for the past two years. The business is doing great.

This marks her first business loan from KADET Ltd to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to renovate her butchery premises. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her child and expand her business further. She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to renovate her butchery

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 57 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Luis, su esposo desde hace 26 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Omar y Eder a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Sicaya. Todos los días camina largos tramos, para llegar a los anexos de Auquispuquio y Colpa, donde sen encuentran sus terrenos agrícolas, donde siembra alfalfa, maíz, zanahoria y papa. Pues es ahí donde disfruta estar. Cuenta con 18 años de experiencia en el rubro. Y en cada cosecha comercializa sus sembríos en la ciudad de Huancayo, donde los comerciantes mayoristas de un reconocido mercado comprar los alimentos que producen la tierra que cuida Rosa. Pero como es una mujer muy comprometida con el trabajo en el campo, también se dedica al trabajo de peón en otros sembríos, dedica este tiempo en sus horas libres, ya que de esa manera puede ver sus sembríos y no dejarlos de lado. Asimismo se dedica a la crianza de animales como cuyes y burros, los primero le sirve para alimentar a sus familia y vender su carne cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica apremiante, lo segundo lo utiliza para carga. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “sicaya” y este es el décimo séptimo crédito con MFP, donde se siente muy feliz, pues en todo este tiempo logró obtener muchas ganancias, todo gracias al apoyo económico que le brindan. Por ello promete una vez más, cumplir con el pago de las cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación, pues todos los integrantes son personas solidarias y trabajadoras. Rosa de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero en la compra de mangas (especie de bolsas de 300 metros para regar) y la otra parte en el pago de los peones que le ayudarán en la limpieza del canal.
texts.en: Rosa, 57 years old, is a hardworking woman. She lives with Luis, her husband of 26 years. They have two children, Omar and Eder, whom they take care of in their home located in the locality of Sicaya. Every day she walks long distances to arrive at the enclosures of Auquispuqio and Colpa where her farm lands are located and where she plants alfalfa, corn, carrots, and potato. It's there that she enjoys being. She has 18 years of experience in the area and at each harvest she markets her sown fields in the city of Huancayo where the wholesale traders of a recognized market buy food that the land that Rosa takes care of produces. As she is a woman who is very committed to her work in the field, she also makes a living working as a laborer in other sown fields. She dedicates this time in her free time as in this way she can see her sown fields and not leave them to the side. Also, she makes a living raising animals like guinea pigs and donkeys. The former serves to feed her family and sell its meat when she has an urgent financial need. The latter she uses for cargo. She belongs to the communal bank "Sicaya" and this is her seventeenth loan with MFP with whom she feels very happy. In all this time she has accomplished obtaining good earnings, all thanks to the financial support that they have given her. For this reason, she promises to fulfill her payments another time. Moreover she likes to work with the association as all the members are supportive and hardworking people. Upon receiving support, Rosa will invest the money in the purchase of hoses (a type of 300-meter bag with which to irrigate) and the other part in the payment of laborers that will help her in cleaning the canal.

loans.use: to buy 300-meter irrigation hoses and to hire laborers.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 69 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de Jacinta, su esposa desde hace 39 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo  viven con su hijo Samuel, al que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Sicaya.  Durante 27 años dedicó su vida a trabajar en el instituto geofísico del Perú, cuya sede se encuentra en el valle, se desempeñaba en el área de física solar, recuerda con mucho orgullo esa etapa, ahora se jubiló y solo recibe una pensión mensual de parte del estado. Es entonces que comenzó a sembrar papa, alverja y zanahoria en sus terrenos agrícolas, de eso hace 19 años. Donde todos los días dedica su tiempo al cuidado de sus terrenos agrícolas, cuenta que en cada cosecha lo comercializa los alimentos a la capital del país, donde recibe muchas ganancias. Además comenzó con la crianza de cuyes, cuenta con 400 ejemplares, los cuales vende en la feria que se realiza los fines de semana en la ciudad, tiene clientes fijos, los que elogian la calidad de crianza que tiene. Su secreto es cuidarlos con mucho cuidado, desinfecta las jaulas con cal para que no sufran ninguna enfermedad, además constantemente los cambia de lugar para que no se estresen, de esta manera puede lograr la calidad que espera. Él pertenece al banco comunal “sicaya” y este es el décimo quinto crédito con MFP, donde se siente muy feliz, pues en todo este tiempo logró obtener muchas ganancias, todo gracias al apoyo económico que le brindan. Por ello promete una vez más, cumplir con el pago de las cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación, pues todos los integrantes son personas solidarias y trabajadoras. Juan de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes para reforzar los nutrientes de sus sembríos. Además de implementar los galpones donde cuida de sus cuyes.
texts.en: Juan is 69 years old and a hardworking man. He lives with Jacinta, his wife of 39 years. They have 4 children, but only live with their son Samuel, whom they care for in their own home, located in the community of Sicaya. For 27 years he has dedicated his life to working in the Instituto Geofísico of Peru, whose headquarters is located in the valley. He worked in the area of solar physics and remembers that time very proudly. Now he is retired and only receives a monthly pension from the state. So he began to plant potatoes, peas, and carrots on his farmland. He has done this for 19 years. He cares for his crops every day and sells every crop of food in the country's capital, where he makes a lot of profit. He also started to raise guinea pigs. He has 400 of them and sells them at a market that takes place on weekends in the city. He has regular customers who praise the quality of the animals he raises. His secret is to raise them very carefully, disinfecting the cages with lime so they don't get sick. He is also constantly changing their places so they don't get stressed. That is how he is able to achieve the quality he expects. He belongs to the “Sicaya” communal bank and this is the fifth loan he has had with MFP and he is very happy there. He has been able to make a lot of income, all thanks to the financial support they have offered him. That is why he promises once more to make his payments. He also likes to work in his association because all of the members are supportive and hardworking people. If Juan receives your support, he will invest the money he has asked for in buying fertilizer to reinforce the nutrients of his crops. He will also outfit the sheds where he raises his guinea pigs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and outfit a shed to raise guinea pigs.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros, de 33 años es una mujer singular,. Vive en compañía de Alex, su esposo desde hace 8 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Sicaya. Ella se adaptó al negocio de la familia de su esposo. La crianza de cerdos y la preparación de lechón (comida típica a base de carne de cerdo), es su principal actividad económica. Su trabajo consiste en la preparación de este sustancial plato, el cual realiza para por lo menos tres veces a la semana, ya que los vende en las fiestas que se realizan en todo el valle del Mantaro, gracias a ello conoce diversos pueblos y costumbres de los mismo. Gana muy bien en la preparación, pero cuenta que es muy cansado viajar y trasladar el enorme cerdo cocinado. Más ve recompensando, todo su esfuerzo, ya que muchos elogian su buena sazón. Ahora ella desea tener un lugar donde vender su especialidad, por ello comenzará el proyecto de abrir su propio restaurante. Sabe que lo conseguirá con la ayuda de su esposo, quien se trabaja en la gobernación de su localidad, como chofer del alcalde. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “sicaya” y este es el décimo crédito con MFP, donde se siente muy feliz, pues en todo este tiempo logró obtener muchas ganancias, todo gracias al apoyo económico que le brindan. Por ello promete una vez más, cumplir con el pago de las cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación, pues todos los integrantes son personas solidarias y trabajadoras.
Milagros de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayólicas y yeso para mejorar su horno, donde cocina el cerdo.
texts.en: Milagros is 33 years old and a singular woman. She lives with Alex, her husband of 8 years. they have 3 children whom they care for in the home they own, located in the community of Sicaya. She joined the business of her husband's family, raising pigs and cooking suckling pig (a traditional pork dish). This is her main financial activity. Her work consists of preparing this substantial dish, which she makes at least three times a week. It is sold in festivals all over the valle of Mantaro. Thanks to her job she has gotten to know different towns and customs in the area. She makes good money doing this, but says that it is very tiring to travel and transport the enormous cooked pig. But her hard work is rewarded, since many people pick her good seasoning. Now she wants a place where she can sell her specialty and she will begin a project to open her own restaurant. She knows she can do it with her husband's help. He works in the local city hall, as the mayor's driver. She belongs to the “Sicaya” communal bank and this is her tenth loan with MFP. She feels very happy there because she has been able to make good income all thanks to the financial support they have given her. That is why she promises, once again, to make her payments. She also likes to work in her association, because all of the members are supportive and hardworking people. If Milagros gets your support, she will invest the money in majolica pottery and plaster to improve the oven where she cooks the pigs.

loans.use: to buy majolica pottery and plaster to improve her oven.

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
Lai is a widow who lives in a rural area of the Sa Ang district in Cambodia. She has four children. 

Struggling to raise her children as a single mother, Lai has been working on her plantation for 40 years. This is the first cycle for Lai with Kiva field partner, VisionFund. 

In order to expand her business, Lai is requesting a loan of $1,000. She will use the loan to buy necessary material for her plantation such as seeds, fertilizers and a water pump. With these items, she will be able to produce more crops and earn more income. She hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and a water pump for her plantation.

loans.name: Adeleto Mariano

texts.en:
Adeleto is 43 years old and married with two school-age children. He aims to improve his family's status of living and give them a better life. He engages in hog-raising to generate additional income. He plans to improve his hog-raising business to increase his income and satisfy his family's needs. He has been in this business for nearly four years. He usually earns a profit of PHP 11,000, which he spends on food and allowances for his children. 

To improve the business, Adeleto is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hog-raising business. He says that the loan will enable him to improve his business and hopes that he will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hog-raising business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 46 años, es una mujer admirable. Vive en compañía de Rafael, su esposo desde hace 29 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo vive con uno de ellos, Jhon al que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Florida. La actividad que realiza es diversa, desde la venta de ropa casual y calzado, que realiza desde hace ya 3 años, hasta la preparación de pasteles. Pero la actividad que más le gusta es la crianza de pollos, según cuenta realiza una crianza de 200 a 300 animales, que cuida desde que se encuentran bebes, ya que ahí se centra el secreto de Juana, pues no se muere ningún ejemplar, ya que los 3 primeros meses los fortaleza con vitaminas e inyecciones para prevenir las enfermedades, “los cuido como a mis hijos”, comenta. Pues se siente muy triste cuando llegan el mes que tiene que vender todas las gallinas, que ya crecieron. Le va muy bien en su negocio, pues lo comercializa a un reconocido restaurante y a clientes fijos que son conocedores de la buena calidad de su carne. Ahora desea aumenta al doble la crianza de los pollos, sabe que lo conseguirá ya dio el primer paso implementando un terrenos que tiene, donde comenzará a criar los animales en sociedad con su hija. “Para ello tengo que invertir una fuerte cantidad de dinero”, concluye. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “tambo al progreso” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde está muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque son personas responsables y solidarias. Juana de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de comida balanceada, tolvas (especie de bolsas largas para que puedan alimentarse los animales) y bebederos, para que pueda cuidar a sus animales.
texts.en:
Juana, 46 years old, is an admirable woman.  She lives in the company of Rafael, her husband of 29 years.  Together they have four children, but they only live with one of them, Jhon, whom she takes care of in her home, located in the town of Florida.

The business she does is diverse; from the sale of casual clothing and footwear, which she has done for three years, to the making of cakes.  But the activity she likes most is raising chickens.  According to count, the raising of 200 to 300 animals, which she cares for from when they are babies. That is where Juana centers her secret.  So that it does not die without a copy, it is that for the first three months she strengthens them with vitamins and injections in order to prevent sickness.  "I care for them like my children," she says.  Therefore, she feels very sad when they reach the month in which she has to sell all her chickens, which have grown.  Her business is doing well since she sells to a well known restaurant and to regular customers who are connoisseurs in the good quality of its meat.  

Now, she wants to increase the raising of chickens by double.  Knowing that she will obtain it, she has already made the first step of implementing her land, where she will begin to raise the animals in partnership with her daughter.  "To do this I will have to invest a large amount of money," she concludes.

She belongs to the solidarity group "Tambo al progreso" and this is her fourth loan with MFP, where she is very happy to know that she has financial support. Furthermore, she likes being part of her association because they are responsible people and work together in solidarity.  Upon receiving the support, she will invest the money requested in purchasing balanced feed, "tolvas" (a kind of long bag used so that animals can feed), and water troughs, so that she can care for her animals.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and water troughs for her animals.

loans.name: Reina Isabel Garcia

texts.es:
Doña Reina tiene 48 años, es una persona  muy trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante, junto con ella vive su hija quien la ayuda en su negocio, ella vive en la ciudad de Choluteca, en su negocio  tiene mucha demanda ya que viene trabajando con muchos clientes desde hace 20 años ya que la calidad de sus producto son muy bueno y a precios muy accesible.
Doña Reina el financiamiento lo necesita para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, camisetas, bóxer, cameras, calzonetas etc. con el crédito espera darle un mejor servicio a su clientes cubriendo cada pedido que le hacen todas las semanas y  de esta manera agenciarse mejores ingresos para tener una mejor vida.
Doña Reina piensa a  futuro en hacer crecer su negocio propio y que su hija pueda culminar sus estudios completos.



Choluteca, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Reina is 48 years old. She is a hardworking person who wants to get ahead. She lives with her daughter, who helps with her business, in the city of Choluteca. Her business is in demand and she has been working with a  lot of customers for 20 years. the quality of her products is very good and her prices are very accessible.  

Reina needs the loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses, t-shirts, boxers, pajamas, shorts, etc. With the loan, she hopes to give her customers better service, filling every order they make every week and thus making more income to have a better life. 

Reina plans to make her business grow in the future and for her daughter to finish her studies. 



Choluteca, Honduras - Marzo del 2012

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, boxers, blouses, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Lydia Samuel

texts.en:
Lydia lives in Yambio. She sells charcoal, and she has been in business for two years. She is 25 years old and married with four children, two of whom are still in school.

Lydia heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan with BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Patrick Tito Mulwa

texts.en:
Patrick is 45 years old and married with four children. He sells sweaters, socks and blouses to earn a living. He has been in this business for three years.

Patrick describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. 

He has applied for a loan of 70,000 KES to buy sweaters, socks and blouses to sell.

loans.use: To buy sweaters, socks and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 63 years old. She is blessed with three children and is a married lady. Her husband also contributes to the family income. 

Alice has been in the farming business for the past 40 years. She also sells cereals as a secondary business. Her businesses generate a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She is requesting a loan of KES 20,000. She will use the loan to purchase seeds and farm inputs for her farm. The profits will be used to plant more crops and increase produce. 

Alice's dream is to buy another plot of land that is more fertile.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm inputs for her farm.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina lives in Yambio. She runs a food stall and has been in business for five years. She is 37 years old, married, and has six children. Four of them are still in school. Regina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and rice to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for resale.

loans.name: Moses Kimani Njoroge

texts.en: Moses is 33 years old. He sells men's shirts to earn a living. He has been in this business for 8 years and describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to grow his business and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy men's shirts to sell.

loans.use: To buy men's shirts to sell.

loans.name: John Kamonde

texts.en:
John is 32 years old and is married to Angelina, who contributes to the family income. They have two children. He has been making shoes to sell for the last eight years with an income of approximately 15,000 Kenya shillings a month.

This is his fourth loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous ones. He wants to use the loan to buy more materials for making more shoes to sell. He hopes to open a shop for selling his shoes.

loans.use: to buy materials for making shoes.

loans.name: Bonface Ilahuya

texts.en:
Boniface is 37 years old and married to Musimbi, who contributes to the family's income. He has been operating his motorcycle transport business for a period of four years with an income of approximately 24,000 Kenya shillings a month.

This is his third loan with KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous ones. He wants to use the loan to buy an extra motorbike to increase his income. He hopes to start a public transport business with buses and vans.

loans.use: to buy an extra motorbike to increase his income.

loans.name: Josephine Severino

texts.en:
Josephine lives in Yambio. She sells from a food stall, and has been in business for one year. She is 28 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom are in school.

Josephine heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and sugar to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Titus Njari

texts.en:
Titus is 34 years old and married to Mary, who contributes to the family income. He has been operating his auto spare parts and welding business for a period of about five years with an income of approximately 10,000 Kenya shillings a month.

This is his fourth loan through KADET LTD, after successfully repaying the previous ones. He wants to use the loan to buy another generator so that he can enhance his efficiency as he serves his customers, and also increase his income. 

He hopes to expand and open more branches in Kitengela town.

loans.use: to purchase another generator.

loans.name: Mary Wanjiru

texts.en: Mary is 57 years old. She is from Nakuru and is married with four children. Mary has a charcoal business that she has been running for the past three years, and she has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more sacks of charcoal to add to her stock for sale. She hopes to open a retail shop in the near future and also expand her charcoal shop.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Elizabeth Loselan

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 36 years old and married, and she is blessed with four children aged 16,14,10 and 6 years respectively. She is in a business of selling charcoal, which she started three years ago. She earns a monthly income of about KES 7,500. 

She has requested KES 25,000 to buy more charcoal to sell.  Her profit will help her take care of her family’s needs. Her dream is to be successful in the business world. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn Tattao

texts.en:
Marilyn, a 33-year-old mother of four children, is the operator of a motorcycle service that has been in operation for four years. She has been working hard every day just to meet the needs of her family.

Marilyn has requested a loan of P28,000 (Philippine pesos) to buy paint and gasoline for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She hopes to increase her profits so that she can sustain the financial needs of her family, improve their standard of living, and save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy paint and gasoline for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Zahran's Group

texts.en:
Zahran is 41 years old, married and has a son and a daughter. Her son operates a barber shop in the market, while her daughter is an embroidery expert. In order to afford the living expenses of her family, Zahran sells shawls and also sews and produces decorative embroidery. Her daughter supports her in this business and helps her complete the orders on time.

Zahran is requesting a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to improve her enterprise through the purchase of beads, colored threads and sketches in quantities that will allow her to produce more attractive embroidered clothes and increase her profits. She will also buy a variety of shawls to sell.

Very experienced in her business, Zahran is confident that the loan will help her earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy embroidery material and shawls.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice lives in Yambio. She sells at a food stall and has been in business for five years. She is 36 years old, married, and has six children. All of them are still in school.
Joice heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Rosebella

texts.en:
Rosebella is 31 years of age and blessed with two children. She is a tailor, a business she ventured into seven years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES.10,000. She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase fabric for her embroidery business. 

The profit she earns from this business would help her educate her children and purchase additional stock for her business. Her dream is to be successful in life. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase fabric for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice lives in Yambio. She sells clothes and has been in business for two years. She is 25 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is in school. Beatrice heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase clothes to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad Lahlouh

texts.en:
Mohammad is photographed in his butcher shop.
Mohammad is a 51-year-old man. He is married and a father of four sons and three daughters. 

For the past 14 years, Mohammad has had a butcher shop selling clean broilers (chicken) for cooking to customers, which has been a profitable project.

Mohammad is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing additional broilers for sale. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase broilers for sale

loans.name: Margret Elia

texts.en:
Margret lives in Yambio. She runs a food stall and has been in business for five years. She is 36 years old, married, and has five children. All of them are still in school. 

Margret heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and rice to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Cristina Soriano

texts.en:
Cristina has a community-based store in Rizaluna Cordon. She has been operating this kind of business for more than five years and up to the present. Aside from her retailing business, Cristina is also engaged in a transportation business, particularly in motorcycle transport. She is glad because her husband is responsible and supportive in raising their living conditions from poverty. 

Cristina is 45 years old and blessed with three grown up children. One of her children has already settled for marriage while the other two remaining are still single and working as Overseas Filipino Workers (OFW). Cristina is a determined person and doesn’t want to ask for financial support from her two children. She wants to earn income independently because she still has the potential to run her store wisely. 

For this reason, she is asking for additional working capital from the lenders amounting to P25,000, which will be used to buy stock groceries for her store. She knows that through this loan amount, she can obtain greater profits which will serve for her family needs and the improvement of her retail store.

The client in the business picture is on the right side while the project officer is on the left side.

loans.use: to buy stock groceries for her retail store.

loans.name: Maderina

texts.en:
Maderina lives in Yambio. She sells bread and has been in business for five years. She is 37 years old, married, and has five children. All of them are still in school.
Maderina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase bread. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase bread for sale.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Hog raising has been the primary source of income for Leticia’s family. She is 39 years old and married to Marcelo, who is a farmer. They are thankful because they are blessed with two children. The eldest is still single and working, and the youngest is out of school. 

Leticia is raising four hogs, fattening them for future sale. According to her, the price of feeds nowadays is high, and that’s the reason why her income is no longer enough to buy the needed supplies for her hogs. 

For this reason, Leticia is requesting additional capital in the amount of P20,000, which will be used to purchase stock feeds for her hog raising. She hopes to obtain the requested loan amount in order to fully nourish the growth of her hogs. In this way, she could sell them for a greater profit, which will serve in improving her way of living.

On the right side of the business picture, wearing a blue polo shirt, is the project officer of ASKI, while the client is on the left side.

loans.use: to purchase stock feeds for her raised hogs.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 58-year-old married woman from Madaba, Amman, Jordan.

Aisha sells clothes and she is requesting a loan of 1000 JOD to purchase more quantities for trading purposes.

Aisha is looking to provide her family with better life conditions by increasing her income.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is a 31-year-old married woman from Irbid, Jordan, and the mother of two children.

Nawal sells blankets and she is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to purchase blankets for trading purposes.

Nawal is looking to establish a shop for her business.

loans.use: to purchase blankets for trading purposes.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Vending charcoal has been the business involvement of Juliana. She has been running this business for more than three years. She is thankful because her previous loan really helped her in making her business more productive. This time she is in need of a bigger loan amount due to the many orders for charcoal from her customers. 

She is asking for a loan amounting to P10,000, allowing her to buy more charcoal. She is expecting that her requested loan amount will be granted. This would really be a big help to her, both in satisfying her customer’s demands and in providing her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal for her retail business.

loans.name: Patricio

texts.en:
Because his wife is working as an Overseas Filipino worker (OFW), Patricio is responsible for taking care of their two children and running her community-based store. He doesn’t want to just wait for his remittances from his wife because his children are growing, most especially his young son. He is spending much on this youngest child due to the high cost of milk and the other needs of an infant baby. So, he aims to increase his sales and profit to be able to provide all their daily needs. 

To make his dream realistic, he is asking for financial assistance in the amount of P6,000 to increase the volume of her store's merchandise. In this way, she could be generating greater profit which will serve her family's needs. She would be glad if his requested loan amount were approved.

loans.use: to increase the volume of merchandise in his wife's store.

loans.name: Bendia Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Bendia, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Madoudiarrabougou, sous préfecture de Fana.
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de céréales et d’habillements.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Bendia sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire, après avoir remboursés sans difficulté les trois précédents.                                                                          
SOCKONA,  première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debouts, compte acheter une douzaine d’habits auprès des fournisseurs de Dioïla pour ensuite les revendre au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour faire face aux besoins personnels et de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The women of the Bendia group all are married. On average they are 37 years old with 3 children, and all live in extended traditional families in the village of Madoudiarrabougou, Fana prefecture.

They met through connections with family and friends, and in the neighborhood. The women sell condiments, grains and clothing.                                                                                                                          
They are on their third group loan, and the three previous loans have all been repaid with no problems.                                                                          

Sockana, first on the right, standing, plant to buy a dozen outfits from suppliers in Dioïla. She will then re-sell them in the village, for cash and on credit, to customers who are both men and women.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 CFA francs, which she will use to meet her personal needs and those of her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Busena Mahamud

texts.en:
Busena lives in Yambio. She sells clothes and has been in business for four years. She is 45 years old, married, and has five children. Three of them are still in school.

Busena heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her fifth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 3,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase clothes to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Fatimah

texts.en:
Fatimah is a conservative person, so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the Internet. The man in the photo is her husband.

Fatimah is a 33-year-old married woman from Hay Nazal, Jordan. She is the mother of four children.

Fatimah makes handmade art pieces, and she is requesting a loan of 1,500 JOD to purchase equipment needed for her business.

Fatimah is looking to establish a shop for her home-based project with an aspiration of changing her home furniture.

loans.use: to purchase equipment needed for making handmade center pieces.

loans.name: Lilibeth Peregrino

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 35 years old and married to a farmer. They are raising their family in a village. She engages herself in a hog-raising business while her husband manages their rice farming business. Despite the hardship of living, she aims to improve her hog-raising business to increase her income and satisfy their needs. 

Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for an addition of P11,000 to buy feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. She mentioned that the loan will help her improve the business and hopes that she will be successful in managing the business.

loans.use: To buy feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Association Dental 12 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "Dental 12" est composée de 5 femmes qui habitent le même quartier.Les trois sont mariées alors que les deux sont célibataires.Elles s'activent dans le commerce de tissus, d'encens et d'articles de mercerie.Les membres du groupe s'appuient mutuellement en se cotisant pour constituer une épargne qui pourra leur servir comme caution pour obtenir des prtes à l'UIMCEC.Elles arrivent avec leur commerce à générer des revenus qui leur permettent de subvenir à leurs besoins et à ceux de leurs familles.Afin de renforcer leur fonds de commerce, le groupe sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter des tissus, des seaux d'encens et des articles de mercerie. Elles ambitionnent de construire une cantine pour mieux commercialiser leurs produits.
texts.en:
The "Dental 12" group is made up of 5 women who live in the same neighborhood. Three are married, two are single. The sell fabric, incense, and haberdashery items. The group members support each other by contributing to a savings fund that they can use as a deposit to obtain loans from UIMCEC. The business provides them with enough income to meets their needs and the needs of their families. 

To increase their assets, the group is asking for a loan of 500,000 francs to buy fabric, containers of incense, and haberdashery items. Their goal is to build a kiosk for better marketing of their products.

loans.use: to buy fabric, containers of incense, and haberdashery items.

loans.name: Kholod

texts.en:
Because Kholod is a conservative person, she is unwilling to upload her picture on the Internet. The man in the photo is her son.

Kholod is a 40-year-old married woman from Irbid, Jordan. She is the mother of four children.

Kholod sells home products and she is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to purchase home products for trading purposes.

Kholod is looking to expand her business and improve her family's life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase home products for trading purposes.

loans.name: Benard Wambua

texts.en:
Benard is a 26-year-old man. He is married and has two children.

He runs a motorcycle transport business, locally known as a boda boda business, in Emali. He has been in the business for four years now and gets a monthly income of 5,000 KES.

This will be his first loan from KADET Ltd. He plans to use the entire loan to repair his motorcycle. He believes this will improve the business. With the profit that he will get, he will buy a plot of land. 

In the future, he wants to become a millionaire.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a very talented lady. She is the mother of 2 sons and 2 daughters. She operates a boutique business in her community where she displays her collection for selling. She handles a good clientele base. She keeps herself up to date about the latest trends in fashion which helps her understanding of the clients' demands. 

Her husband is also involved in a clothes sales business. He operates his shop in the clothing market and earns good profits every month.  Her eldest son also has a clothes sales business, while her remaining children are getting their education.
 
Kalsoom has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further improvement of her boutique business. With the loan investment, she will buy a variety of unstitched clothes & threads to sew them for displaying in her boutique for selling. She is very experienced in her business and confident about her success as the result of the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy unstitched clothes & thread for her boutique business.

loans.name: John Lempesa

texts.en:
John is 35 years old, single, and has one child.  He has a cereals business in Oloitoktok, which he has had for one year.  John earns a monthly income of 16,000 KES.

John is requesting his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy dry maize, beans and peas to sell so that he can expand his cereals business.  In the future, he wants to diversify to crop farming.

loans.use: to purchase dry maize, beans, and peas.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Balimaya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 41 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Beleniko, sous préfecture de Fana.
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de savons de fabrication moderne et traditionnelle, de condiments alimentaires et de gâteaux et sont                                                                                                                    à leur troisième prêt solidaire et les deux précédents ont été correctement remboursés.                                                                          
DOUNAMBA, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche, compte acheter  1 sac de sel de cuisine et un carton de cubes Maggi auprès des revendeurs de Fana et de Dioïla pour ensuite les revendre au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 6 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour faire face aux besoins personnels et de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The women of the Balimaya group are all married. They are, on average, 41 years old and have about four children each. All of them live in large, traditional families in the village of Beleniko, in the Fana sub-prefecture.

They met through relatives, neighbors, and friends. They sell both modern and traditionally-made soaps, condiments, and cakes. This is their third group loan. The two previous loans were correctly repaid.

Dounamba, the second person from the left, plans to buy 1 bag of cooking salt and a box of Maggi bouillon cubes from sellers in Fana and Dioïla. She will then resell these goods in her village for cash or credit to a clientele made up of both men and women.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 6,000 FCFA, which she will use to tend to her own needs and those of her children.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Ruzimo

texts.ru: Рузимо трудолюбивая, честная и добрая женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать четверых детей. Муж плотник и каменщик. Более 6 лет Рузимо занимается купле- продажей крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. Каждую неделю она покупает скот, затем хорошо ухаживает и откармливает их до следующей недели, а затем продает за хорошую цену. Рузимо хотела бы получить займ для покупки скота с целью пополнения оборотного капитала. Она надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Ruzimo is a hard-working, honest and kind woman. She is married and a loving mother of four children. Her husband works as a carpenter and mason. For over 6 years, Ruzimo has been buying and reselling cattle and smaller livestock. She purchases new animals each week, then takes good care of them and fattens them up until the following week when she sells them at a profit. Ruzimo would like to obtain a loan to buy livestock in order to replenish her working capital. She is hoping for your help and compassion.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen lives in Yambio. She runs a food stall and has been in business for five years. She is 30 years old, married, and has six children. Four of them are in school.

Hellen heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Edith Xiomara Molina

texts.es:
La señora Edith tiene 32 años, ella es una persona muy responsable y luchadora, junto con ella vive sus dos hijos y su esposo quien la respalda en cada uno de sus compromisos, Doña Edith vive en un barrio de la ciudad de Choluteca. Doña Edith tiene su negocio en un lugar de fácil acceso y esto hace que sea muy visitado y tenga mucha demanda de su producto ya que viene trabajando con ellos desde hace 10 años; el préstamo lo utilizara para compra de maíz, leña y cal, así de esta manera elaborar y vender mas de su producto a mas  clientes. Doña Edith con el préstamo espera satisfacer la demanda diaria de cada uno de ellos y así obtener un mejor ingreso para seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Doña Edith desea a futuro comprar una maquina de elaborar tortillas y  mandar a sus hijos a la universidad.



Choluteca, Honduras –  Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Edith ia a 32-year-old, responsible, hardworking woman. She lives with her two children and her husband, who supports her in all of her committments. Edith lives in a neighborhood of the city of Choluteca. Her business location has easy access and is easily seen. There is a lot of demand for her products as she has been offering them for the past 10 years.

The loan will be used to purchase corn, lime, and wood to make and sell more products to her customers. With the loan, Edith expects to meet the daily demand of each of her customers, earn more income, and continue to help her children with their studies so that they have a better life. In the future, Edith wants to buy a machine to make tortillas and send her children to the university.

Choluteca, Honduras –  March 2012

loans.use: to buy corn, lime and wood for her business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es: Lilia, de 31 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Ronald, su esposo desde hace 9 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Mijail y Antony a  los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Chilca. Se desempeña como profesora de nivel inicial, a principios de años el gobierno la destacó, para enseñar en un pueblo alejado de la ciudad, llamado Ajoyanca, donde laboró todo el año, percibiendo un sueldo mensual. Pero como es una mujer emprendedora y con ánimos de ayudar a las personas, abrió el negocio de venta de ropa en el pueblo, ya que por motivos de lejanía los pobladores no tenían acceso constante a la ciudad, ese problema Lilia, lo tomó como una oportunidad para poder conseguir ingresos extras y ayudar a las familias del lugar. Es así que comenzó a llevar ropa de buena calidad y sobre todo barata, para los habitantes del lugar, disminuyendo así los gastos de traslado que tiene que realizar constantemente para comprar las necesidades básicas. Ahora ella, pidió su traslado a la ciudad de Huancavelica una de las más pobres del país, donde espera enseñar a los niños del nivel inicial y poder seguir con su trabajo de venta de ropa. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde agradece al apoyo de los que hacen posibles el préstamo, además promete ser puntual con el pago de las cuotas, pues los integrantes de su asociación son personas responsables y solidarias. Lilia de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de uniformes y útiles de escritorio para vender en esta campaña, a los pobladores de Huancavelica.
texts.en:
Lilia, age 31, is a hard-working woman.  She lives with Ronald, who she has been married to for nine years.  They have two children, Mijail and Antony.  They are caring for them in their own home, which is in Chilca.

She works as a preschool teacher.  At the beginning the government selected her to teach in town, Ajoyanca, which is far from the city.  She worked there all year, and she received a monthly salary.  However, as an enterprising woman who is eager to help other people, she opened a business selling clothes in her town.

Because the town’s inhabitants are far away, they do not have constant access to the city.  Lilia took this problem as an opportunity to be able to get extra income and to help the families in her town.  That is how she started to carry good quality and, and above all, inexpensive clothes to sell to her neighbors.  She is decreasing the expense of traveling constantly to buy basic needs products.

She has now requested her transfer to the city of Huancavelica, one of the poorest in the country.  She hopes to teach preschool there.  She also hopes to be able to continue her work of selling clothes.

This is her fourth loan with MFP.  She is thankful for the support that makes the loan possible.  She pledges to be punctual with her payments.  The members of her communal bank are responsible and supportive people.  Upon receiving your support Lilia will buy uniforms and desk supplies to sell during this season to the inhabitants of Huancavelica.

loans.use: to buy uniforms and desk supplies.

loans.name: Astghik Estoyan

texts.en:
Astghik is 54 years old. She lives in Yerevan with her husband and two sons. Astghik's elder son is 24 and works at the gold market. Her younger son is 22 and works at a car-washing service. Five years ago, Astghik decided to start a retail business with her husband. They rented a booth in a city market, where they trade in men's clothing.

Astghik wants to refresh their clothing selection for the coming spring/summer season. For this reason she has applied for this loan to purchase clothing. This loan will help Astghik to increase sales and develop her business, which means increased income for Astghik and her family.

loans.use: to pay for clothing

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina is the mother of four daughters and a son, two of whom work, while two others are studying. Interacting efficiently and professionally with her clients, Robina operates a grocery store adjacent to her home. Due to the quality of her products and services, she makes a good profit every month.

Robina is requesting a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to purchase more groceries such as flour, rice, spices, cooking oil, etc. for her store. This will help her meet client demand on time and increase her sales and profits. Having operated her business for the past many years, Robina is confident that the loan will improve her enterprise.

Note: Decorative embroidery cloth is shown in the photo, as one of the loan applicants operates an embroidery business.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her grocery store business.

loans.name: Julius Kamau

texts.en:
Julius is 56 years old, married to Hellen, and together they have been blessed with four children. He has operated his cereal shop business in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last seven years. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of the existing clients and he plans to use this loan to buy more cereals for his business. 

In the future, Julius hopes to grow his business and make more profits and be able to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals for his business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 33 years old and married with one child. She runs a pharmacy to earn a living, has been in business for three years, and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition.
