Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy medicine for resale.

loans.use: To buy medicine for resale

loans.name: Peter Gitau

texts.en:
Peter is 54 years old. He is from Njabini, is married to Edith, and they have a son who is 25 years old. 

Peter is a farmer and has been one for the past 13 years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him buy fertilizer and manure to put in his farm. 

He hopes to buy a pickup which will help him transport milk from Nakuru to Nairobi.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and manure

loans.name: Jose Danilo Estrada

texts.es:
Don  José de 31 años de edad, el vive con su pareja, tiene dos hijos que dependen de él, la casa donde vive es familiar, el es de San Lorenzo, Valle.
Don José tiene su negocio de venta de mariscos y productos soya el cual lo vende en aldeas cercanas a san Lorenzo y lugares cercanos es así como el se gana la vida para poder sacar adelante a su familia. 
Don José solicita 20,000.00 lempiras a PRISMA para  complementar la comprar un vehículo para repartir con más facilidad su producto a sus clientes.
Don José con las ganancias de las ventas pretende comprar  más mercadería y así mejorar su forma de vida y la de su familia.
Don José desea continuar  trabajando con PRISMA  porque de esa  forma a logrado mejorar su economía.
El sueño de Don  José es comprar su propio vehículo ya que de esa forma podrá distribuir su  producto y así lograra un mayor progreso en su vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
José is 31 years old and lives with his partner and 2 dependent children in their family home. He is from San Lorenzo in the department of Valle. José has his own business selling seafood and soy products in areas close to San Lorenzo. This is how he makes his living and supports his family.

José is requesting 20,000.00 lempiras from PRISMA in order to purchase a vehicle so that he can more easily distribute his products to his customers. With the profits from these sales, José will buy more merchandise and improve the lives of he and his family. José wants to continue working with PRISMA because he will be able to improve his finances. José's dream is to purchase his own vehicle so that he will be able to distribute his products and make better progress in his life. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle to transport his business merchandise.

loans.name: Geghetsik Safrazyan

texts.en:
Geghetsik is 53 years old. She lives in Akhlatyan village with her family: her husband, son, daughter-in-law and little grandchild. Geghetsik works at the local school, and her husband is a veterinarian. But the main income for the family comes from agriculture. 

Geghetsik has applied for this loan to develop cattle breeding. She plans to purchase five cows. Expansion of the farm will allow Geghetsik to receive more milk and also sell the meat. This means additional income for Geghetsik, which is important for her to make ends meet and cover the family's costs.

loans.use: to pay for cows

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband's fruit-selling business. With the loan investment, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits to sell to his clients. He is an honest businessman. He shows very good behavior with his customers and offers them a variety of fruits with good in quality at very reasonable rates. Najma is hopeful that his business will be improved further after the loan investment. 

Najma is also a very supportive person. She works for her community clients as a seamstress. She is very skillful and receives regular orders every month.

She has five children. Three of them are studying while the others do different kinds of work to financially contribute to the family. 

She is hopeful about her family's better financial future as the result of the improved business of her husband.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits for fruit sales business

loans.name: Kulbara

texts.ru:
Кулбаре 52 года, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Кулбара закончила университет по специальности преподаватель кыргызского языка и литературы, и в настоящий момент работает заместителем директора школы села Наматбек. С 1994 года Кулбара занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 20,000 сом (KGS). В настоящее время хозяйство Кулбары приносит  около 11,000 сом (KGS)   в месяц от продажи молока  и молочных продуктов.  Также, Кулбара возделывает 4,40 га орошаемой земли, где выращивает картофель, фасоль и яблоки. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулбара обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп бычков для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Кулбара планирует вложить в увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Kulbara is 52 years old, married and has four children.  She graduated from a university with the Kyrgyz-language and literature teaching degree and currently works as an assistant director of the school in the Namatbek village.  Kulbara has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 1994, having started this business with an initial sum of 20,000 som (KGS).  At the present time, her business yields about 11,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and milk products.  Also, Kulbara works on 4.40 hectares of irrigated land, where she grows potatoes, beans and apples.  In order to further develop her business, Kulbara requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy bulls for fattening up and resale.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Maidagul

texts.ru: Майдагул замужем и любящая мать пятерых детей. Муж работает на насосной станции. Более 5 лет она занимается купле- продажей крупного и мелкого рогатого скота.  Еженедельно она покупает скот на рынке, привозит  домой,  окармливает в течении определенного периода, а потом продает за выгодную цену. Майдагул запрашивает займ в размере 4000 Сомони для покупки крупного и мелкого рогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Maidagul is married and a loving mother of five children.  Her husband works at a water pressure station.  Maidagul has been involved in buying and selling cattle and small livestock for over five years.  She buys livestock at a market on a weekly basis, brings it home, fattens it up during a set period of time and then sells it at an advantageous price.  Maidagul is requesting a loan in the amount of 4000 Somoni to purchase cattle and small livestock in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cattle and small livestock

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат разведенная и на воспитании имеет одну дочку. Более 13 лет занимается вышиванием и продажей яктаков (мужской национальный халат). Она покупает материалы и вышивая их продает за выгодную цену на рынке. Среди населения много большая потребностей на данное изделие. Мухаббат хотела бы получить займ в размере 10000 Сомони для покупки материалов на пошив яктаков. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Muhabbat is divorced and raising one daughter.  She has been involved in embroidery and sales of yaktars (men's national robes) for over 13 years.  She buys fabrics, embroiders them and sells them at an advantageous price at a market.  This piece of clothing is in high demand among the residents.  Muhabbat wants to obtain a loan in the amount of 10,000 Somoni to buy fabrics to sew yaktars.  She relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for sewing

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana de 24 años, convive con Miguel, con quien tiene un hijo de 4 años al que llamaron Swin. Todos ellos viven en una casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Yanama Alto, distrito de Palca – Tarma. Desde que se entero que sería madre, Maximiliana se dedica a la agricultura. A lado de Miguel siembra arveja, papa y olluco. Admite que el trabajo es muy cansado, por eso cuando temporadas de cosecha contrata peones para apresurar las tareas. Toda su producción la comercializa en el mercado mayorista de Tarma. Así también cría animales como ovejas, cuyes, toros y 2 vacas que le proporcionan la leche con la que elabora quesos para venderlos. “Solo vendiendo quesos gano de 5 a 10 soles al día”, dice, es por esa razón que piensa adquirir más vacas  para mejorar su producción de queso. Maximiliana es una mujer visionaria. Sus planes están bien marcados, por eso pronto comprará otro terreno de cultivo para incrementar la obtención de papas, y hortalizas. Éste sería su crédito número 8 que recibiría de MFP, por eso se responsabiliza de pagar con puntualidad las cuotas, como anteriormente lo hizo. Trabaja con empeño y dedicación dentro de su banco comunal “Los Manantiales de Yanama”, porque afirma que sus socios son personas confiables y solidarias. Ella solicita 500 soles para comprar una bolsa de semillas de arvejas para iniciar con una siembra, ya que cuenta con las bolsas de abonos.
texts.en:
Maximiliana, aged 24, lives with Miguel with whom she has a 4-year-old son named Swin.  They live together in their own home, located in the village of Yanama Alto, in the district of Palca-Tarma.  

Since becoming a mother, Maximiliana has been working in agriculture.  Alongside Miguel, she grows peas, potatoes and root vegetables.  She admits that her work is very tiring, which is why they hire workers during harvest time to speed along the work.  She sells all her production in the wholesale market in Tamba.  She also raises animals such as sheep, guinea-pigs, bulls and two cows who provide her with milk with which she makes cheese to sell.  "Selling cheese alone, I earn 5 to 10 soles a day", she says.  For this reason, she is thinking about acquiring more cows to improve her cheese production.

Maxmiliana is a visionary woman.  Her plans are well laid-out; for this reason, she will soon purchase another piece of farmland to increase her production of potatoes and vegetables.

This will be her eighth loan that she will receive from MFP.  For this reason, she will be responsible about making her repayments punctually, like she has done previously.  She works with diligence and dedication with her communal bank “Los Manantiales de Yanama” ["The Springs of Yanama"], because she notes that the members are trustworthy and supportive.  

She is requesting 500 soles to purchase a bag of pea seeds to plant, as she already has bags of manure.

loans.use: to purchase a bag of pea seeds.

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.ru: Рахматулло умный и перспективный молодой человек. Более 2-х лет он занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Рахматулло имеет собственную машину марки «Тикко», которую приобрел недавно. Имеет много постоянных клиентов. Рахматулло запрашивает займ для покупки новой автомашины с целью расширения бизнеса. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Rahmatullo is a smart and promising young man. For over 2 years, he has been offering taxi services. Rahmatullo has his own car of the Tikko brand, which he has recently purchased. He has many regular clients. Rahmatullo is requesting this loan to purchase a new car for his taxi business. He is hoping for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy a new car for his taxi business

loans.name: Fatullo

texts.ru: Фатулло женат и любящий отец четверых детей. Более 10 лет он занимается купле- продажей сухофруктов, имеет много постоянных покупателей. В бизнесе занимается самостоятельно. Кроме того он занимается выращиванием пшеницы и кукурузы. Также он имеет дополнительный доход от выпечки и реализации лепешек. Данный бизнес является семейным бизнесом. Фатулло запрашивает займ для покупки сухофруктов. На данный момент спрос большой и есть выбор на рынке .
texts.en: Fatullo is married and the loving father of four children. Fatullo has been selling dried fruits for over ten years and he has many regular customers.  He runs the business independently.  Besides this, he also grows food crops.  Primarily, he grows wheat and corn.  Fatullo is requesting a loan for the purchase of dried fruits.  Currently there is high demand and a good selection at the market.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits

loans.name: Ryskul

texts.ru:
Рыскул 58 лет, замужем, имеет 5 детей. 17 лет назад Рыскул начала заниматься животноводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки 5 овец. В настоящее время хозяйство Рыскул насчитывает 3 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь и 10 овец, что приносит  около 10,000 сом (KGS)   в месяц от продажи молока  и молочных продуктов.  Также Рыскул возделывает 2,0 га орошаемой земли, где выращивает фасоль и многолетние травы. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рыскул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Рыскул планирует вложить в увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Ryskul is 58 years old, married and has five children. She became involved in animal husbandry 17 years ago, having started this business with the purchase of five sheep.  At the present time, Ryskul's business contains three dairy cows, one horse and ten sheep, and yields about 10,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and milk products.  She also works on 2.0 hectares of irrigated land, where she grows beans and multi-year herbs. In order to further develop her business, Ryskul requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of livestock. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Dinora Patricia

texts.es:
En la fotografía aparece la señora Dinora junto con su hija.

La señora Dinora tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera de una hija. Ella se dedica al comercio, recientemente empezó a administrar su propio cafetín, antes se dedicaba a lavar ropa de otras personas, pero tomo la decisión de iniciar este negocio y comenta que le va muy bien.

Todos los productos que vende los compra en una ciudad, ella viaja una vez a la semana los días sábado, este viaje es  obligatorio, ya que ella aprovecha a saldar cuentas, pago de recibos y compra todos los insumos para vender durante la semana en el cafetín. Además aprovecha a comprar lo que necesita en la casa para su hija.

El préstamo que esta solicitando Dinora es para cancelar una deuda con la Fundación Campo y la otra parte la utilizara para construir una parte del muro de su casa, para evitar el deslave debido a la lluvia. Con el préstamo mejorara una parte de su vivienda que le provoca molestias en la época de lluvia, ya que parte del agua que corre ingresa a su casa y con la construcción del muro evitara el problema. También tendrá mayor comodidad para ella y su hija, menor riesgo a su salud en la época de lluvia. Dinora desea construir completamente su casa para bien de su familia.
texts.en:
In the photo, you can see Señora Dinora and her daughter.

Señora Dinora is 36 years old, and is a single mother of one daughter.  She works in retail, and recently began to run her own cafeteria.  Previously, she worked washing other people's clothes, but she took the decision to start this cafeteria business and comments that things are going very well.

She purchase all the products that shells in the city, where she travels once a week on Saturdays.  This trip is necessary, because she uses it to settle her accounts, pay her bills, and purchase all the supplies that she sells during the week in her cafeteria.  She also uses it to purchase whatever she needs in the house for her daughter.

The loan that Dinora is requesting is to pay back a debt to Fundación Campo, and she will use the other part to build part of a wall for her home, so as to avoid run-off from the rain.  With the loan, she will improve the part of her home which causes issues during the rainy season, when some of the rain runs into her house.  With construction of the wall, she will avoid the problem.  It will also be more comfortable for her and her daughter, with less risk to their health during the rainy season.  Dinora wants to build her house completely for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to pay back a debt to Fundación Campo, and the other part will be used to build part of a wall for her home.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Yambio. She sells charcoal and has been in business for 5 years. She is 28 years old, single and has two children, both of them are still in school. 

Grace heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 400 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Yambio. She sells at a food stall and has been in business for 3 years. She is 30 year old, single and has three children, two of them are still in school. 

Agnes heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 300 SDG in order to purchase cassava flour and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase cassava flour and beans for sale.

loans.name: Kumush

texts.ru:
Кумуш  52 года, вдова, имеет 2 детей. 17 лет назад Кумуш начала заниматься животноводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки 1 дойной коровы. В настоящее время  в хозяйстве Кумуш  имеется 1 дойная корова и 2 теленка, что приносит  около 4,000 сом (KGS)   в месяц от продажи молока  и молочных продуктов.  Также Кумуш возделывает 1,80 га орошаемой земли, где выращивает фасоль и многолетние травы. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кумуш обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Кумуш планирует вложить  в капитальный ремонт дома, а в дальнейшем - в увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Kumush is 52 years old, a widow and has two children. She became involved in animal husbandry 17 years ago, having started this business with the purchase of one dairy cow.  At the present time, Kumush's business contains one dairy cow and two calves, and yields about 4,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and milk products. She also works on 1.80 hectares of irrigated land, where she grows beans and multi-year herbs.  In order to further develop her business, Kumush requested a loan in the amount of 55,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of livestock. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a major repair of her house and an expansion of her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Armanda

texts.es:
Armanda de 47 años, convive con Adán. Ambos tienen 5 hijos pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: José de 20 y Jeancarlos de 12 años en su casa propia en el pueblo de Palcamayo – Tarma. Desde niña le enseñaron trabajar la tierra y producirla, por eso siembra con éxito arvejas, espinacas y zanahorias en su 3 terrenos de cultivos. Ella es muy inteligente. Sabe cuando son las temporadas de mejores ventas, por eso viaja con constancia hacia la ciudad de Lima para ofrecer sus hortalizas al mercado mayorista. Una de sus principales dificultades son las heladas y plagas que azotan sus sembríos, “los años no pasan en vano, ya sé como combatir estos problemas, pero también se invierte mucho”, comenta.
Como las ventas de verduras son buenas en la ciudad capital, también se dedica a la compra y venta. Por eso viaja 3 veces a la semana. Todo este trabajo lo realiza de la mano de su inseparable esposo: Adán, a quien agradece por el cariño y compañía.  Afirma que vale la pena tanto esfuerzo, ya que sus hijos trabajan y José (de 20 años), está estudiando una profesión. Ésta orgullosa. Éste sería su crédito número 11 que recibiría de MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas como en oportunidades anteriores. Se siente orgullosa de pertenecer, como una de las socias más antiguas, al banco comunal “Patrón San Cristóbal”
Armanda podrá comprar una bolsa de semilla de arvejas y una lata de semillas de espinacas. Así iniciará con éxito una siembra para el mes de julio.
texts.en:
Armanda is 47 years old and lives with Adán. They have 5 children, but only two of them live with them: José, who is 20, and Jean Carlos, who is 12. They own their own home in the town of  Palcamayo – Tarma. From childhood she was taught how to work the land and obtain products from it; therefore she successfully plants peas, spinach, and carrots in her three plots. She is very intelligent and knows the times when sales are the best. She travels frequently to Lima to sell her vegetables wholesale. One of her main problems is the freezes and pests that destroy her plantings. “The years aren't spent in vain because I know how to combat these problems, but it takes a lot of investment,” she said.

She also sells at retail since vegetable sales are good in the capital, and she goes there 3 times a week.  All this work is done with the help of her inseparable husband Adán, to whom she is grateful for his affection and companionship.  She asserts that all this effort is worth it, since her sons work and 20-year-old José is studying to become a professional. She is very proud. This will be the 11th loan she has received from MFP. She promises to make her payments promptly as she has done in the past. She is proud to belong, as one of its oldest members, to the communal bank “Patrón San Cristóbal.” Armanda will be able to buy a sack of peas and a can of spinach seeds and successfully start her planting in July.

loans.use: to buy a sack of peas and a can of spinach seeds.

loans.name: Kholoud Ramadan

texts.en:
Kholoud is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo standing next to his car.

Kholoud is a 30-year-old woman, a mother with two sons. Her husband is a construction contractor who gets a low salary which is not enough to cover the family's costs.

Kholoud is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing a new sewing machine to start her new project at home to sew clothes for customers. This sewing machine will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Taha

texts.en:
Taha is a 23 year old single man. He is a lawyer and a "fresh graduate." He has a training session (or an internship) in a law office.

Taha is requesting a youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new laptop. Taking this loan will enable Taha to enhance his skills in using a computer and to do the required reports for his training session on time. 

Taha is photographed in the store where he is purchasing the laptop.

loans.use: To purchase a new laptop.

loans.name: Ahmad Ajaj

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 25-year-old married young man with no children yet. For the past three years, Ahmad has had a grocery store selling different types of groceries. It has been a profitable project, but not enough to cover the costs.

Ahmad is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request such as rice, sugar, and milk. This will increase sales and increase Ahmad's income.

Ahmad is photographed in his store.

loans.use: to purchase needed stock of basic groceries for sale.

loans.name: Fatema

texts.en:
Fatema is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Ahmad appears in her Kiva profile photo, photographed next to the sheep he has.

Fatema is a 30-year-old young woman. she is a mother of two sons and three daughters. Her husband Ahmad is employed for a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's costs.

For the past 5 years, Fatema's husband has also been raising sheep and selling sheep products, which has been a profitable project.

Fatema is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing more sheep and bulk of fodder to feed the sheep. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase additional sheep and bulk of fodder.

loans.name: Ibtehal Abu Azezah

texts.en:
Ibtehal is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, photographed in his restaurant.

Ibtehal is 27 years old and a mother of one son and one daughter. Her husband is a school employee who earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs. For the past three years, Ibtehal's husband has also been operating a restaurant, selling "Homos and Fool modamas", a Palestinian traditional food, which has been a profitable project.

Ibtehal is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing bulk chickpeas and pod peas to make  "Homos and Fool modamas" to sell to customers. This will cover the increasing demands from customers for this type of food, increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase bulk chickpeas and pod peas to make " Homos and Fool modamas" to sell to customers.

loans.name: Bahaa

texts.en:
Bahaa is photographed at the university where he is studying. He is a 24-year-old single young man. His father is a taxi driver who earns an income, but not enough to cover the family's needs and also pay Bahaa's education costs.

Bahaa is studying at the university, specializing in Marketing. He wants to complete his studies by paying the university fees, so he is requesting a youth loan from FATEN to help him cover those costs. This will ensure a better future for Bahaa and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To pay his university fees.

loans.name: David Kamau

texts.en:
David is 53 years old and married to Joyce. They are blessed with two children. David has operated a shoe sales shop in Nyahururu town now for the last 5 years. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the field officers and he plans to use this loan amount to buy more leather shoes, slippers and sandals for sale in his shop. 

In the future, David hopes to expand and invest more in his business and hence, make more income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes, slippers, and sandals

loans.name: Ezekiel Lokala

texts.en:
Ezekiel is 26 years old, married, and blessed with two children, ages 1 and 3 years, respectively. Ezekiel is in the business of selling charcoal, a business he started two years ago. He earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. 

He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy more charcoal for sale. His profit will help him buy more stock for his business. This is his first loan.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Judith Mueni Oloo

texts.en: Judith is 33 years old and a mother of 2 children. She does tailoring to earn a living. She has been in the business for 12 years and has employed one person. She describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 50,000 KES to buy a tailoring machine.

loans.use: to buy a tailoring machine

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, de 53 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su mamá, a quién cuida y su hija Janeth en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Sicaya. Antes su principal ingreso económico se centraba en la crianza de gallinas, con el tiempo pudo obtener mucho beneficio de ello. Pero conforme pasó el tiempo, su mamá se enfermo, pues ya es anciana, desde entonces se dedicó a cuidar de ella. Sue hermanos le brindan un pago mensual por ello, y como buena hija es muy dedicada. Pero aún cuida de su hija menor que estudia psicología en una universidad reconocida, ella está muy orgullosa, pues trabaja en la gobernación de su localidad, solventando por ella misma los gastos de la universidad. Mientras que Carmen, no se queda atrás, hace poco comenzó a dedicarse a la crianza de cuyes, los que cuida con mucho cuidado y esmero, ya cuenta con 400 ejemplares, los que vende a los clientes que llegan a su casa. Es algo tedioso mantenerse al pendiente de sus animales, por ello se asoció con su yerno, ya que por la enfermedad de alza Hiner que tiene su madre, no le permite dejarla sola. Pero se mantiene firme con progresar y triunfar. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “sicaya” y este es el décimo sexto crédito con MFP, donde se siente muy feliz, pues en todo este tiempo logró obtener muchas ganancias, todo gracias al apoyo económico que le brindan. Por ello promete una vez más, cumplir con el pago de las cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación, pues todos los integrantes son personas solidarias y trabajadoras.
Carmen de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago del alquiler de alfalfa, durante un año para el alimento de sus animales.
texts.en:
Carmen, age 53, is a hard-working woman. She lives with her mother, whom she takes care of, and her daughter, Janeth.  She lives in her own house in Sicaya.  Previously her main income centered around raising chickens.  In time she was able to get much benefit from it.

However, as time passed her mother became ill; she is now elderly.  From then on Carmen devoted herself to taking care of her mother.  Her siblings give her money every month for this.  As a good daughter, she is very devoted.

She still takes care of her youngest daughter who is studying psychology at a well-known university.  She is very proud.  She works for the local government, and she pays her university expenses herself. 

Meanwhile, Carmen is not left behind.  A short while ago she started raising guinea pigs.  She takes care of them with great care and dedication.  She now has 400, and she sells them to the customers who come to her house.  It is somewhat tedious to keep watch over the animals.  That is why she has collaborated with her son-in-law.  Her mother has Alzheimer's, and this does not allow Carmen to leave her alone.  However, she is steadfast about progressing and triumphing.

She belongs to the Sicaya communal bank.  This is her sixth loan with MFP.  She is very happy because in all this time she managed to get a lot of income.  All of this is thanks to the financial support she was given.  She pledges one more time to make her payments.  She likes working with her communal bank.  All of the members are supportive and hard-working.

Upon receiving your support she will use the requested money to rent an alfaflfa field for one year in order to feed her animals.

loans.use: to rent an alfalfa  field to feed her animals.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina lives in Yambio. She sells food at a food stall, and has been in business for two years. She is 40 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are in school. 

Angelina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 400 SDG in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Sozulkan

texts.ru:
Созулкан  54 года, вдова, имеет 4 детей. Созулкан  работает преподавателем кыргызского языка и литературы.  16 лет назад Созулкан начала заниматься животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 18,000 сом (KGS). В настоящее время  в хозяйстве Созулкан  имеется 1 дойная корова, 2 бычка, 10 овец,  что приносит  около 5,000 сом (KGS)   в месяц от продажи молока  и молочных продуктов.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Созулкан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Созулкан планирует вложить  дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Sozulkan is 54 years old, a widow and has four children. She works as a Kyrgyz language and literature teacher.  Sozulkan became involved in animal husbandry 16 years ago, having started this business with an initial amount of 18,000 som (KGS).  At the present time, her business contains one dairy cow, two bulls and ten sheep, and yields about 5,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and milk products. In order to further develop her business, Sozulkan requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of livestock. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Zulfiya Nuridinova

texts.ru: Зулфия замужем и заботливая мать четверых детей. Муж работает сторожем. Более 2-х лет Зулфия занимается купле- продажей скота. Имеет хороший опыт бизнеса в этой сфере. В бизнесе помогает младший сын. Зулфия кредитуется в «ИМОН Интернешнл» с 2000 года и имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Она хотела бы получить займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки 2-х голов крупного рогатого скота. Зулфия надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Zulfiya is married and a caring mother of four children.  Her husband works as a security guard.  Zulfiya has been involved in buying and selling livestock for over two years.  She has a good experience in this business area.  Her son helps with the business.  Zulfiya has been obtaining financing from "IMON International" since 2000 and has a good credit history.  She wants to obtain a loan in the amount of 5000 Somoni to buy two heads of cattle.  Zulfiya relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice lives in Yambio. She sells food at a food stall, and has been in business for five years. She is 28 years old, single, and has two children, both of whom are in school. 

Joice heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 900 SDG in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Satik Karapetyan

texts.en:
Satik is 26 years old. She lives with her mother, brother, and sister. Satik's father has left for abroad to work there and sustain the family. Satik is a teacher at the local school. She is also involved in cattle breeding on the family farm. Satik has applied for this loan to develop beekeeping and pig-breeding. With the requested amount she will purchase five pigs and five beehives. 

With the loan's help Satik will develop her family's agriculture business and generate more income. This will also allow Satik's father to come back to the family and continue developing the farm.

loans.use: to pay for beehives and pigs

loans.name: Joseph Ngure Kinoko

texts.en: Joseph is 41 years old, married, and has four children. He runs a butcher shop to earn a living and has employed two people. To earn extra income he does carpentry. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to expand it in the future. He has applied for 40,000 KES to buy a cow for slaughter.

loans.use: To buy a cow for slaughter

loans.name: Catherina Taban

texts.en:
Catherina lives in Yambio. She sells food at a food stall, and has been in business for five years. She is 42 years old, married, and has six children, all of whom are in school. 

Catherina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,000 SDG in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Lucero De La Mañana Group

texts.es:
Doña Federica, es una señora casada, tiene 46 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos, 4 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la venta de ropa típica y como también a la confección de delantales, inició pensando en su superación familiar y hasta el momento lleva 8 años de experiencia en la venta de ropa, ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la confección de pantalones y delantales. 

Organiza un grupo con el objetivo de solicitar un préstamo que servirá para ampliar su capital de comercio de ropa típica, compra de cortes, güipiles, delantales, fajas, etc; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a diversas actividades económicas: venta de ropa, alimentos, atención a tienda en general, confección de delantales y pantalones, confección de blusas y a la crianza de animales. En el futuro creen que su negocio sera grande y con diferente productos.
texts.en:
Federica is 46 years old and married.  She did not have the opportunity to get an education.  She has five children, and four of them go to school.

She sells typical clothing, and she also makes aprons.  She started by thinking of improvement for her family.  So far she has eight years of experience in selling clothes.  She has her husband’s support.  He makes pants and aprons.

She organized a group with the objective of requesting a loan.  The loan would serve to increase her capital in her business of selling typical clothing, to buy Mayan skirts, traditional blouses, and sashes, etc.

The other members of the group devote themselves to diverse financial activities like selling clothes, food, working in a general store, making aprons and pants, making blouses, and raising animals.  In the future they believe their businesses will be large, and they will have different products.

loans.use: to buy typical clothing.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su esposa y dos hijos uno de 6 años y el otro de 3 meses. El se dedica a la profesión de electricista desde hace 12 años y lo aprendió por medio de una institución, pues le brindaron la oportunidad de aprender. 

Antes solo se dedicaba a la agricultura junto con su papá. Una vez él termino el curso de electricista, un amigo le dio trabajo para que pusiera en practica lo que había aprendido. Luego trabajo para una empresa de telecomunicaciones y en otras empresas más. El sueño de José es tener su propia empresa, hoy en día esta trabajando por su propia cuenta.

Para comprar los materiales que necesita para realizar su trabajo, aborda un autobús que tarda treinta minutos en llegar al lugar de destino. Don José esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar 70 metros de lámina, 250 pernos, 3 capotes, un galón de pintura y el resto para pago de mano de obra. Esta inversión será para cambiarle el techo a su casa, ya que el que tiene no le sirve y en el invierno caen muchas goteras.

De esta manera, comenta don José que podrá ofrecerle a su familia un mejor hogar y más seguro antes que llegue el invierno. Lo que más desea José es dejarle a sus hijos un mejor hogar, que se gradúen en la universidad e instalar su propia empresa donde pueda emplear a más personas.
texts.en:
José is 34 years old  and lives with his wife and two children, one of whom is 6 and the other is 3 months old. For 12 years, he has worked as an electrician, a profession he studied at an institution that offered him the opportunity to learn it. Before that he farmed alongside his father. Once he finished the electrician training, a friend offered him work so that he could practice what he had learned. Then he worked for a telecommunications company and other firms. José's dream is to own his own business; today he works on his own. To buy the materials he needs to do his job, he takes a bus that takes thirty minutes to arrive at his destination. 

José is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo to buy 70 meters of sheet steel, 250 bolts, 3 canopies, a gallon of paint, and the rest to pay for labor. With this investment, he will replace the roof of his house because it is in poor condition and leaks a lot in the winter. José says that he will then be able to provide a better, safer home for his family before winter begins.  José wants more than anything to give his children a better home, to see them graduate from college, and to have his own business that would be able to employ more people.

loans.use: to buy 70 meters of sheet steel, 250 bolts, 3 canopies, a gallon of paint, and the rest to pay for labor.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia de 59 años, es una mujer separada. Vive con su hija Katy  de 21 años en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Palcamayo – Tarma. Celia es una mujer muy comunicativa. Cuenta que, para lograr lo que ahora tiene tuvo que vivir muchas experiencias de trabajo. De niña ayudaba a sus padres en la agricultura y ganadería.  Luego se dedicó a la preparación de panes, pasteles y otros alimentos. Más de 10 años estuvo trabajando en una pastelería. Con todo su esfuerzo logró ahorrar el dinero suficiente para adquirir un terreno propio donde siembra arvejas, papas, habas y espinacas. Llevaba sus productos hasta la selva central del país, por eso logró construir su casa propia allí, pero como vive en Tarma, alquila los cuartos a otras personas obteniendo ingresos. Actualmente cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes que instaló en su propia casa. Así empezó a dedicarse a la compra y venta de terrenos, “las ventas son esporádicas por eso mi tienda me ayuda mucho”, afirma. 
Celia ve sus objetivos hacerse realidad, ya que su única hija terminó sus estudios superiores y podrá desenvolverse sola con facilidad, Está contenta. Éste sería su crédito número 11 que recibiría de MFP, se siente muy agradecida por todo el apoyo brindado en estos años. Ella pertenecen al banco comunal “Patrón San Cristóbal” y menciona la importancia que tiene el grupo en el desarrollo de sus objetivos.
Con el dinero podrá comprar latas de semillas de espinacas para empezar con fuerza una nueva siembra, así también bolsas de abonos orgánicos.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 59 years old and separated.  She lives with her daughter, 21 year old Katy, in a home of her own, located in Palcamayo – Tarma.  Celia is a very communicative woman.  She tells us that she has had to endure much work in order to be able to have what she has.  As a girl, she would help her parents with the farming and the livestock.  She later began baking bread, cakes, and other foods and she worked in a bakery for more than 10 years.  Through all of her efforts she was able to save enough money to buy land of her own, where she raises peas, potatoes, beans, and spices.  She would take her products to the country’s central jungle, so she built her house there, but since she lives in Tarma, she rents out the rooms to other people, which brings her income.  At the moment she has a grocery store that she runs out of her home.  This is how she got started buying and selling land.  She says, “Sales are sporadic, so my store helps me a lot.”

Celia is seeing her goals come true, now that her daughter has completed her higher education and will be able to support herself with no problem.  She is happy.  This will be her 11th loan through MFP.  She is very grateful for all the support she has gotten over the years.  She is a member of the “Patrón San Cristóbal” communal bank and she talks about the importance that the group has had in developing her goals.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifania de 66 años es una tierna abuelita. Vive con su anciana madre y su nieta, en una casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Palcamayo – Tarma. Epifania es una mujer como pocas, ejemplar y de coraje. A su edad continúa dedicándose a la agricultura. “Desde que tenía 20 años ya sembraba ayudando a mis padres”, cuenta. En todo este tiempo ha vivido buenas experiencias y algunas decepciones, pero nada comparado con la muerte de su hija a sus 33 años. Por eso cuida con mucho amor a su nieta que quedo en la orfandad. 
Tiene la fuerza necesaria para sembrar habas, arvejas, espinacas, zanahorias, lechugas y otras hortalizas. Pero siempre necesita de más personal, por eso contrata peones para agilizar las faenas. Además se dedicarse al cuidado de animales menores como: cuyes, gallinas, carnero y burros, los que enseba para luego venderlos a los carniceros y vecinos de su localidad. Ahora ella desea mantener las fuerzas para seguir adelante, ahorrar lo necesario y cuidar de su madre que ya no puede oír muy bien. Éste sería su crédito número 6 que recibiría de MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón San Cristóbal”, menciona que le agrada compartir los mismos intereses de superación y trabajo con sus socios. Epifania destinará el dinero en la compra de latas de semillas de espinacas y zanahorias, ya que los meses de marzo y abril inician las siembras. Un pequeño porcentaje del dinero será para adquirir bolsas de abonos orgánicos.
texts.en:
Epifania is 66 years old and a gentle grandma.  She lives with her elderly mom and her granddaughter in their own house located in the Palcamayo-Tarma area.  Epifania is a woman like few others; an example for others and courageous.  At her age, she continues working in farming.  "Back when I was 20 years old, I was already helping my parents farming", she notes.  In all this time she has had both good experiences and several disappointments, but nothing compared to the death of her daughter at 33 years old.  For this reason, she has great love for her granddaughter who was orphaned.

She has the strength required to grow lima beans, peas, spinach, carrots, lettuce and other vegetables.  However, she always needs more hands, so she hires workers to streamline her activities.  She also works looking after small animals such as guinea-pigs, hens, a ram and donkeys, which she raises so that she can sell them at a later point to butchers and neighbors in her area.  She now wants to keep up her strength to continue moving ahead.  She is saving what's necessary and looking after her mother who can't hear very well.

This will be the sixth loan that she has received from MFP, and so she agrees to be punctual in her monthly repayments.  She belongs to the “Patrón San Cristóbal” ["Patron St. Christopher"] communal bank, and mentions that she is grateful to share the same interests in succeeding and wroking with hre fellow-members.

Epifania will put the money towards the purchase of cans of spinach and carrot seeds, as the months of March and April are when sowing starts for these crops.  A small percentage of the money will be to acquire bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase spinach seeds, carrot seeds, and sacks of manure.

loans.name: Elkana Kenyanya

texts.en: Elkana is 25 years old, married, and has two children. He sells fruits and vegetables to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. He describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 40,000 KES to buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: David Emuria

texts.en:
David is 45 years old and married to Gladys. They have been blessed with two children, ages 5 and 2. He manages a pool table games business which he started three years ago. He earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES. 

He is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase another pool table. His dream is to see himself venture into farming and earn additional income from that. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase another pool table.

loans.name: Margret Candiru

texts.en:
Margret lives in Yambio. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for five years. She is 35 years old, married, and has six children, four of whom are still in school. 

Margret heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,000 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
Anastacia tiene 44 años, formó su familia hace 10 años con Paulino, el padre de sus 6 hijos. Ahora vive con 2 hijos de aun en edad escolar en una casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Yanama Alto, distrito de Palca – Tarma. Hace 23 años que se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando arveja y papa en todas sus variedades. Según cuenta, tiene diferentes terrenos agrícolas que se sitúan en caseríos de su distrito y en la costa peruana (allí siembra papas, cuyas semillas lleva de su tierra natal). A mediados de año, que es cosecha grande, ella se dirige hacia la ciudad de Lima, donde vende los frutos que produce. La ganadería es otra de las actividades que le brinda satisfacciones. Con la ayuda de sus 2 toros ara la tierra, y con la leche que producen sus vacas vende la leche y elabora quesos.
Así también hace 1 año instaló en su hogar una bodega de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad. Comenta que le va muy bien en todas estas acciones. 
Yanama es un caserío donde la movilidad no transita con frecuencia, dificultando el traslado y venta de sus productos, por lo que desea ahorrar lo necesario para adquirir una movilidad y poder trasladarse con mayor facilidad. Éste sería su crédito número 7 que recibiría de MFP, espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos, por su parte ella dice que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales.  Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Manantiales de Yanama”; se siente contenta de formar activamente este grupo de personas responsables. Anastacia invertirá el dinero en la compra de  2 bolsas de semillas de arvejas de la variedad “super”, que cuesta 600 soles cada una. Lo restante lo invertirá en bolsas de fertilizantes orgánicos.
texts.en:
Anastacia, 44, formed her family ten years ago with Paulino, the father of her six children. She now lives with two children who are still school age in a house of her own in the Yanama Alto settlement, Palca-Tarma District.  

She’s been farming for 23 years growing peas and all varieties of potato.  According to her, she has several parcels of farmland located in her district and along the Peruvian coast (she grows potatoes there with seeds she takes from her birthplace).  Mid-year which is when harvests are large she heads to the city of Lima to sell what she produces.  Another activity that produces benefits for her is raising livestock.  

She tills the land with help from her two bullocks and she sells the milk her cows produce and also makes cheese with it. In addition, she opened a grocery and basic staples store at home a year ago.  She comments that she does very well in all her activities.

Yanama is a settlement with scarce transportation which makes transportation and sale of her products difficult which is why she wants to save up what’s necessary to buy a vehicle to be able to transport her products more easily.

This would be loan #7 received from MFP and she hopes for support from all of you so that she can continue toward her objectives.  On her part, she pledges to be punctual with her monthly installment payments.

She belongs to the “Los Manantiales de Yanama” (Yanama’s Springs) communal bank and feels happy to be an active member of this group of responsible people.

Anastacia will use her money to buy two bags of pea seeds of the “Super” variety that cost 600 soles each.  She will invest the rest in sacks of organic manure.

loans.use: to buy bags of pea seeds and bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Delia Dinora Martinez

texts.es:
Dona  Delia  es  una   Señora de  44 años   de  edad, muy  emprendedora,  dedicada  a su  negocio, ella actualmente  vive  con  su  esposo y es  madre  de  3  hijos   los  cuales  tiene  en  el  colegio  de  su  comunidad.
Doña Delia tiene negocio de venta de productos de consumo básico el prestamos lo necesita  para  la  compra  de café, azúcar, harina, refrescos, cal, frutas, verduras, lácteos, pastas, churros, etc.
Doña Delia espera con este  préstamo tener  más  ventas  ya  que se  descapitalizo por problemas de salud de su esposo.
Doña Delia sueña  con graduar a sus hijos ya  que  en  este  año se  le  gradúa una de sus hijas como  maestra y  poder ayudarle a sus demás hijos en sus estudios. 


Choluteca, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Doña Delia  is a woman of 44, who is very enterprising and dedicated to her business.  She currently lives with her husband, and is the mother of three children who attend school in her community.

Doña Delia has a business selling basic consumer products.  She needs the loan to purchase coffee, sugar, flour, sodas, salt, fruit, vegetables, dairy products, pastas, churros (like doughnuts), etc.

Doña Delia hopes that with this loan, she will be able to get more sales. as she has run down her capital due to health problems with her husband.

Doña Delia dreams of her children graduating, as this year one of her daughters will graduate as a teacher and will be able to help her other children with their studies.

Choluteca, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to purchase corn, sugar, bread, coffee, beans, butter, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
Adam is a student applying for a loan to purchase a laptop to assist in his studies at Strathmore University and this is his story:

I am a student at Strathmore University pursuing a Bachelor of Science in Informatics. The course is an Information Technology course which the university is offering. My main challenge in the course so far has been acquiring a portable PC which I can use for my school work, since a laptop investment has been quite a challenge for my parents. As part of my degree, we are required to undertake units in computer, system analysis, web developments and networking. Due to the current large number of students in the institution, it has become inconvenient to use the school computer labs for the work involving such units. Random access to a computer is always needed; hence, it requires the acquisition of a portable PC.

I am planning on using the laptop for my learning activities, such as my school work, and also to access school information even when I am not in the school environment. As an Information Technology student, I would also like to use my laptop to educate others about the internet and the use of computers, since a relatively large number of people still do not have access to computers and the internet.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop to help him in his studies, access coursework off campus and teach others about computers.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina de 31 años convive con su esposo, con quien tiene 2 gemelas de 2 año: Betzi y Bretza. Vive contenta rodeada de sus padres, hijos y esposo en la casa de sus padres ubicada en el caserío de Yanama Alto, distrito de Palca – Tarma. Delfina es una mujer guerrera. Desde los 20 años trabaja en las tierras de cultivo. Siembra papas, arvejas y habas. “Es rentable sembrar habas y arvejas porque no se invierte tanto como la papa y su precio casi siempre es bueno”, explica.
Afirma que el trabajo en el campo es muy cansado, más aún soportando las lluvias y el frío de su zona, pero no son inconvenientes para seguir luchando. Sus hijas son su mayor inspiración, por eso confía que alcanzará sus metas. Las ventas son mejores en la ciudad de Lima, así que viaja con constancia llevando verduras y papas al mercado mayorista.
Ella espera contar con buenos ahorros para adquirir un auto y así trasladarse con facilidad, para ello seguirá trabajando con el mismo optimismo. Delfina obtendría su crédito número 13 de MFP, agradece el apoyo brindado en todo este tiempo. Confía en que pagará puntualmente las cuotas como lo hizo anteriormente. Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Manantiales de Yanama” y se siente contenta de formar parte de un grupo sólido y responsable. De recibir el dinero podrá destinarlo en la compra de 4 bolsas de semillas de arvejas y 2 de habas. Lo restante será para comprar bolsas de abonos orgánicos.
texts.en:
Delfina, 31, lives with her husband and their two year old twins: Betzi and Bretza.  She lives in the company of her parents, children and husband in her parents’ house located in the Yanama Alto settlement in Palca-Tarma District.  

She grows potatoes, peas and lima beans.  “Planting lima beans and peas is profitable because one does not invest as much as with potatoes and their price is almost always good,” she explains.

She affirms that work in the fields is hard even more so having to endure the rain and cold in her zone but these aren’t obstacles to continue with the struggle.  Her daughters are her greatest inspiration and why she trusts that she will reach her goals.  Sales are better in the city of Lima so she travels there regularly taking vegetable and potatoes to the wholesale market.  She hopes to have good savings so that she can buy a car to get around more easily; to do so she will continue working with the same optimism.  

Delfina will get loan #13 from MFP and she is grateful for the support provided all this time.  She trusts that she will make her payments punctually like she’s always done. 

She belongs to the “Los Manatiales de Yanama” (Yanama’s Springs) communal bank and feels happy to be part of such a responsible, mutually supportive group.  If she were to receive the money she will be able to use it to buy four bags of pea seeds and two of lima beans.  The rest will be used to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.use: to buy four bags of pea seeds and two bags of lima bean seeds as well as to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana de 42 años. Hace 20 años unió su vida a Félix, el padre de sus 2 hijos: Miguel de 19 y Doris de 17 años. Ella vida contenta rodeada de su familia en una casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Yanama Alto, distrito de Palca – Tarma. Sebastiana se dedica a la agricultura, que es la principal actividad económica del lugar. Desde que empezó a convivir con Félix empezó a sembrar arvejas y papas en todas sus variedades. “Para que haya buena producción se tiene que estar constante en la chacra (terreno de cultivo)”, dice. También cría animales, como ovejas y 4 vacas a las que cuida mucho, ya que le brindan leche. Con la adquisición de sus ovejas y la leche de sus vacas, puede tener un ingreso extra al hogar. 
Félix trabaja junto con ella en estas arduas tareas, por eso sus resultados son mayores y sus ventas mejor canalizadas. De esa manera llegó hasta la ciudad de Lima para comercializar sus productos al por mayor.
Con la fuerza y firmeza que la caracteriza seguirá trabajando en lo que el gusta: la agricultura, para aumentar sus ventas y generar más ahorros. Éste sería su crédito número 2 que recibiría de MFP, por eso se compromete en pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. “Los Manantiales de Yanama”, es el nombre de su banco comunal, se siente contenta de formar parte de un grupo de personas cuyos objetivos son similares.
Sebastiana invertirá el dinero en la compra de 2 bolsas de semillas con 1200 soles; lo restante será destinado a la compra de bolsas de guano de corral y granja.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is 42 years old.  For the last 20 years, she has been united in life with Félix, the father of her two children:  Miguel, aged 19 and Doris, aged 17.  She lives contentedly, surrounded by her family in their own house, which is located in the village of Yanama Alto, in the district of Palca-Tarma.

Sebastiana works in agriculture, which is the principal economic activity of the region.  When she began living with Félix, she began growing peas and potatoes in all their varieties.  “As there's been good production, I've need to be constantly on the farmland", she says.  She also raises animals, such as sheep and four cows who she looks after carefully as they provide milk.  With the acquisition of her sheep and her cows' milk, she can earn a little extra income for her household.
 
Félix works with her on these arduous tasks, which is why their results are stronger and their sales are better channeled.  He goes to the city of Lima to sell their products at wholesale.

With the strength and firmness which characterizes her, Sebastiana continues working doing what she enjoys, agriculture, to increase her sales, and earn more savings. 

This will be her second loan with MFP, so she agrees to make her monthly repayments punctually.  “Los Manantiales de Yanama” ["The Springs of Yanama"] is the name of her communal bank.  She is happy to be part of a group of people whose objectives are similar.

Sebastiana will invest the money in purchasing two bags of seeds for 1,200 soles.  The remainder will be used to purchase bags of farmyard manure.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of pea seeds, and sacks of farmyard manure.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina lives in Yambio. She sells fish, and has been in business for two years. She is 40 years old, single, and has five children, all of whom are still in school. 

Marina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Nelly Barseghyan

texts.en:
Nelly is 26 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in Ejmiatsin town. Nelly keeps a greenhouse, where she cultivates vegetables and roses. Nelly's husband and his parents are also involved in farming. 

Nelly is requesting a loan to purchase potato seeds. She hopes to gather a rich potato harvest and generate more income from its sales. In the future, Nelly has plans to construct a new greenhouse and grow more roses.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds.

loans.name: Fredis Argentina Maradiaga

texts.es:
Doña Fredis es una  persona  muy trabajadora, actualmente  vive  con  su  esposo  y  sus  3 hijos  con quines vive departamento de  Choluteca. Y   Se  dedica  a su negocio  propio que es una pulpería.
Doña Fredis el  préstamo  lo necesita  para  la  compra  de refrescos, maíz, leche, frijoles, pan, lácteos, embutidos, pastas, harina, etc.
Doña Fredis espera que al finalizar el  verano tener  bien  surtido  el  negocio  ya  que en el invierno es una  zona  muy  productiva  de   mariscos  y  otro tipo  de  actividades.
Doña Fredis desea tener  más mercadería  y  poder  crecer   en este  tipo  de negocio y Seguir  trabajando  duro  para  a si   terminar  de  darles  a  sus  hijos  lo  mejor  que  es  la  educación y a sí  que  sean  personas  de  bien  para  poder  ayudar  a su familia   ya  que  son personas humildes y de escasos recursos económicos.


Choluteca, Honduras - Marzo  del 2012
texts.en:
Fredis is a very hardworking person who is living with her husband and three children in Coluteca Department.  She has a business of her own: a grocery store.

Fredis needs the loan to buy soft-drinks, corn, milk, beans, dairy products, cured meats, noodles, flour, etc.

Fredis hopes that at summer’s end she’ll have the store well-stocked because in winter the zone is very productive of seafood and other activities.

Fredis wants to have more merchandise to grow in her business and continue to work hard in order to finish providing her children with the best education so that they will grow into upstanding citizens and to be able to help her family because they are humble people of scarce economic resources.

Choluteca, Honduras – March, 2012

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Isabelita Medina

texts.en:
Isabelita is a 53-year-old mother who loves to sell pork, egg, and chicken barbecue in the market. This is her way of gaining income for their daily living while her husband cultivates their farmland. They live in a village with their five children. Through their patience and sacrifices, they survived poverty. At this time, some of their children are already married and have their own families.

Isabelita aims to continue and improve her business to earn and save more income for their future. She is asking for additional capital of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy pork, eggs, chicken heads and intestines, liver, and seasonings needed for making barbecue. She believes that this loan will help her to improve the business and is hoping that she will be successful in the future.

loans.use: To buy pork, eggs, chicken heads and intestines, liver, and seasonings needed for making barbecue.

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es:
Nicanor tiene 57 años; está casado con Natividad, la madre de sus 9 hijos, pero solo vive con 4 de ellos, ya que los demás son independientes y ya tienen familia propia. Esta familia vive unida en una casa propia ubicada en el anexo de Yanama, distrito de Palca – Tarma. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a la agricultura. Esta actividad se la inculcaron sus padres. Gracias su destreza en el trabajo en el campo consiguió adquirir terrenos propios. “Siembro papa, arveja, olluco, lechugas, zanahoria, gladiolo, de todo, porque así ya tengo para los gastos de todo el año”, comenta confiado.
Comercializa sus productos casi todo el año, esa es la ventaja de sembrar constantemente. Traslada sus cosechas hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Pero en los meses de enero, febrero y marzo, la papa tiene gran demanda en la ciudad de Lima, por eso viaja frecuentemente. Lo mismo sucede en mayo y noviembre con la venta de flores de gladiolos. Nicanor también se dedica a la ganadería. Gracias a sus vacas lecheras prepara quesos y vende leche. Está contento de vivir en el campo, a pesar del frío y las intensas lluvias que dificultan su trabajo. Éste su crédito número 8 con MFP, asegura que será puntual el pago de las cuotas mensuales.  Espera de su apoyo para lograr sus objetivos. Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Manantiales de Yanama”. Se siente bien trabajando con personas responsables y solidarias.
Invertirá el dinero en la compra de 3 bolsas de semillas de arvejas, lo restante será para adquirir abonos.
texts.en:
Nicanor is 57 years old and married with Natividad, the mother of their 9 children. Only 4 still live with them; the remainder are independent and now have families of their own. His family lives together in their own house, located in the annex of Yanama in the Palca district of Tarma. For more than 30 years, Nicanor has been farming. He learned the trade from his parents. Thanks to his skill in agricultural work, he managed to acquire his own fields. “I sow potatoes, green peas, 'olluco' [an Incan tuber, like potatoes], lettuce, carrots, and gladiolas, everything, because in this manner, I have income to cover expenses all year,” he commented confidently.

Nicanor sells his harvests almost all year round -- this is the advantage of planting constantly. He transports his harvests to the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. During the months of January, February, and March, potatoes are in great demand in the city of Lima and Nicanor travels there frequently. The same occurs in May and November, when he sells gladiolas.

Nicanor raises cattle as well. Thanks to his milk cows, he also makes cheeses and sells milk. He is content to live in the countryside, despite the cold and the intense rains that make his work difficult. 

This is his 8th loan through MFP, and Nicanor assures us that the monthly payments will be made punctually. He awaits this help in order to achieve his objectives. Nicanor belongs to “Los Manantiales de [The Fountains of] Yanama” communal bank. He is very satisfied to work with such responsible and supportive people. He will invest the money in purchasing 3 bags of green pea seeds; the remainder will be used to acquire fertilizers.

loans.use: purchase 3 bags of green pea seeds plus sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Tacajalve Group

texts.es:
La señora Santos Maria es casada, tiene 39 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos 2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al comercio a la venta de alimento concentrado para animales, inició este negocio con una tienda y hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia en este negocio, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de concentrado para alimento de aves y purina alimento de gatos y perros, ya que en el futuro quiere ver un negocio grande. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedica a la venta de ropa y a la atención a tienda en general.
texts.en:
Santos María, 39, is married.  She never went to school.  She has five children two of which attend school.  She is a merchant.  She sells animal feed concentrate.  She started the business with a store and to date has six years’ experience in this business.  Her husband sells clothes and helps with support.

She organized a group in order to request a loan that she’ll use to buy fowl feed concentrate and Purina cat and dog food because in future she wants her business to be larger.  

The other group members sell clothes and run a general store.

loans.use: to buy feed concentrate to sell.

loans.name: Cristina Del Carmen Maradiaga

texts.es:
La  Señora Cristina   es una  persona  muy  emprendedora  dedicada   a su  negocio,  es madre  de  3 hijos  los  cuales  son  del  sexo  femenino, sus hijas le  ayudan   con  su negocio,  ella vive en  el  departamento   de  Choluteca  en  el  sur  del   honduras.
Doña Cristina la ejerce  desde ya  hace  mas de  15  años la actividad de Venta  de  refrescos, churros, sandalias y otros productos,  El  préstamo  lo  necesita  para  la  compra  de    refrescos, churros, recargas, sandalias y otros productos para la venta.
Doña Cristina con el  préstamo   espera  vender  mas   ya  que  tiene  poco  capital  para este  tipo de  negocio. En  poco  tiempo espera  poner  su  pulpería  en  su  casa  ya  que  el  negocio  que  tiene  ahora  lo hace  a  domicilio. 



Choluteca, Honduras - Marzo  del 2012
texts.en:
Cristina is a very enterprising person who is dedicated to her business.  She’s the mother of three children who are girls.  Her daughters help her with the business.  She lives in Choluteca Department in the south of Honduras.

Cristina has been selling soft-drinks, snacks, sandals and other products for more than 15 years.  She needs the loan to buy soft-drinks, snacks, recharges, sandals and other products to sell.

Cristina hopes with the loan to sell more since she has little capital for this type of business.  In a short time she hopes to open a grocery store at home because the business she has now is home delivery.

Choluteca, Honduras – March, 2012

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Ever Orlando Alonzo

texts.es:
El Joven Ever, tiene 27 años de edad, soltero y reside desde hace más de 4 años en la ciudad de Danlí, él se dedica a la venta y reparación de relojes de diferentes marcas, estilos y colores, su negocio lo ha nombrado como relojería Cristal. 
Ever el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de 75 relojes para dama, 70 relojes de varón de diferentes marcas, colores y estilos y 100 relojes de moda actuales, Con el préstamo de PRISMA podrá abastecer más su negocio lo que incrementara más sus ventas y atraerá mas clientela por el surtido que tendrá mejorando así sus utilidades.
Ever tiene planes a futuro de casarse y formar su familia, pero su sueño inmediato es comprarse un vehiculo para comercializar su mercadería. 


Danlí, el paraíso, Honduras - Marzo de 2012
texts.en:
Ever is 27 years old, single, and has lived in the city of Danlí for the past 4 years. He sells and repairs different brands, styles, and colors of watches and has named his business Cristal Watches. Ever will use this loan to purchase 75 women's watches and 70 men's watches of various brands, colors, and styles, and 100 fashion watches. 

With the loan from PRISMA, he will be able to stock more merchandise, which will increase his sales and attract more customers. The selection will allow him to improve his profits. In the future, Ever plans to marry and start a family, but his immediate dream is to buy a vehicle to market his merchandise.

Danlí, paradise, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to buy women's and men's watches for his business.

loans.name: Book Khoole 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "BOOK KHOOLE 1" qui signifie "coeurs unis" est constituée de cinq femmes toutes mariées.Depuis trois ans, elles exercent dans le commerce de vêtements pour femmes et enfants, de chaussures et de produits cosmétiques.Avec les revenus tirés de ce commerce, elles prennnent en charge leurs propres besoins et parviennent aussi à soutenir leurs maris dans les dépenses d'entretien de leurs familles respectives.Afin de renforcer leurs fonds de commerce, les femmes sollicitent un pret de 500000f pour acheter des vêtements, des chaussures et des produits cosmétiques.Le groupe ambitionne d'élargir ses activités.
texts.en: The Book Khoole 1 group (the name of the group means « United Hearts ») is composed of five married women. For three years, they have been selling women’s and children’s clothing, shoes, and cosmetic products. With the revenues derived from their business, they provide for their personal needs and also manage to help their respective husbands with household expenses. In order to bolster their work capital, the group members are seeking a loan of 500,000 West African francs to buy women’s and children’s clothing, shoes, and cosmetic products. The group’s goal is to expand  its business activities.

loans.use: to buy women’s and children’s clothing, shoes, and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice lives in Yambio, South Sudan. She sells food in a food stall, and has been in business for five years. She is 20 years old and married with no children.

Loice heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds (SDG) to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for resale.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
Feliciano, de 50 años de edad; es un hombre soltero; vive en su propia casa donde habita solo junto a su negocio.  Feliciano, es un hombre de provecho; su labor principal es la venta de diferentes mercaderías como: ferretería, agroquímicos, venta de materiales de escritorio, productos de abarrotes, etc.  Esta labor lleva realizando hace 19 años y comenta que le ha ido muy bien ya que en su localidad es el único con este negocio. Por el momento, cuenta con un ayudante que le apoya, mientras Feliciano,  sale de viaje para realizar sus compras que ofrece a sus clientes. Lo que mas le gusta de este trabajo es que gracias a ello puede tener un solvento económico para sí mismo.
Con el préstamo solicitado de MFP, viajará a la ciudad de Lima para poder comprar útiles escolares de diversas variedades para esta campaña escolar; ya que sus clientes necesitan para sus hijos. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP, se siente contento por recibir este apoyo económico ya que de esa forma continuará con sus planes de trabajo; asimismo, se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago ya que desea acceder a otro. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles mas el capital de sus ganancias, se abastecerá de materiales de educación como: cuadernos, lapiceros, entre  otros.
texts.en:
Feliciano, 50, is single.  He lives in his own house by himself alongside his business.  Feliciano is a go-getter; his main occupation is selling various merchandise like hardware, agrochemicals, office supplies, groceries, etc.   

He’s been in this line of work for 19 years and comments that he’s done very well because he’s the only one in this business in his location.  For the moment, he has an assistant that helps him while Feliciano goes on buying trips to buy what he needs to offer his customers.  What he likes best about his work is being able to have economic solvency for himself.

With the loan requested from MFP he will travel to the city of Lima to buy assorted school supplies for the next school term because his customers need them for their children.  

This will be loan #1 with MFP.  He feels happy to receive this economic support because he will be able to continue with his work plans this way.  Also, he commits to be punctual with his payments because he’d like to access another loan.

He will use the 3000 new soles plus capital from profits to stock up on school supplies like notebooks and pencils, among others.

loans.use: to buy school supplies like notebooks and pencils.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es: Alberta, es una mujer muy activa y empeñosa; tiene 35 años de edad; vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Juan de 36 años y sus 03 hijos a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Alberta se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como: arroz, conservas, bebidas, golosinas, verdura, etc. Su tienda esta ubicada en su propia casa; esta actividad viene realizando hace 11 años; a veces lo hace con la ayuda de su esposo y a veces recibe el apoyo de sus hijos. Lo que más le gusta de trabajo es poder estar tranquila al pendiente de su familia  y lo más difícil es cuando sube los precios de los productos. Pero aun así para ella este trabajo le es muy fácil de realizar  porque es lo que mas sabe hacer. Ahora después de meses  que llego a vender casi toda la mercadería pues se preocupa por aumentar más víveres; es por ello que acude a las oficinas de MFP para que le apoyen con préstamo y de esa manera logre cumplir con sus objetivos. Sus planes a futuro es que sus hijos sean profesionales y tengan un buen futuro. Este será su crédito número 03 con MFP; y agradece el apoyo porque gracias a ello puede cumplir con sus planes de trabajo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participe y sobre todo responsable. Con los 2.000 nuevos soles podrá abastecerse de mercadería para su negocio y de esa forma no poder faltarle nada en las compras de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alberta, 35, is an active, enterprising woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Juan, 36, and their three children who she wants to provide a better quality of life for.  

Alberta sells groceries like rice, canned goods, soft-drinks, snacks, vegetables, etc.  Her store is located in her house.  She’s been in this line of work for 11 years.  Sometimes her husband helps her and sometimes her children do.  What she most likes about the work is being able to be at peace watching over her family.  What’s most difficult is when the price of her products rises.  Even so, this work is easy for her to do because it’s what she knows how to do best.  

Now, after having sold out most of her merchandise these months she’s concerned about increasing her stock again and this is why she comes by MFP’s offices to seek support from a loan in order to reach her objectives.  Her plans for the future are that her children become professionals and that they have good futures.
